englishTitle: Altenglische Legenden: Kindheit Jesu. Geburt Jesu.Barlaam und Josaphat. St. Patrik's Fegefeuer.

text.0:
I. Kindheit Jesu aus Ms. Laud 108. Jci comence le enfaunce ihu crist. JN þe honuraunce of swete Jhu , þat is louerd ful of vertu, Ane partie ichulle eou rede Of is lijf and of is child hede; Nou ich eou bidde at þe biguynninge þat &yogh;e herknen to þis talkinge, &yogh;if &yogh;e it wulleth under stonde: Hov Jhc liuede in þisse londe, Ane partie &yogh;e mouwen i here; Herkniez þanne alle i fere. &yogh;wane ihu crist was i bore, To saui þis world þat was for lore, In one Crachche he was i leid Bi fore Oxe and Asse; sothþ it is seid: Wel huy wusten in heore mod þat it was Jhu verrei god, And þat he was into eorþe i send To bringue us out of turment. And sethþe i circumcised was he, Ase þe lawe was in þat contre. To þe temple þanne he was i sent, He was welcome verreiement Of symeon þat Man old, þat muche of him bi fore hadde i told. þer after þre kinges of vncouþe londe To þat child brou&yogh;ten heore sonde. Inou&yogh;h &yogh;e habbez þarof i heord telle: Ne kepe ich more of heom spelle. Bote þo Heroude þat wicke king Hadde i heord þat tiþing þat þis kingues of onekuþe contreie Werent i wend hom bi an oþer wei&yogh;e, Him þou&yogh;hte is herte wolde to breke, Bote &yogh;if þat he were a wreke. For Jesus loue he let sle Alle þe children of þat contre Of two &yogh;er elde and of more; He was Man of wicke lore. He þat made þis world of nou&yogh;t Swiþe wel wuste is wicke þou&yogh;t; Nolde he nou&yogh;t þat þe maistrie Hedde heroude with his enuie. Almi&yogh;hti king is Aungel hende To Marie he gan sende And to Josep hire housebonde, And bad heom wende into egypte londe And þare bi leue for to eft sone þat oþur tyþingues to heom come. þo Marie and Josep hadden i heorde þis sonde, Ne dwelden huy nou&yogh;t after ful longue, Huy token with heom þat neod was, Ase to heom bi feol in þat cas, Huy duden heom bliue in þe weie, As þe Aungel heom gan sei&yogh;e. Ne hadden huy nou&yogh;t ful longue i fare, þat huy ne sei&yogh;en wondres þare: þe Bestes Mankene and eke wilde Comen out of wodes and of felde; þe Dragouns out of þe Montaygne Comen ful Manie bi on and tweine To herien him þat þare was lad, Him to seon huy weren ful glad; þe liouns kene and eke grete þat swete child huy gonnen mete, þe wolfues þat weren ramage To þat child of so &yogh;oung age Fullen on knes and to him bouwe And in heore manere on him lowe. þe Dragouns of grete fli&yogh;hte To þat child ful of mi&yogh;hte Ali&yogh;hten heom lowe to þe grounde And bi leften a wel gret stounde, Him forto honoure þat hem wrou&yogh;hte. Marie was in wel grete þou&yogh;te; Heo was a gast and in feringue, For it was so muche a&yogh;ein kuynde þat þe wolf wilde and rauisaunt With þe schep &yogh;eode so milde so lomb, And ne made to heom no semblaunt To don heom harm taunt ne quaunt. Ms. quaunt mit danebengeschriebenem kaunt von ders. Hand. Swiþe wel ech it onder stod þat it was sothþ þat seide þe bok, þat ysaie to folke seide, þo he þe prophecie gan schewe and rede; He seide wel with heorte mild: þat, &yogh;wane Marie bere a child, þe wolf with þe schep scholde ete e in ete scheint ausradirt . With outen harm with oute hete. Here ore leuedi a li&yogh;hte of þe Asse, and Josep hire halp a doun, & made hire sitte onder a treo for hete þat bar apples and oþer fruyt. Þene þridde dai verreiment þat huy weren out i went Of þat corsede lond þat heroudes hadde in is hond, þe sonne wax hot and snov&yogh;h bri&yogh;ht, Ase it was þoru&yogh;h godes mi&yogh;ht; And Marie þat swete Maide clepede Josep and to him sayde: Sire Josep, wite þou for sothþ þat þis hete gret dere me dothþ, þere fore me þinchethþ it is þe beste vnder þis trco þat ich me reste. Dame, he seide, at þi wille it beo! Josep hire ladde to þat treo And of þat best þat heo sat on Softeliche haf hire a doun And bad hire sitte and reste þere, Forte þe hete i passede were. Here þat treo beu&yogh; a doun þoru&yogh; þe voiz of Jhu , and Marie eat of þat fruyt, þat heo muche desiredc. and heo &yogh;af Josepe þar of ase muche ase he wolde. VNder þat treo hire reste Marie Wuch heo bi heold with hire ei&yogh;e; Gret wille heo hadde to habbe þar Of þat fruyt þat it bar. Wel heo schewede in hire willing þat heo þer to hadde liking, And seide to Josep with lei&yogh;hinde wille: Jcholde ich hadde here of mi fulle. Jhc þat wuste heore þou&yogh;t i liche To þat treo spak mildeliche And seide: ich þe hote, treo, To mi Moder a bouwe þou þe! With gret plente nouþe &yogh;if hire Of þat fruit þat þou dest bere! To þat voiz with gret de duyt þat treo a beu&yogh; þat bar þat fruyt. Marie inou&yogh;h þar of et, And al so dude Josep ek. þo huy weren wel i fuld Of þat fruyt erore wild, þarof huy maden ful gret blisse And þonkeden Jhm for is godnesse. Muche loued is Moder Jesu, For he dude for hire muche vertu, And heo louedde him, and þat was ri&yogh;th, For him heo was boþe fair and briht. Here comaunde Jhu þat treo stonde upri&yogh;ht, þo is moder hadde inou&yogh; i&yogh;ete. JEsu Crist þat blessede child, þat to is Moder was so mild, Blessede þat treo with is honde And het it upri&yogh;ht forto stonde. With oute ani more lette þat treo ful sone upri&yogh;ht him sette And stod also ase hit dude er. þis merueile he dude þer. Gret Joye þanne ore lauedi hadde Of hire sone þat heo ladde, Of þe dedes þat he wrou&yogh;te, Ful gret wonder þar of heom þou&yogh;te. Here comaundede Jhus þat treo þat wellene sprounguen out is Rotene, and it bi feol þat Marie and Josep þerof dronken. þat wellene im Ms. doppelt. ÞO seide Joseph þat olde Man: Marie, mi leof, mi swete lefman, þurst me takez and water me failez, Ne can ime nou&yogh;t þar of conseile. þanne answerede ore leuedi And seide: sore a þurst am J, And also þe Asse þat stondez here So is a þurst on hire manere. Jhc þat child, þat was þo so &yogh;ing, Swiþe i heorde here pleyning. Heorkniez hou seide þat swete wi&yogh;ht To þat treo þat stod upri&yogh;ht: Treo, ich þe comaunde and hote þat þare springe out of þine Rote Welle stremes faire and clere For mi Moder and for hire fere, For ich ire louie and habbe deore; Do nou, treo, ase ich þe lere, And &yogh;uyt ich þe comaundi, treo, þat þou heonne forthþe ward beo Fruyt berinde in paradis Jn Min orchard with oute mis, And multepliinde þat þou beo Of racines þat comieth of þe, þat wellene springuen out of þi rote With watur cler guod and swote. &yogh;wane Jhu crist ful of guodnesse Hadde i seid wordes þusse, Wellene clere in luyte stounde Out of þe Rotene þare beoth i sprounge. þo dronk Marie al hire fulle Swiþe williche of þat welle, And Josep also þat i wilned it hadde In his þou&yogh;t he was ful glad, And Josep maude al so gret feste, More him likede þat ilke giste þane ani flechs i sode oþur i rost. Jhm he þonkede alre most Of al þat he heom dude er and þo. Muche louede ore lauedi hire sone þo. Here cam an Aungel and tok þreo braunches of þat treo and sette heom in paradis, and alle þulke þat þare bi side stoden weren ase huy weren dede for þe grete bri&yogh;htnesse þat huy i sei&yogh;en, and ihc confortede heom with is wordes. TO þis treo &yogh;eot eft sone Spak Jhc godes sone: Of þe braunches þat þou berst i wis Schullen beon set in paradys. An Aungel wel sone cam And of þe braunches þare he nam, In paradys huy weren sette, As Jhu crist it hauede i hote. Ake &yogh;wenne þe Aungel was i sei&yogh;e Of þe folk of þat contreie, Ech on is side was in fcre And in gret doute þei were; Li&yogh;htnesse þare was so muche i sei&yogh;e þat al þat treo þar mide was wri&yogh;e Boþe bi hinde and bi fore, þat no man mi&yogh;hte no forþore Of heom þat se þis vertues, þat wol statt þer verschrieben . Ake fullen a doun ase dede cwes, Ne seien huy neuere swuch bri&yogh;htnesse. Muche huy þonkeden Jhc of blisse. þanne spac Jhc to hem: &yogh;wi were &yogh;e so dredfule men? Ful wel i wite &yogh;e it schulle, þat mine hestes worþeth ri&yogh;t folfullde. Here &yogh;eode Jhc into one temple of giwes and for dude heore Maumates, and alle huy fullen bi heom sulf, and þe feon|des þat with inne heom weren wenden out, &yogh;wuche heroudes þe king honourede with þe giwes. ÞO spac Josep to Jhu Die Initiale ist hier fälschlich V statt þ. þat was ful of vertu: Grete hete habbe we, þat we fur brennethþ, so þinchez me, And &yogh;if it is þi swete wille, Go we ner þe weie stille, For it is caldore ner þe se, Ore sped schal þe more beo. Jhc answerede with milde herte: Ore wei schal nouþe sone schorte &yogh;e bi þritti guode Jorneies; It schal be soth þat ich eou sei&yogh;e. þo Jhc hadde þis wordes i seid oute, Josep loke him a boute: þe Montaynes þat weren hei&yogh;e Of Egypte he sai&yogh;h with is ei&yogh;e, þat huy heom hadden i passed sone and wel þoru&yogh; Jhu Marie sone echdel. Bote gret wonder þarof huy hadde, Hou huy so muche hadde i spedde. In þulke londe him þou&yogh;te he sai&yogh;h Wickede men of false lai&yogh;h, þat to þe fende weren i take And heore beden to him make, Ase þe prophecie seith, ich onder stonde: Nei&yogh;h þreo hondret þare weren i founde Of false ymages i maked with honde, In here temples forto stonde. þudere comen al þat folk, Boþe þe lewede and eke clerk, For to herien þane feond þat hadde i bounde heom with is bend; And heroudes þe king was þere Heriende heom ase huy godes weren. Jhu crist marie sone Bi þat Maumerie gan come þat was i maud al of tricherie; þar of he felde a gret partie; Atþe temple Jhc eode Jn And lokede al a boute him, Hov þare alle þulke Men To þe false godes honoureden heom. Bote þo Jhc in i come was, þare was soruwe and alas: Al þat synagogerie It ful a doun, þat folk gan crie, Alle heore godus up and doun þat huy honoureden fullen a non, þe false ymages bi gunne to breke þat þe feondes weren inne i steke. Here cam heroudes þe king of egypte lond and criede ore louerd merci and bad for &yogh;iuenesse of is wicke dedes, and Jhc it him grauntede and to his folke, and þer to is beneiscoun. HEroudes, þo he hadde þis iherd, In his heorte he was a ferd, For is godes he was sori And for is folk also witterli. Ake sethþe þo he wel vnder stod þat swete Jhu milde of mod Was mi&yogh;hti king and poustifs And destruyde is enemis, Of &yogh;wam þe prophetes tolden with toungue Ms. pphetes ohne Zeichen der Abkürzung . And in write of him soungue þe dedes þat ihus þare wrou&yogh;hte, Hit was wilninde in is þou&yogh;te: Pharaon þat was Aumperour Of egypte with muche honour, He nolde i leue for none lore þat Jhc on eorþe wolde beo bore, Ne he nolde merci crie For nou&yogh;t þat he sai&yogh;h with ei&yogh;e; Bote pruyte he hauntede euere faste; In þe se he Dreinte atþe laste And to helle wende he, þare he schal euere be. Heroudes was ai in doute, And so is come with grete route To Jhu þat childe so swete, Hise sunnes forto bete. Jhesus of him hadde reuþe And wuste his þou&yogh;t and is treuþe, His misdedes he for &yogh;af him sone And alle þei þat with him come. Jesus is ful of for &yogh;iuenesse, So ful of loue and of blisse, þat he fur &yogh;iuez is wrathþing To heom þat mis doth ani þing, And huy wollen with hore talent Comen to amendement. þanne it is guod boþe loude and stille For to don al his wille, For þat he wole is Joye him &yogh;iue þat serueth him þe &yogh;wuyle he liueth; þanne it is guod and sikernesse For to wurche to habbe blisse. Here compasede ihc þe seue lawes and dude watur þare with inne. Ake a feolun giw him lette with is staf and fur|dude is lawes, and þare fore he deide a non ri&yogh;ht þere. ÞIs was þe fifte &yogh;er þat ihc was i bore on eorþe her: With oþur children of þe cite Him for to plei&yogh;e þanne eode he. þe children maden gret solas As þei &yogh;eoden in heore pas. Huy wenden forth to þe Riuer, þare huy founden þat watur cler. Bote Jhu fol of pouste Made þat watur drawe a&yogh;e; þanne Jhu ful of mi&yogh;hte and grace Cumpassede a druye place, Watur þare with inne he brou&yogh;te, His lawes maken þare inne he þou&yogh;te. Bote a giw of heorte wrac Alle hise lawes þare he to brac. Jhc him seide with hastiue wille: A þou feondes sone of helle, Ms. sone doppelt. &yogh;wi hast þou to broke mi lay? þou schalt dei&yogh;e nou to day. þo Jhc hadde þis word i seid, þe giv to grounde ful doun ded; þis oþure nadden of him no plawe; Ech wende fram oþur in a þrowe And tolden heore faderes þis ilke cas þat þoru ihu heore fere ded was. Here cam Marie to hire sone and tolde him hov þe giwes þretneden Josep for þe childe þat was ded, þat with him and with oþure pleide, and Jhc touchede hine sethþe mid is fot. TO heore faderes lasse and more þis children come with grete fare And seiden þus with wicke sawe þat Jhc hadde a child a slawe. þeos giwes with heorte feint To Josepe eoden to maken pleint, And seiden wel with wicke breth þat he was retet of þat deth. Ms. deutlich recet; jedenfalls ist dafür retet zu lesen . With wordes bolde and eke kete Josep þo huy gunne þrete. þo was Josep in gret mourning For þe giwene þretning. Al þis seide Josep to Marie And: J ne dar Jhm nou&yogh;t blamie. þo Marie wuste of þis dede, Hire sone heo wolde bidde and rede þat he wolde for hire loue Don so non more and lete þe wone. þo spac Jhu to is moder dere: Ich þe louie in eche manere; Ich gan make here in mi lawe A luytel watur a&yogh;ein with drawe, þanne comethþ þes giv felonet And is staf with inne hath set, Al þat i bigan to make With is staf he gan it breke; þare fore, dame, ich reherce þis þat þou it wite he dude amis, þere fore þis feolun is here ded; Ake lif him tit þoru&yogh; þi red; Moder, for þi loue here Fram deþe to liue ichulle him a rere; I nelle nou&yogh;t þat þou habbe maugre In none stude, Moder, for me. Jhc þat child milde of mod Touche þene dede with is fot, And he a ros anon with þat, Bote no merci he ne bad. Here made Jhc twelf fliene of clei&yogh; with inne þe lawes and het heom fleon a mong hem alle. Sethþe is Jhc i wend a &yogh;e To is lawes, ase i sei&yogh;e þe, And of þe clei&yogh; þat he fond He schop twelf fliene in þat lond. þis dude he on a satur day. þe giwes come and þat i sai&yogh;h, On cam þere with gret espleit, Ake sone he was a freid, þo he wuste is dede, Ful smartliche a&yogh;ein he eode And orn to Josep with oute let And made to him plainte gret And opbraid him of is sone And seide he hadde vuele wone, Muche him blamede, and þat wel ofte, For þat he in ontyme wrou&yogh;hte; Ore lawes he al to rent And bi sabat ore folk schent. Josep to Jhu eode in þe stude And axede him &yogh;wi bi sabat he so dude. Jhc to gadere is hondene smot And lou&yogh;h so þat it dude him guod And seide: fliene, forth fleo &yogh;e, &yogh;wodere þat owere wille it beo! þo flouwen forth þulke fli&yogh;en Bi fore him and oþur men. Some þat sei&yogh;en þat merueile þonkeden Jhc with guode wille. Here cam a wickede giv and smot Jhm vnder þe ere bi fore þe princes, and þe giv ful a doun to grounde, and þe princes wrathþeden heom to ward Jhm and Josep. SOne þare comen oþure alse Ms. ursprünglich also; o ist in e verbessert . bi fore þe princes fikele and false And seiden anon with heore sawes þat Jhc despisede heore lawes. Jhc a midde þe place stod, And þare cam on of heorte wod, On of þe princes hine bi &yogh;at, And Jhm ful euele he smot; Bote Jhc him stod ful stille, þat ilke stroc him likede ille; Nou&yogh;ht for þan with oute lesing Of him he tok gret wreching: Im Ms. ist nicht zu unterscheiden, ob wreching oder wrething zu lesen . He feol a doun ded þare a non Bi fore heom alle euerchon. þare fore was Josep in grete fering, For huy him eoden alle þretning. Here a giv lep up to Jhues scholdren and smot Jhm vuele, and Jhc him wrathþede and þe giv ful a doun ded to grounde a non. JOscp for doute of þe men Ladde Jhm with him hom, For euerechone þulke giwes Hateden muche swete Jesus. Anoþur giv is aftur i rounne, Bi fore alle oþure he was þanne, Opon Jhues scholdren he lep up þere And smot him vuele onder þe ere. Jhesus with oute more to telle cleopede him þe feondes sone of helle, And seide: henne ne gost þou hol ne fier, Here þe worth encombrer. He ful a doun ded for is gult, Ne hadde he noþur dunt ne pult. Here cometh þe giwes to Josep and makez gret plainte of Jhu for he hadde a child a slawe; ake sethþe Jhc hine a rerde. Aftur al þisilke sake gret noise huy guonne make, þe giwes into al þe londe, And seiden man dude hem gret schonde. Ms. anscheinend hom, aus ham verbessert; es ist aber wol hem zu lesen. Alle þeos giwes lowe and proute Of Jhc Messie huy hadden doute And to Marie heom playnieth þore, Boþe þe lasse and eke þe more, And hotez and biddez wel Marie þat heo schulle hire sone chastie. Marie and Josep to Jhm sede And ful ofte siþes him bede Bi fore þe princes þat þer were, With faire wordes huy guonne him lere. þo speken þis maistres gret: Josep, þou art mis bi hed; Tac us to lere þinne sone, And he schal lete is vuele wone; His Maister schal beo Zacharie, þat him schal techen of clergie; Al ore lawe he hauez ouer herd, Ms. ore doppelt. Of him he may beo wel i lered. Josep bad Jhm ful &yogh;eorne þat he scholde of heom leorne, Ake ase ich wene he nolde go Anne fot with heom þo. þanne spac on a rebous: Josep, þi sone is Merueilous; He hauez don us more lore þane euere us dude ani bi fore: A giv he haueth a slawe i wis þat was i holde of gret pris; To his freont make þi gre, Oþur þou worst i flem of þis contre; For &yogh;if &yogh;e duellez here ou&yogh;t longer, Ms. long' d. i. longer. He wole don us muche wrong. Ake &yogh;if he wolde drawe him þare fro, It were guod to bidde him so. Josep preide Marie suete þat Jhc wolde is noise lete, And Marie a non hire sone bad. Moder, he seide, ich am glad þine hestes forto do. Jhc to þe dede giv gan go, þane giv hente bi þenere, Fram deth to liue he gan him a rere. Aris up, he seide, þou cheitif! þe giv a ros and hadde lif. Jhc fram him stilleliche eode. þat folk hadde wounder of þat dede. Josep was glad in þis cas þat þis giv a liue was, For he was i þretned ofte Of þat folk þat luyte of him rou&yogh;hte. So was marie þat Maide mild And Jhc hire swete child. Here was Jhc i lad to scole and ouercam alle þe maistres with puyr clergie; so þat euerech heold him sulf amad, for he schewede heom wel þat huy weren out of ri&yogh;hte Muinde. A Gret Maister Zacharie, þat muche couþe of þat clergie, To Josepe hadde gret enuie And him seide: þou dest folie þat þou nelt lere þine sone in londe And lettre don him vnder stonde. Men him scholden take &yogh;eorne And hine an hongue oþur fur berne. Josep seide: i þe bi seche, Tak hine to þe and þou him teche. Nou spekth Jhūs wordes clere And answerez Zacharie þe grete maistere: With wrong, maister, þou seist me blame, And þar of ich habbe schame. Jhc ne bi lefte nou&yogh;t to longe þat he ne gan with wordes strongue þene Maister streite a posi, And þar to was he ful hardi; Wel sone he axede him, in is boke &yogh;wat it was þat he gan loke. þou lokest, maister, in þi lai, Wel ofte ich it i seo and feor ich sai; And so ne canst þou me nou&yogh;t telle, &yogh;wat ich þenke ne &yogh;wat ich wille? þou wenest of lore þou habbe mest Of alle men, and hauest lest, Of alle þe lawes þou hauest þat los And honoured ase a god of þeos and þos: art fehlt . Canst þou telle &yogh;wanne þou were i bore? Nai ich wene þou hauest i lore; To blame Josep &yogh;wi artþou glad, þat me haueth hidere to þe i lad? Vnder stond ane &yogh;wile hit: Canst þou telle &yogh;wat seith þet writ? A god schal i bore beo þat al schal warde and al ise; He is nou i bore, for soþe i sei&yogh;e, And fale siþe þou hast him i sei&yogh;e. On of þe Maistres sethþe forth eode And to Josep tolde and seide Of Jhm þat he prechede a non To þe Maistres euerech on þoru þe force of clergie, And more schewede with maistrie, And sethþe ech one with oute envie To him merci gunne crie. His wit, he seide, is of swuch doingue, þat noman ne mi&yogh;hte make delayingue Of þing þat he wolde don, For his pier nis in londe non, þat schewe couþe þoru&yogh;h ani vertu þat to us seide þare Jesu; For he purueide with is mi&yogh;hte þat tuyrne schal to grete ri&yogh;hte; He is god, i sei&yogh;e for þi; For þat is nou icome þat &yogh;wilene seide daui In þe saume þat men callez flumcn dei, þat muche spak of him sikerli; So is nouþe wel i schewed And bi him sulue wel i preoued; Josep, i seie þe þis þing With outen ani kunne lesing. þo was Josep bliþe and glad Of þat þe oþur him hadde i seid. þe Maister fram Josep wende þo, And Josep hamward gan to go. Here was a riche Man ded þat hei&yogh;hte Josep; and þo seide Jhu to Josepe is fader þat he eode forto arere þane riche Man, for he bar is name. XLIV; originally read: fehlt hit vor hiet, oder þat im Anfange .] So þat Men wenden to seche Fisicieins and eke leches, For þare was sik a riche man, His name ich eov telle can, þat was wel i norisched And swiþe softeliche i fed; He was i cleoped Josep bi name, And Man he was of grete fame, Of alle he hadde loue and red; Ake in þat tyme he was ded. þare ase þilke Josep ded was, Gret deol men Mauden and seiden alas, And for is guodnesse and his vertu, For ech guod man him wel i knev. He þonkede Josep with al is mi&yogh;hte And him gan axi anon ri&yogh;te: &yogh;wat is þilke Jhus þe wise þat hath imad me fram deþe a rise, Ase we mouwen alle i seo? Seie me sothþ, i prei&yogh;e þe! Josep Answerede with oute delai: Jesus is a god verray. — Wel ich it i leue and þat is þou&yogh;ht Min, þare fore ichulle bi leue on him. Gret Joye þare is and muche blisse With Josepe and his sibnesse, Huy habbez Jhm þe more i loued And þoru&yogh;h out al þe more honoured. Here eode Josep Jacobes sone into one lei&yogh;htone after wuyrtene; þare cam an Addre and envenimede þat child in þe honde; And þat child for grete anguische bi gan to crie, and ase he was ham ward, he mette Jhm , and he dude him guode vengaunce. INto Bedleem huy beoth i come Josep and Marie with heore sone. Of heore kunrade founden huy þare, And for heom huy beth in þe lasse care, þat heom habbez faire vnder fongue, þo huy heom weren i come a mongue. Jacob is Josep hiet calle And bad him go swiþe with alle A non ri&yogh;ht doun into þe lei&yogh;htone, For to bringuen heom wuyrtone. þis Josep was of þe sibnesse Of Jhu criste with oute misse. He wende forht wel hasteli þe wuyrtene forto gaderi. In þat lei&yogh;htone, þare he was, þare cam An Naddre out þe gras And him envenimede in þe honde. þis child gredinde hamward gan &yogh;ongue. He haueth Jesum wel sone i met, þat axede him sone with outen let: &yogh;wi he made so gret cri; And he answerede him ful hastifli And seide: he was i hurt in is hond With an Naddre þat him stong. Bliue a&yogh;en þo seide Jesu: To þe Naddre torne we nov! þou schalt beon a wreke, are we gon, So þat harm ne tit þe non. Echone weren þarof bliþe And þonkede Jhm fale siþe. Here cam Jhc and Josep and Marie to one feste, and heore kun maude gret Joye with heom. TO one feste forht huy eoden, þare huy founden of heore kunrede And oþure mo with outen mis, þat hadden of heom ful gret blis. IN þe contre of Nazareth So was þere a gret a semble Of folk of þat ilke cite, For þudere i bede weren heo: þare was i wedded a wumman Of þat Cite to a guod man. 0.1: Of Joie & blisse is al my song, : kare to bileue, & to herie him among : þ t al our sorwe schal reue. Icome he is þe suete dew, : to wan is al our hope, Jhu kyng of alle kynges, : þe swete hony drope; Bicome he is oure broþer; : war was he so longe? He it is & non oþer, : þ t bo&yogh;te ous so stronge. Oure broþer we mowe him clupie wel, : so seiþ he him sulf ilome. So ne mi&yogh;te hi neuer adel : þ t bifore ous come. He nas oure broþer no&yogh;t, : ar he oure flesch nome, þer myde he haþ ous dere abo&yogh;t : to make ous isome. Isome we nere bifore, : angelis & oure kunde, Ar swete ihc were ibore, : þ t to selde is in munde. Ac nou he haþ oure kunde Inome, : & oure broþer is; Oure kunde is wel heie i come : among oþer iwis. Vor he is al oure kunde hext : saue is godhede, & aboute is trone is next, : so noble is manhede! Nach trone fehlt man. Here mone was deol to ihure, : ne gamede hem no gle; Ac he ne mened hem no&yogh;t : a&yogh;en oþer bifore, hem st. him. Vor he nas no&yogh;t to deþe ibro&yogh;t, : ar god were ibore; Ac he lyuede, vorte he him isei : & in armes nom, Ms. iseie u. inome mit unterpungirtem e. þo he acandelmasse dai : to þe temple com. Louerd, wel may ous beo : bet, þen hem mi&yogh;te þo, þ t mi&yogh;te nowar fleo : ac to helle scholde go. þer oure lord sede, : þo he was ibore, þer st. þerfore. þ t we mi&yogh;te beo wel glad : ouer oþer þ t were bifore. þe prophetes wilnede uorte se : & mony kynges also, þ t we iseeþ, &yogh;if it mi&yogh;te be, : ac hi ne mi&yogh;te no&yogh;t do; We mowe nou as it were : for no&yogh;t to heuene come, Seþþe our lord ous haþ ibo&yogh;t : & þe deueles power bynome; Ac hi þ t such grace nadde, : þ t to fore ous come, After oure lord hi gradde : In prophecie ilome; After him hi gradde : wiþ grete wille & longe, No mendement hi ne seie : bote þe pine stronge. So longe þ t hi weri were : & lete al beo stille, & here aredinge forbere : & turnde to godes wille, aredinge, st. gredinge verschrieben? Vor hi ne seie non oþer won : as ose seieþ uor sore,
0.2: Vche of hem to reste drou&yogh; : & ne speke of him nammore: þ t swete bern our kunde : boþe of flesch & felle. Nach kunde fehlt wol nam. Of þe kunde of wan we come : somwat i c mot telle. we come fälschlich st. he com. A good mon þ t me clupede isacar : was bi olde dawe In bedlehem, þ t do&yogh;tren hadde two : In þe olde lawe: þ t on was s. anne, : þ t ber our leuedi marie, þ t oþer elizabethes moder, : þ t het Ismarie; Elisabhet bar of hire : s. Jon þe baptist, & marie, anne do&yogh;ter, : bar our lord ihū crist. A good mon þer was In galilee, : me clepede ioachym, Scephurde he was & holi mon, : gode grace was wiþ him. gode st. godes. þo he was of twenti &yogh;er, : s. anne he nom to wyue. þer nas couple In ierlm : of so clene lyue. Boþe hi doutede oure lord, : hi delde here good aþre Vche &yogh;er, al þ t hi hadde, : þ t ech man mi&yogh;te ise: þ t o del hi &yogh;eue to þe temple, : to hem þ t seruede þer Inne, As we &yogh;eueþ oure teþinge : of þ t we mowe awynne; þ t oþer del hi &yogh;eue to pouere men : & weiueringe also; Hem silue hi lyuede bi þe þridde : godes seruise to do. þer nere none men In ierlm : þ t so muche good hadde, As ioachim & his wif, : vor triwenesse þ t hi ladde. Vor hose doþ wel his teþinge : nouþe & eke þo, His good wole þe betere wexe : nouþe & euer mo. Joachim & anne is wif : to gadere hor lif ladde In clene spoushod twenti &yogh;er, : & no child hi nadde. Aschamed þer of hi were sore, : for hem þo&yogh;te þ t hi were Vor &yogh;ete of god to fore alle oþer, : vor no child hi ne bere. Hi bihete god, &yogh;if þ t he wolde : eny child hem sende, To godes seruice oblege hi wolde : þ t child wiþþouten ende. Vche &yogh;er also ioachim : to þe temple wende þre siþe, to stable his biheste, : &yogh;if god him eny sende; Nach eny fehlt child. & offrede largeliche : of þing þ t he hadde, ffor schame & for sorynesse : þ t hi no child nadde. þo hi hadde twenti &yogh;er : hor lif ilad so, Joachim offrede to þe temple, : as he was iwoned to do. þe prest þ t þe temple wuste : pulte him abac anon & sede þ t he werþi nas : a mong godemen to gon, & oure lord him scewede wel, : wen he ne þolede no&yogh;t Nach & fehlt þat. þ t eny child as of oþer men : were of him ibro&yogh;t. Joachim was so sore of schamed : þ t he wende out anon, ffor schame among oþer men : In þe temple he nolde gon. Wiþ is scip he wende in to anoþer lond : wepinge wel sore. He ne þo&yogh;te to þe temple come : ne to anne is wif nammore. Wiþ scephurdes þer he was : In sorwe monþes fiue, He ne hurde no&yogh;t of is frendes : ne of anne is wyue. An angel com adoun to him : & bad him be wel bliþe, & sede our lord him wolde sende : þ t he wilnede ofte siþe, þ t anne scholde a do&yogh;ter bere : & of him be bi&yogh;ite, To blisse of al þe world, : as þe prophetes hadde iwrite. In toknynge he bad him go hom, : &yogh;if he ileue nolde, At þe guldene &yogh;ate his wif : he mete scholde. Joachim ne leuede it no&yogh;t, : uor longe childles hi were, Ac hamward he wende naþeles, : he ne dorste elles for fere. Gret deol made his wif vor him, : no womman mi&yogh;te more. As heo was in morninge adai : wepinge wel sore & gan to wringe hire honde: : swete lord, heo sede, Eche þing þ u &yogh;euest Joie : & eche þing of blede, Me one þ u makes Joie les, : Ine seo non oþer so; Me wondreþ &yogh;if i c dorste segge : wi þ u þenchest so do, Ms. þencheste mit unterpungirtem e. Wen þ u children hast me bynome, : & me eke hast bynome Myn hosebonde þ t is my Joie, : Inot war he is bicome. þo com þus an angel to hire; : doute þe no&yogh;t! he sede, Icham þe angel þ t habbe ibore : bifore god þi godhede; A dou&yogh;ter þ u schalt her bere : al bi godes rede, Marie schal hire name beo, : þ t holi lif schal lede; Of hire schal wondri al þe world : & þoru hire isaued beo; þ t child þ u schalt bityme bere : & þ t soþe iseo; A&yogh;en þin hosebonde þ u go; : to voluelle þi bone, Ate guldene &yogh;ate þ u schalt him mete, : ne come þ u so sone. Anne ne leuede no&yogh;t þis, : ac naþeles uorþ heo wende Vorte Imete hire hosebonde, : as þe angel hire kende. Joachim & anne is wif : sone to gadere hem mette Ate guldene &yogh;ate wiþ grete Joie, : as þe angel hem sette. Hi clupte & custe wiþ Joie Inou; : þe bet hi leuede þo, Vor hope of þis holi child, : hamward hi gonne go. Anne seþþe wiþ childe was, : & seþþe wiþ ri&yogh;te kunde Bar þ t swete holi bern : þ t euer worþ In munde, Marie, þ t ous haþ isaued : þ t erore were ilore. þe ei&yogh;teþe dai of septembre : þ t swete child was ibore. In ierlm heo was ibore : In hire fader house iwis Biside þe &yogh;ate of iosaphat, : þ t nouþe an abbei is In honourance of s. anne : of blake nonnerie, In þe stude þer heo was bore : þe swete maide marie. Holi chirche nuste no&yogh;t : wuch dai heo was ibore, Ar nou late þoru myracle : þ t god dude þeruore. A good mon nou late eche &yogh;er : gret Joie in heuene isay ffram &yogh;ere to &yogh;ere In septembre, : as falleþ our leuedi day. Our lord he bad ententifliche : sum tokene him sende þere, Wi more Joie were In heuene þo : þen in oþer time were. Angeles sede þ t for our leuedi : ibore was þulke dai, þat for wol st. for þat. & of hire burtime was al þ t ioie : þ t he In heuene isai; & bad warny holi churche : & men on erþe also þ t hi made feste of þulke dai, : as he sei in heuene do. Hire burtime holi chirche : wuste In þisse manere. Telle we of hire lif, : þ t heo ladde anerþe here! Anon as heo was þre &yogh;er old, : as it vel in þe lawe, I offred heo was to þe temple, : as it vel bi olde dawe, þo heo bileuede hire moder breste : & ne sek namore. þo heo to þe temple com, : me mi&yogh;te ise godes ore: Vor þer were viftene de gres : bifore þe heie auter In þe honur of þe viftene saumes : þ t beþ In þe sauter; þis maide clamb ech after oþer, : vorte heo com vp an hei, As heo were of gret elde, : ne com nomon hire nei; Heo ne lokede after no moder, : þo heo vpard stei. Gret Joie hadde ech man : of hire þ t hit isei. Chastete heo bihet, : &yogh;if godes wille it were. Wiþ oþer maidens In þe temple : heo was iset to lere. So vair heo was & queynte : of witte & of dede, þ t ech mon of such &yogh;ong þing : wondrede & were in drede. Heo nas neuer iseie wroþ : ne enes li&yogh;ynge gon Ne no misword enes segge, : bote euer heo was In on. Heo sewede & span & waf : boþe wollone & lynne, Heo hadde lute erliche good, bote as heo mi&yogh;te wynne, Ms. erliche st. erþliche, wie häufig im Ms. Eche werkedai bi ri&yogh;te tyme : þen dai heo delde a þre: Eche day vorte vnderne : In bedes heo wolde beo, ffram vnderne to mydouernon : to werke heo wolde sitte, To spinne oþer to sewe, : heo was of gode witte; In hire beden heo wolde þenne beo : vorte eue wel softe. To hire angeles come al day : & confortede hire wel ofte. Wen heo hurde of sikemen, : sone to hem heo wende & confortede & helde hem : þoru grace þ t god hire sende. In hire childhod hit was : þ t i c &yogh;ou habbe itold. ffor ech godnesse myd hire was : boþe &yogh;ong & old. þo heo was fourtene &yogh;er old, : þe biscop of þe lawe Het ech maide of þulke elde : to hore contreie drawe, To take hosebondes as þe lawe was; : þe maidens were vawe Of þulke heste, bote marie : ne likede no&yogh;t þe sawe; þo heo wiþ oþer was ihote go : hosebonde to take, Heo sede : þ t þe lawe wole, : nele i c no&yogh;t vorsake; Mi fader & my moder made biheste, : ar i c were bi&yogh;ute, þ t i c scholde in godes seruise : my maidenhod wute; I c my sulf, þo i c was child, : bihet our lord al one To lede my lif in chastete : wiþþoute mannes mone; þerfore i c &yogh;ou segge to soþe : al myne wille: Nei man ne schal i c neuer come : my maidenhod to spille. þe biscop & þe oþer maistres, : þ t In þe temple were, Gret conseil nome of þis word : & were in gret fere, Vor þe lawe wolde þ t noman : a&yogh;en suche biheste scholde beo, & þe lawe wolde þ t no womman : vn spoused me scholde iseo. Gret conseil þer of hi nome : fram daie to dai in þe &yogh;ere In orisoun to bidde our lord, : som toknynge to sende hem þere. þo com a uois to hem & sede: : þencheþ in isaie! þ t maide ches hire spouse : þoru his prophecie. Nou sede isaye : þ t þer scholde springe A &yogh;erde of Jessees more : of dauid þe kynge, & aflour scholde springe : of þulke more also, & þer vppe ali&yogh;te þe holi gost : & come so þerto. Her þoru þis men wuste : hou hi scholde on take. Of dauies kunde he het eche man, : þ t was wiþþoute make & of elde to habbe wif, : þ t ech of hem bere A &yogh;erde to þe auter, : þ t non vorbore nere; & wuche &yogh;erde bigonne to blowe : & a coluere þer vppe ibro&yogh;t, þ t he tok maric to spouse, : þ t it nere bileued no&yogh;t. þe biscop was þo glad Inou&yogh;, : he let crie þere Al þ t were of dauies kunde : a&yogh;erde to þe auter bere. þo hi were to þe auter icome, : ech hadde a &yogh;erde an honde. þer was Josep an old mon, : þ t bihynde alle gan stonde. A&yogh;enes wille he þuder com, : he ne dorste elles vor fere; His &yogh;erde he hudde, þo oþer men : hore to þe auter bere. þer nas non þ t gan to blowe, : ac iosep hi vnder&yogh;ete þ t he hadde is &yogh;erde ihud; : hi gonne anon to þrete; Hi made him bere uorþ is &yogh;erd, : hit ne moste non oþer beo; þo he to þe auter com, : me mi&yogh;te miracle iseo: His &yogh;erde bigan to blowe anon, : þ t raþer was old & bar, Anoueward sat acoluere; : fair miracle was þar: Vpe þe &yogh;erde longe heo sat, : & seþþe þ t folc isei: Heo flei in to al þe temple : & seþþe in to heuene an hei. þer nas non þ t þis isei, : þ t sore adrad nas. Ac Joseph þe oldeman : swiþe sori was; þo me lokede him þe maide, : a schamed he was sore. Lokeþ, he sede, my feblesse : & habbeþ of me milce & ore! Nam i c old & cke feble? : my mi&yogh;te is me bynome; Heo is &yogh;ong & sunne it is : make ous to gadere come. Nym &yogh;eme, quaþ þe biscop, : þ t þ u þi sulf ne aspille, As dude datan & abiron, : vor hi were a&yogh;en godes wille. þo was Joseph sore adrad, : he ne dorste wiþsegge namore Vor drede of oure lordes heste; : he gan to sike sore. Inele no&yogh;t god misdo; : wenne it mot be so nede, Ichulle hire wedde, ac heo ne schal : for me hire maidenhod scede; Ichulle hire wite as hire wardeyn, : oþer ne mai i c no&yogh;t, þ t my sone hire wedde after me, : þ t hire kunde be uorþ ibro&yogh;t. Ms. kude st. kunde. Vor þe lawe was: wen man ne mi&yogh;te : bi&yogh;ute child bi is wyue, þ t is nexte kun scholde : hire wedde after is lyue, & ech after oþer, vorte sun child : of þe blode come; Ms. sun st. sum. Hoso non wonne, vnwerþi was, : as it verde ilome. Joseph wedde in þis entente : þis clene maide þere. wedde st. weddede. Ac for oþer þing our lord nolde : þ t heo iwedded nere: þ t is moder nere isclaundred : þ t heo vnwedded wiþ childe were, Ne þ t þe deuel it vnder&yogh;ete : þ t a maide child bere; Vor þer bi he wolde habbe iwust : þ t it were godes sone, Hinter sone ist von späterer Hand þere, hinter 271 sone zugefügt, offenbar um den irrthümlich ver|missten Reim zu ergänzen . & habbe destourbed in alle þing : of his passione; & god wolde ek, þ t is moder : were in eche god hod; Ms. goohod st. godhod. Of wymmen þre þer beþ : þe hexte is maiden hod, þe oþer hexte is widewehod, : spoushod þe þridde is. Alle þre þe maide hadde : þ t bar oure lord crist: Heo was maide widewe & wif; : hoso nys non of þis þre, Bote heo come to amendement, : non hope ne mai of hire be. Ac naþeles þer wiþþoute : me mai ifynde some, Ac, &yogh;if god wole, hi mowe amende, : ar hi to deþe come. Hier schliesst Ms. Ashmol. 43 ab; das Uebrige findet sich allein in Ms. Egerton 1993.

1.1: Of ioie and blisse is now mi þou&yogh;t, . care to bi leue, Vor te herien him among . þat al oure sor schal reue. ffor icome he is þe swete þeng, . þe swete honi drope, Jhs king of alle þing, . to wham is al oure hope; I come he is oure swete broþer; . whar was he so longe? He it is and non oþer, . þat bou&yogh;te vs vrom pine stronge. Oure broþer we mowen him clepe, . so seiþ him self ilome. So ne mi&yogh;ten heo neuer adel . þat bi foren vs come. Vor he nas here broþer nou&yogh;t, . ar he oure vlessch nome, þer wiþ he haþ vs dere abou&yogh;t . to maken vs i some. I some nere hi nou&yogh;t to fore, . angles and oure kuinde, Ar swete ihs were ibore, . þat seldene is in oure muinde. Ac now he haþ oure vlesch inome, . and oure broþer is; Oure kuinde is wel hei&yogh; bicome . among alle oþere iwis. Vor he is al oure kunde next . saue his god hede, is ist übergeschrieben . And aboute is trone men worþ next, . so noble is monhede! Angles ne worþ him nout so nei&yogh;, . vor he nis heore broþer nou&yogh;t, And oure kuinde is eke so hei&yogh;, . vor he haþ vs deore abou&yogh;t, Vor angles ne bou&yogh;te he nou&yogh;t, . we beþ þer fore him þe ner; Whan he vs haþ so dere abou&yogh;t, . wel au&yogh;te we louen him her. Angel nas neuer mo . bote as his messager; How mi&yogh;te hit þanne go . þ t angel were oure broþer her? And in heuene heo schulen also, . whan þ t heo beþ þere, Oure heste and oure wille do, . oure hinen as hit were, And to oure heste seruen vs . to fote and to honde; Vor oure we mowen hem holden þus, . who so wole vnderstonde: Ne mowe þenne glade be . vorto habben such hine? we fehlt hinter mowe. þe soþe we mowe now iseo, . whose siþ al þe fine, þat we beþ alre kuinde hext, . wiþ oute oure lord one, And in heuene al so him next . among his angles echone, And alle þat now late come, . seþþe oure lord ali&yogh;te And oure vlesch haþ here inome, . ihered beo is mi&yogh;te! And hi þat bi fore were, . whan hy þe deþ afonge, þanne heo were forþ inome . in to helle grounde; Nere neuer so holi ne so god, . þer nas for bore non: þer fore heo longeden in here mod . after oure lord echon. þe prophetes þ t were so gode . and so holi men alle, þat of oure lord vnderstode . how hit scholde bi falle, Heo wusten wel þat he wolde come, . ac heo nusten whanne; þe time hem þou&yogh;te swiþe long, . vnche hem þou&yogh;te aspanne. vch fehlt vor vnche. Heo gradden after him wel ofte . in here prophecie And in here bokes þat heo wrou&yogh;ten, . vor he scholde hi&yogh;e. God &yogh;eue, quaþ on of hem, . þat heuene borste ato, þat he mi&yogh;te li&yogh;te adoun anon . and vs sauie so. Somdel hem longede þo, . whan he ne mi&yogh;te abide, þat heuene cleue softe ato . to sauen eiþer side. hat Ms. Ash. 43 vier Verse, die hier fehlen .
1.2: Par di &yogh;et ne cam he nou&yogh;t, . nere him neuer so wo, Ar he hedde þe ground of helle sou&yogh;t, . he & oþer mo. Sein dauid ek in his anuy . after him gradde þus: Lord, þin heuene abowe adoun . and ali&yogh;t to vs, Am Rande ist nebengeschrieben: D(omi)ne inclina celos tuos et ostende fac(iem) t(uam) et salui erimus. And schew vs þin holi face, . & we worþ sauf anon! Him longede ek after his grace . þe olde symeon, Vor al oþer blisse him was binome, . & ofte he gradde bifore: Lord, whanne wol he come? . whann wol he be bore? Ms. wan statt wanne. Weneste þat ich mowe dure? . weneste þat i c mowe iseo? Heore mone hit was deol to here, . hem gladede no gleo; Ac he menede him for nou&yogh;t . a&yogh;en oþere bifore, Vor he nas nou&yogh;t to deþe ibrou&yogh;t, . ar god were ibore, Ac liuede, forte he him say . & in his armes nom, de in liuede übergeschrieben . þo he acondel masse day . to þe temple com. Lorrd, wel may vs bet now, . þan hem mi&yogh;te þo, Ms. lorrd st. lord; vor bet fehlt beo. þat ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t so fle, . þ t he ne moste to helle go. þer fore oure lord him selue seide, . þo he was on erþe ibore, þ t we mi&yogh;ten beo glade & lute dede (!) . þen heo þ t weren bifore. þat prophetus wilneden to seo . and mankuinde al so, þat we seþ now, &yogh;if hit mi&yogh;te be, . ac heo mi&yogh;ten hit no&yogh;t do; Vor we mowen as it were for nou&yogh;t . anon to heuene come, Suþþe oure lord vs haþ i bou&yogh;t . & þe deoles power binome; Ac heo þat such grace nadden, . þat biforen vs come, After oure lowde (!) gradden . in here prophecie ilome; Ms. lowde st. lorde, oder es fehlt lorde nach lowde. Hoe gradden after him so hei&yogh;e . wiþ grete wille and longe, hoe st. heo, wie v. 626 . And non amendement ne sei&yogh;e . bote þe pine of helle stronge. So longe þat heo weren weri . & leten al be stille, And of greding for bere . and toke al godes wille, Vor heo ne sei&yogh;e non oþer won, . þei&yogh; hem þou&yogh;te longe; Von þei&yogh; bis inow&yogh; 77 fehlt in Ash. 43 . Oure lord lette heo (!) wille ago, . ar he wolde oure vlesch avonge. lette aus hette corrigirt; Ms. heo st. heom. And þo heo weren weri inow&yogh; . as whose seiþ for sore, Euer vch to reste drow . & speken of him namore. þat swete bern oure kuinde nam . in vlesch & in velle. Of þe kunde of wham he com . somwat imot telle. A god mon þat het Isacar . was bi olde dawe In bedleem, þat dou&yogh;tren to . hadde bi olde lawe: þe on was anne, þ t ber . oure ledi seinte Marie, þe oþer þat was sein Jones moder, . þ t al so marie; Statt was ist jedenfalls ber zu lesen; hinter al so fehlt het. And elisabet ber of hire . sein Jon þe baptist, And marie, anne dou&yogh;ter, . ber oure lord ihū crist. A god mon þat was in galilee, . iclepud Joachim, A schepherde was and holi mon, . & godes grace was wiþ him. þo he was of twenti winter, . seint anne he nom to wiue. þer nas couple in isrl . of so clene liue. isrl Abbrv. st. Israel. Boþe heo douteden ihū crist, . here god heo deleden a þreo Vche &yogh;er, al þat heo hadden, . þat ech mon mi&yogh;te iseo. þat o del heo &yogh;af to þe temple, . þat serueden þer inne, As we &yogh;eueþ now oure teuþinge . of þat we mowe winne; þat oþer del heo &yogh;af pore men . and wey uerinde al so; Hem self he liueden bi þe þridde . godes seruise to do. þer fore nomon of isrl . þat so muche of orf hedde, Vor nomon fehlt nas. As Joachim and his wif, . for þe gode lif þat heo ladden. Vor whose deþ is teþinge wel . loke now and þo, His god wol þe bctere waxe . and schal euer mo. Joachim and anne is wif . to gadere here lif ladde In clene spoushod twenti &yogh;er, . and nochild heo nadde. Of schamed heo weren þerof sore, . vor hem þou&yogh;ten þat heo were Ms. þou&yogh;tē mit überflüssigem n. Vor&yogh;ete of god bi fore alle oþere, . vor heo no child ne bere. Heo bi heten god, &yogh;if þat he wolde . eni child hem sende, To godes seruise to oblegi . þat child wiþ outen ende. Ech &yogh;er also Joachim . to þe temple wende þreo siþe, to stablen his bi heste, . &yogh;if god him eni child sende; And offrede largeliche . of þing þat he hadde, Vor schame & eke for sorinesse . þat he no child nadde. þo heo hadden twenti &yogh;er . ilad here lif so, Joachim offrede to þe temple, . as he was woned to do. þe preost þat þe temple wuste . pulte him abak anon And seide þat he vn wurþe was . among gode men to gon, And seide þ t oure lord hit schewede wel, . whan he ne þolede nou&yogh;t þat eni child as of oþer was . of hem were forþ ibrou&yogh;t. Joachim was so sore aschomed . þat he wende out anon, Vor schame among oþer men . in þe temple he nolde gon. Wiþ his schep he wende in to anoþer lond . wepinde wel sore. He ne þou&yogh;te in þe temple come . ne to anne is wif na more. Wiþ oþere schep herdes þer he was . in deol monþes fiue, þat he ne herde word of is frend . ne of anne is wiue. An angel com adoun to him . and bad hem be liþe, hem st. him. And seide oure lord him wolde sende . þ t he wilnede ofte siþe, And þat he scholde habbe a dou&yogh;ter . of him bi &yogh;ite, To ioie and blisse of alle þe world, . as þe prophetes hadden iwrite. In tokninge þerof he bed him gon hom, . &yogh;if he it leue nolde, him im Ms. doppelt . And ate goldene &yogh;ate his wyf . homward he mete scholde. Joachim ne leuede him nou&yogh;t, . vo heo so longe childles were, vo st. vor, wie v. 361 . Ac hamward he wende naþeles, . he ne dorste elles for fere. Gret deol made anne his wif vor him, . ne mi&yogh;te no wommon more. As heo was for him in morning . and wep aday wel sore And gan to sike and wringe hire honden: . swete lord, heo sede, Vch þing bote vs þow &yogh;euest ioie . and echinge of blede, Vs one þow makest ioieles, . ine seo non oþer so; Me wondreþ &yogh;if i c dorste sigge . þ t þ u wolt þi wille do, Whanne þou children me binimest, . þ t þow me hast binome Min hosbonde þat is mi ioie, . i not whar he is bicome. þo com þer angel to hire; . ne doute þe nou&yogh;t! he sede, Ich am þe angel þat habbe ibore . bi fore god þi godhede; An gode dou&yogh;ter þou schalt bere . al þorw godes rede, Marie schal hire name beo, . þat holi lif schal lede; Of hire schal wondri al þe world . & þorw hire isaued beo; þat child þow schalt bi time bere . and þat soþe iseo; A&yogh;e þin hosbonde þow go anon, . and, to folfulle þi bone, Ate goldene &yogh;ate þ u schalt him mete, . ne come þ u neuer so sone. Anne ne leuede nou&yogh;t wel þis, . ac naþeles forþ heo wende Vorte meten hire hosbonde, . as þe angel hire sende. a. R. : Portam auream. Oure lord he bad ententifliche . som tokne him sende þere, Whi more ioie in heuene þo . þan in oþer time were. An angel him seide þat oure ledi . was ibore þulke day, And of hire burþtime was al þe ioie . þ t he in heuene isay; And bad him warne holichurche . þat men on erþe al so Maden feste of þulke day, . as he say in heuene do. Hire burþtime al holichirche . wusten on þis manere. Telle we now of hire lif, . þat heo ladde on erþe here! Anon þo heo was þreo &yogh;er old, . as hit fel in þe lawe, Offred to þe temple heo was, . as me vsede bi olde dawe, þo heo bi leuede hire moder breste, . þ t heo ne sek na more. And þo heo to þe temple com, . me mi&yogh;te iseo godes ore: Vor þer were viftene degres . imad bifore þe auter In þe honuraunce of viftene salmes . þat beþ in þe sauter; þis maide clomb vch after oþer, . vor te heo come an hei&yogh;, As heo were of gret elde, . ne com hire no mon nei&yogh;; Heo ne bi heold after fader ne moder, . þo heo vppard stei&yogh;. Gret wonder hadde vch mon of hire . þat þis þing isei&yogh;. Chastite heo bihet al bi hire lif, . &yogh;if hit godes wille were. Mid oþer maidnes in þe temple . heo was forto lere. So renable heo was and queinte . of wit & of dede, þat vch mon of a so &yogh;ong þing . wonder hedde and drede. Heo nas neuer isei&yogh;e wroþ . ne enes li&yogh;ynge gon Ne onus word sigge to man, . bote euer more in on. Heo sewede and span and waf&yogh; . boþe wollene and lynne, Heo hedde oþer lutel erþliche god . hire mete to winne. Vche werke day bi ri&yogh;t time . þe day heo delede aþreo: Ms. b ri&yogh;t st. bi ri&yogh;t. Ech morwe forto vnderne . in hire bedes wolde beo, heo fehlt vor wolde. Vrom vnderne to midouernon . to hire werke sitte, Spinne oþer sewe oþer weue, . he was gode witte; of fehlt nach was. In hire bedes þanne heo wolde . vort eue beo wel softe. To hire an angel com alday . and confortede ofte. hire fehlt vor ofte. Whan heo herde of sike men, . to hem sone heo wende And confortede & helede hem sone . þorw grace þat god hire sende. In hire child hod al þis was . þat ichabbe of itold. Vor alle godne(sse) wiþ hire was . boþe &yogh;ong and old. Ms. godne st. godnesse. þo heo was of fortene &yogh;er old, . þe bisschop of þe lawe Het vche maide of þulke elde . to hire contreie drawe, To take hosbonde as lawe was; . þe maidnes were alle fawe Of þe heste, bote marie, . hire likede no&yogh;t þe sawe; þo heo was ihote vorþ . hosbonde wiþ oþere to take: Sire, heo seide, þat lawe wole, . inul nowt for sake; Vor lawe fehlt þe. Ac mi fader and mi moder . bi hete for me, ar i c were bi&yogh;ete, þat ischolde in godes seruise . mi maidenhod wite; And mi seluen ek, þo ich was child, . bi het oure lord al one To libbe mi lif in chastite . wiþ oute mannes mone; þer fore isigge ow to soþe . þat þis is mi wille: Nei&yogh; mon nulle i c neuer come . mi maiden hod to spille. þe bischop and alle þe oþer maistres, . þ t of þe temple were, Gret conseil nomen of þis word . and weren in grete fere, Vor þe bok wolde þat no mon . a&yogh;en such bi heste scholde be, And þat þe lawe wolde þat no wommon . from spoushod scholde vle. Gret conseil þer of heo nomen, . from dai&yogh;e to dai&yogh;e were and fehlt vor from. In bedes to bidde ihū crist . som tokninge hem sende þere. þo com þer avois and bad hem . þenchen on Isaye, And þat maide spouse chese . þorw his prophecie. Now seide Isaye . þat þer scholde springe A &yogh;erde of Jessees more . and of dauid þe kinge, And a flour scholde vp teo . of þilke more also, And þer vpe þe holi gost . come ali&yogh;te þer to. Her þorw þis men wuste . how heo scholden on take. Of dauiþes kunne he het vche man, . þ t were wiþ oute make And elde to habbe wif, . þat vch of hem bere of fehlt vor elde. A bar &yogh;erde to þe auter, . þ t non vor bore nere; And whos &yogh;erde bigonne to blowe . & a coluere þer on ibrou&yogh;t, þat he toke marie to spouse, . þ t hit nere bi leued nou&yogh;t. þe bischop was þo glad inow, . he let crie þere þat alle þat were of dauiþes kunne . a&yogh;erde to þauter bere. þo heo weren alle to gadere, . & vch hedde a&yogh;erde an honde: þer was iosep an old mon, . þat bi hinde alle gan stonde. A&yogh;en his wille þider he com, . he ne dorste elles for fere; His &yogh;erde he hudde, þo his felaws . here &yogh;erden to þe auter bere. þo þer nas non þat gan to blowe, . and iosep heo vnder &yogh;ite þat hedde is &yogh;erde so ihudde, . heo gonnen him to þrete; Heo maden him bere is &yogh;erde forþ, . he ne moste vor bore beo; þo he to þe auter com, . me mi&yogh;te miracle iseo: His &yogh;erde bigan to blowe faire, . þat bar was and old er, And anowarde sat awhit coluere; . gret miracle was þer: Vpe &yogh;erde longe heo sat, . and seþþe þat volk isai&yogh; þe fehlt vor &yogh;erde. þat heo vlei&yogh; into þe temple aboute . & seþþe to heuene anhei&yogh;. þer nas non þat þis sei&yogh;, . þat sore adrad nas. Ac iosep þe olde mon is his half . þer fore sori was; þat me lokede him to wedde þat maide, . of schamed he was sore. Lokeþ, he seide, mi feblesse . and habbeþ of me milse and ore! Nam ich old wiþ manie children? . mi mi&yogh;ten beþ me bi nome, And heo is &yogh;ong, & sunne hit is . to maken vs to gedere come. Nim &yogh;eme, iosep! quaþ þe bischop, . þat þow þi self ne aspille, As datan dude and abiron . þat weren a&yogh;e godes wille. þo was iosep sore adrad, . he ne dorste wiþ sigge na more Vor drede of oure lordes wreche; . he gan to sike sore. I nul no&yogh;t, he seide, god misdo; . ac, whan hit mot so nede, Ichul hire wedde, ac heo ne schal . hire maidenhod for me schede; Ichul hire witen and hire warden, . oþer ne mai it be nou&yogh;t, þat mi sone mai hire wedde after me, . þ t oure kuinde be forþ ibrou&yogh;t. Vor þe lawe was þo : whan amon ne mi&yogh;te . bi&yogh;ete child bi is wiue, þat is nexte kun hire wedde scholde . anon after is liue, And vch after oþer, vorte som child . of þe blode come; Whose no child no wonne, vn wurþe was, . as hit fel ofte ilome. Josep weddede in þis entente . þis clene maide þere. Ac for oþer þing oure lord wolde . þat heo wedded were: þat is moder isclaundred nere . wiþ childe vnwedded were, Vor wiþ childe fehlt þat heo. To heore oune cite of nazareth. . & þis child wel wex þo And conforded was, & godes grace . in him was ido. þis prophecie of symeon . and of þis holi anne Was sone aboute wide ibrou&yogh;t . from manne to manne, And to heroudes among oþere. . þo dradde he him sore, And on þat þe kinges him seiden er . he þou&yogh;te wel þe more. And þo alle þreo anoþer wey . to ward here londe nome Al bi watere, as iseide er, . and bi him ne come, Sori he made him þer fore . and abod hem ilome; Of annes wordes and symeon . he nam ek gret gome, And þat þe schepherdes seiden also, . þat oure lord was ibore; In gret þou&yogh;t he was ni&yogh;t and day, . oure lord to sle þer fore. He hedde ek six luþer sones, . þat þou&yogh;ten him euele di&yogh;te, To bi nimen him is kinedom . oþer quellen him, &yogh;if heo mi&yogh;te. þo eroudes it vnder&yogh;at, . he drof hem awey anon; To þe emperour þo luþere sones . to pleinte gonnen gon. I not what scholde a luþer fader . bote luþer sones bi&yogh;ete! þo þe emperour þis pleint iherde, . þe soþe he wolde iwite; He let sompne þe king heroudes, . þat hit ne bi leued nou&yogh;t, Vor hit fehlt he, oder were nach ne. þat he were bi fore him . at acertein day ibrou&yogh;t. þo was eroudes sore adrad, . & somdel for &yogh;at so þe wreche þat he hedde iþou&yogh;t . bi oure (lord) to do. Nach oure fehlt lord. To þe emperour sori e wende . & þer to brou&yogh;te is strif, þat is sones him scholde abowe, . & he be king al is lif. Swiþe hardi he was þo, . and hamward he gan wende. Al his þou&yogh;t and his red was . how he mi&yogh;te oure lord schende. He com bi þe see of thars, . and þe schipes þat e founde To douste he let hem brenne anon, . oþer hakke to grounde, þe wraþþe of þe kinges þreo . þ t þer vorþ gonnen wende. þe st. þorw verschrieben oder es fehlt vor. þat seind dauiþ in is sauter, . ibrou&yogh;t it was to ende: Ms. seind st. seide seint. þat þe kingus here of erþe . to gadere beþ ibrou&yogh;t And wondreden, whanne heo sei&yogh;e oure lord, . & destorbed were in here þou&yogh;t, And also imeued ek, . and muche drede hem nome þere And sor, as of awommon . þ t in trauail of child were, And deol foliche þe schipes of thars . wiþ wel hasti breþe. Ms. deol foliche st. defoulede verschrieben, oder defoulede ist zu ergänzen. þis was seid bi eroudes, . as it mi&yogh;te wel eþe, þat destourbed was and imeued, . & in anguise & in drede Defoulede þe schipes of thars . wiþ wel hasti rede. þat was, me þinkeþ, afeble wreche . & gret luþer hede ido, þat vor heo hedden þer forþ iwend, . þe schipes defouli so. þat vor umzusetzen vor þat. þo he nuste how he mi&yogh;te more . of þe kinges him awreke, How he mi&yogh;te oure lord slee, . he biþenchen and speke. Vor biþenchen fehlt gan. E nuste, whar oure lord was, . bote as men him hadden itold, Ac wel he wuste þat e nas . nour (!) nei&yogh; to &yogh;er old. þer fore he let sle alle þe children . þ t wiþ inne to &yogh;er were, A boute al þe contrei of bedleem, . þat oure lord forbore nere. How oure lord ascapede, . þe gospel telleþ vs þat is irad achilder masse day, . þat bigynneþ þus: Oure lordes angel in slep . to iosep cam þo And seide: aris & nim þichild . & is moder, & go A. R.: s. M. Angelus dm appar(uit); s. Math. 2, 13. Ynto egipt and beo þer, . vorte þat i c þe telle, Vor certein it is þ t heroudes . wol seche þis child to quelle. He aros vp and nom þis child . and þe moder þo, And þene wey toward egipt . al bi ni&yogh;te gan go, And was þer, vorte heroudes . his lif an erþe lete, To folfulle þat of oure lord . iseid was þorw þe prophete, þat seide: out of egipt . ichabbe icleped mi sone. þat word hedde þer bifore . longe ben in mone. þo heroudes isay . þat he bigiled was, Of þe kinges wroþ inow . he was for þat cas, And sende and slow al þe children, . in bedleem þ t þer were And in al þe contrei þer aboute, . wiþ inne þe elde of to &yogh;ere, þat were of to &yogh;er and lasse, . he ne bileuede non þer, Vpe þe time þat he of askede . of þe kinges er. þo was it folfulled . þat of Jeremie þe prophete was iseid, . þat he seide in prophecie: þe vois anhei&yogh; is iherd, . muche wep and morninge; A. R.: vox in rama. Rachel bi wep hire sones . and nolde no gladinge, Vor þat heo ne beþ nou&yogh;t. . þis is þe ende lo. Vor þis wordes harde beþ, . me mot hem a lute vndo: þat þis cri was iherd an hei&yogh;, . þ t was of sorwe and sore þat modres vor here children made, . ne mi&yogh;te be na more. þat rachel hire sones scholde biwepe . þ t so longe was ded er, þat was þat moni of þe children, . þat were aslawe þer, Of rachelus kunne were icome, . & for rachel al so I buried was biside bedleem, . þer þis dede was do. þat heo nolde habbe no gladinge, . vor þat heo beþ nou&yogh;t, þat was þat heo lete here lif . & to deþe were ibrou&yogh;t. Twelf monþes after and four dawes, . þat god was ibore, Was þat heo weren islawe, . so &yogh;ong heo weren icore. I cristned heo weren in here blod, . vair was þe companie; Reuþfol and sori was þe cri . þ t here modres gan crie. þe mestedel of þe children . iburied suþþe were þre milen bi side bedleem . in þe souþhalf þere. Alas seli &yogh;onge þinges, . gulteles heo weren dede! Mid hem he hedde lute milce . þ t dude so luþer hede. A wei, heroudes, þow wrecche king, . þow hontest aboute nou&yogh;t: Sore þow draddest þorw him beo . of þi kinedom ibrou&yogh;t, Ac naþeles þow mi&yogh;test wite wel . þat hit nas no&yogh;t is ri&yogh;te, þi wrecche kinedom here to holde, . vor he was of more mi&yogh;te. Whi slowe þ u for hate of him . þe children þat gultles were? Wrecche, he wuste wel þi þou&yogh;t, . ne foundeste him nou&yogh;t þere; Vrom þi power he is ilad, . ac naþeles vor drede nou&yogh;t, Ac vor he wolde his time abide, . ar he were to deþe ibrou&yogh;t. As iosep and marie . þis swete child vorþ ladde A. R.: De miraculis in itinere. Toward þe lond of egipt, . as þe angel hem radde: As heo þorw tounes wende, . &yogh;onge children come And siwede þis swete child . & maden him ioie ilome. Lute wyt þei&yogh; heo couþen, . &yogh;et heo mi&yogh;ten for beren nou&yogh;t To solacen heore &yogh;onge lord, . þat þer was ibrou&yogh;t. þo heo comen in to egipt, . in here wey stod a treo A. R.: De arbore uertuosa. þat of gret vertue was, . non more ne mi&yogh;te beo: þat, whose þer of eni þing . aboute is nekke bere, ffruit oþer rinde oþer lef . oþer eniþing þat þer of were, Vnneþe was eni vuel, . þat he nas hol anon. So gret vertue hedde þe treo; . hit helede monie on. Anon þo oure lord and is moder . in to egipt wende, þe treo bowede þe crop to grounde . & þe middel narwe bende; Adoun hit aloutede to oure lord . boþe crop and more, And vpri&yogh;t stod seþþe a&yogh;en, . þo oure lord was þer forþ ibore. To þe cite heo comen þo, . ac herbarwe nadden heo non. A. R.: De simulacris in templo. To þe hei&yogh;e temple heo wenden, . þer vch mon mi&yogh;te in gon. þre hondred maumetes and fiue & fourti . in þilke temple were; To grounde heo vellen euer vch on, . anon þo oure lord com þere; Stonden ne mi&yogh;ten heo no lengore, . þan he among hem cam, þat here maister was imad . & here power bi nam. In egipte was þis swete child . and is moder also A. R.: De uita illorum in egipto. And Josep in meseise inow, . vorte seue &yogh;er were ido. Mid spinninge and sewinge . oure swete ladi milde Bi wan here mete þulke time . to hem and to here childe. I seo &yogh;e now, wuch gret pruide . he drow forþ, þe hei&yogh;e king, Vor wuch fehlt wiþ. þat he nadde whar bi libbe, . þe lord of alle þing, Bote mid spindle and mid nelde . his moder hi(m) bi wan? Ms. hi st. him. God ensample þis may beo, . me þinkeþ, to pore man: Whan þe king of alle kinges . to such pouerte gan drawe, Me þinkeþ, whose him vnderstode, . of pouerte au&yogh;te be vawe. Suþþe heroudes þe king, . as oure lord grace sende, In serwe and wrecchede inow . out of is lif wende. He was king seuene and þritti &yogh;er, . ac þer nou&yogh;t to vewe, Al to muche bi vche day, , vor he was euere aschrewe. A. R.: De mortis Herodis. Muche wo an erþe he dude, . & þo he hedde al ido, His owne sones he slow þreo, . þ t schrewen weren al so, þat awaiteden hire (fader) to sle . vor is kinedom, Nach hire fehlt fader. And was fel and cam bi fore . & here lif hem bi nom. he fehlt vor was. In such anguise he was him self . & in torment so, þat he wolde him self habbe islawe, . &yogh;if emi&yogh;te ha come þer to ha st. han. Ate laste he þou&yogh;te wel . þat ehedde be such aschrewe, And men wolde be glade vor his deþ, . & lute sori vewe, And ri&yogh;t hit were to plaine . þe deþ of aking; And, &yogh;if heo nolden for is lif, . he þou&yogh;te heo scholden for oþer þing. þer fore þo he scholde dei&yogh;e, . þe hexte of is londe Bifore him he let to deþe do . in serwe inow and schonde, þat hei þat bilafte a liue . of here frendes iwis Vor heore deþ maden deol, . whan heo nolden for his: So þat in o manere oþer in oþer . deol were at is deþe. Al mest ibischrewe him, . ich vor bere vnneþe. And þe schrewe was of liue, . archelaus is sone A. R.: Et quo|modo archelaus regnabat post ipsum. Nach and fehlt þo. King was imad after him, . as lawe was and wone. þe furste &yogh;er, as god wolde, . of is kinedom Josep wiþ þe swete child . out of egipte com. In whuche manere he þenne wende, . þe gospel deþ vs lere þat biginneþ at twelfþe eue, . & is mad on þis manere: A. R.: s. M. Defuncto herode; s. Math. 2, 19 . þo þat heroudes was ded, . oure lordes angel ali&yogh;te In slep to Josep in egipt, . and seide him in si&yogh;te: . . . fehlen mehrere Verse . Into þe lond ecom of isrl . . þo herde he tidinge þat after heroudes is fader . Archelaus was kinge In þe lond of Jude: . he dradde þider wende; I hote he was ek in his slep . of þe angel atenende, And com into galilee, . & wonede þo þere In þe cite of nazareth; . þat hit folfulled were þat of þe prophetes was iseid: . þat escholde icleped beo Of nazareth and bere þe name. . þe encheson me may seo: Vor oure ledi was þer ibore . and also bi&yogh;ete, And oure lord þere in hire ali&yogh;te, . as we findeþ iwrite; And vor heo eke to nazaret . vrom egipt wende iwis, þer fore ihū of nazareth . oure lord iclepud is. þis child ihc wax ful wel . & iconforted was also, And fol was of wisedom, . & godes grace in him was do. And is frendes to ierlm . wenden euer vch &yogh;er, Ate feste of Aster . to siwe þe lawe þer. þo ihc was of twelf &yogh;er old . and twelf &yogh;er were ido, A. R.: s. M. ( st. L.) Cum ihs ēet XII annorum; s. Luc. 2, 42 . Heo wenden forþ to ierlm . vpe þe custom þ t was þo, Vpe þe feste of ester day. . & þo þe dawes ido were: So þat heo wende hom a&yogh;en; . and þe child ihc þere Bilafte in ierlm, . & is kunesmen nusten it nou&yogh;t, A wenden he were hamward . among þe volk ibrou&yogh;t. Ms. A st. An. So þat heo wenden and sou&yogh;ten him . hammard a iorneie Among his cuþþe and is kun, . and also bi vche wei&yogh;e. To ierlm heo turnden a&yogh;en, . þo heo ne mi&yogh;ten him no&yogh;t seo, And sou&yogh;ten him þer in vche side; . & after dawes þreo Amidde þe maistres heo founden him . in þe temple sitte, And herknede and apposede hem, . so þat of is witte Ms. asposede st. apposede. And of is answere al so . and of is queintise Alle þat herden him . wondreden in here wise. Sone, quaþ oure ledi, . what hastow vs ido? Wel sori we þe habbeþ isou&yogh;t, . þi fader and i c also. What is þat, quaþ þis oþer, . þat &yogh;e me habbeþ isou&yogh;t? Neste &yogh;e þ t in mi fader þing . i moste nede be brou&yogh;t? þis word þat he spak to hem . heo ne vnderstode nou&yogh;t, Vor hit was al of his god hede; . þer fore heo weren in þou&yogh;t. þis child ali&yogh;te adoun to hem, . & to nazareth cam, And was in here warde forþ. . & his moder nam God &yogh;eme of alle is wordes . & in hire herte hem hedde ido. Ihc wex wel in elde . and in wisedom al so And in grace a&yogh;en god . and a&yogh;en men iwis. þe ende as me rat in churche . of þulke gospel is þis. þat word of his fader þing, . of whom þis child sede, Was þat it fel to is fader . of wisedom speke and rede; And vor þe temple wiþ ri&yogh;te eke . was of is fader fe, þer fore he seide he moste nede . in is fader þing be. þo marie nom so god &yogh;eme . of is wordes vchon, þat was, whan (men) axeden out, . to tellen hit hem anon. Nach whan fehlt men. þis child was for lore, for me . criede in þe temple faste þat vche mon stode bi is per, . þe while þe feste laste, Man bi man and child bi child . and wommon bi oþer also; So stod vch þing bi is per, . vorte feste were ido. Vor feste fehlt þe. So þat ihc vrom is frendes . among children was ibrou&yogh;t, And heo nusten whar he bicam, . ar he were wide isout&yogh;. þo archelaus hadde . ni&yogh;e &yogh;er king ibeo, So proud he was & so luþer, . as vche mon mi&yogh;te seo, þat þis it nolde þolie nou&yogh;t, . ac is power him bi nome And heroudes, is broþer, maden king . þorw ri&yogh;te dome. Boþe heo weren heroudes sones, . þat king was bi fore, þat fondede oure lord to sle, . þo he was ibore. Heroudes, þis newe king, . and pilatus, þe Justise, And þe bisschop anne & caiphas, . þ t of þe lawe were wise, Alle foure heo weren ate red . to bringe oure lord of dawe. Pilatus hadde þer bifore . vnder eroudes e beo; Ms. e beo st. ibeo. To rome he wende to þemperour . & &yogh;af him of is feo, Vor to holde of þe emperour . þat he of eroudes huld er. þe emperour þus furst binam . eroudes ri&yogh;te þer. þer fore eroudes and pilatus . in wraþþe weren ibrou&yogh;t, Ar god were to deþe ido, . acorded nere hi nou&yogh;t, Vor þe gile þat pilatus . a&yogh;en him hedde ido And þorw strengþe of þe emperour . his lond inome so. So proude were þis giwes euere, . þat þe emperour was wroþ. Heore pruide he wolde abati, . he swor is more oþ. Eroudes kinedom, þe olde, . e delede a vour partie, And tok eroudes and phelip . & here broþer lisanie Vchone apartie þer of, . þ t eroudes sones were, And pilatus þe verþendel, . vort heo hem betre bere. Phelip hedde al iturie, . heroudes galile, And lisanie abiliue, . and pilatus Jude. (Hier schliesst das Gedicht mitten auf der Seite ab, die andere Hälfte sowie die Rückseite von fol. 40 ist leer. Das Ged. ist wol nicht vollständig.)

text.2: III. Barlam und Josaphat aus Ms. Bodl. 779. Barlaam & Josaphat. Der Titel fehlt im Ms., ist aber so vorn im Inhaltsverzeichnisse angegeben . (I)hon of damascene : telleþ vs þe stori&yogh;e Die Initiale I in Ihon fehlt ebenfalls, doch es ist Raum dafür gelassen. Of barlaam & iosaphat, : to haue hem Im memory&yogh;e. Ms. Im st. In, wie v. 163. [Berichtigungen (p. XLIV) add: Das im Ms. häfige i m st. in is wol nur also Verschreibg. anzus. ] Barlaam tornyd Iosaphat, : þe king&es; sone of egipte, Die Abkürzung &es; für die Endung des Nom. Plur. und Gen. Sgl. wird zwar sonst in der Regel nur für us gebraucht, jedoch ist es sehr wahrscheinlich, dass sie in diesem Gedicht für is gebraucht ist, da, wenn nicht abgekürzt, sich nur is als Endung findet und auch meist in den Endungen des Verbs und in den Ableitungssilben i statt e gebraucht ist; nur im Adv. þ&es; scheint &es; für us gebraucht, wie V. 108, 251, 902, 1060, 1084, u. ö., wie es auch V. 211, 1164 ausgeschrieben þus lautet, obgleich sich auch þis in derselben Verbindung (mit seide) findet, z. B. 721, 754, 851, und þ&es; stets mit is reimt; v. 419 findet sich þis durch þ s ausgedrückt; vs reimt mit iwis v. 1238 . & fro fals be leue : to cristindom hym kipte. In þe lond monk&es; : & cristinmen were. Auenne heet þe king : þ t wonyd þo þere; Monk&es; he hatid more : þan I of telle may, & euerymon þ t willuid : to here abbay; willuid f. st. willnid verschreiben zu halten, hindert d. Schreibung wilwid V. 492, welches doch wol dieselbe Bedeutung hat. Cristinmen he harmyd: & monk&es; wit his my&yogh;t, & w t al his conseyl : he þou&yogh;t hem euil dy&yogh;t. It be fel þ t anobil mon, : þat þ o wit hym was, Went in to wildirnes : & monk com by cas; com st. bicom. þey he were in king&es; hous : & gret honour hadde, Al þ t he gan forsak, : for he þou&yogh;t it badde. þo þe king herde þis, : sory he was & wroþ, & þat he scholde be sou&yogh;t : &yogh;erne he swor his oþ. fforþ he sente messager&es;, : þ t haue hym I sou&yogh;t; þey founde hym & to þe king : þey haue hym I brou&yogh;t. þe king hym be held þo : In a foul cirtil; On him he schok his heed : & seyd: hastou do wel? þ u þat were wonyd wit me : be in cloþ&es; ryche, þ u hast tornyd þy self : & gost vylliche; Lene beþ þy chekis : þ t feyr were wonyd to be; þ u hast maad a childis pley, : Iwis, so þinkeþ me. þyn honour þ u hast tornyd : al in to foly&yogh;e, & me þinkeþ þ t þ u dost : þer of no cortesy&yogh;e. &YOGH;if þ u wolt, þis good mon seyd, : þe soþe wit of me, þou most þy fomon anon : dryue fro þe. þe kyng seyde : my fomon? : telle woche be þo! þe gode mon answerde : & hym seyde two: & &, doppelt . two = to. Wraþþe & couetyse : draueþ men be hinde, & for þey ne schold þe soþe se, : makeþ hem alle blinde; Ms. far st. for. But tak to þy conseyl : soþnesse & queintyse, ffor to knowe soþnesse : þey þe wolle wyse. Myldelych answerid : þe king to hym þo: After þat þ u hast seyd, : I wis, I wille do; Sey what þat þ u wolt, : I wolle þ e nou here t in wolt aus d corrigirt . þat I nele wraþþe me : in no manere. ffolis wole, quaþ þis good mon, : þ t lasting is forsake, & þ t ne duriþ nou&yogh;t long : þey strengþiþ hem to take; & I þe segge forsoþe, : ry&yogh;t ne knowiþ þey nou&yogh;t þ t ne haþ in lore wit sorw&yogh; : be fore it I bou&yogh;t; þus it fariþ, leue syre, : I segge þe, by me: Heuin I wold knowe, : forsoþe I segge þe; Who so wil it knowe, : þis world he moot for saake, þis aus þes corrigirt . þat ne last but a whyle, : & hard lyf to hym taake; ffor wit oute hard lyf, : þolyd in world þis, Ne may no mon wit ry&yogh;t : come to heuin blis; For ihū crist oure lord, : þ t god of heuin is, þo he was on crþe, : þolid pyne I wis; ffor hym self he dede it nou&yogh;t, : for vs it was do; þerfore we scholle w t his help : for hym doon also. I wis, quaþ þe king to hym, : nadde I be hote þe þ t I schold wraþþe & couetyse : dryue fro me, Of þe I wold a wreke : In wraþþe be, þat me schold þy reed blood : on grounde se. þerfore swyþe of my lond : þ t þ u now fle! Or w t pyne & w t wo : for doon þ u schalt be. fforþ went þis good mon : in moche sorw&yogh; & wo, For he hopid ful wel : to deþe ben I do. In þ t ilke tyme : þe king nadde eyr none; þerfore he was sory : & made moche mone. God hym sente a knaue child, : þ t was swyþe feyr, Josaphat it was I hote, : & scholde ben his eyr. To þe temple þey went, : his offring for to doon. & after astronomyis : þe king leet sende anon, þat þey schold stody&yogh;e : in eueryche syde & telle hym what his sone : on erþe schold be tyde. Alle þey answerid: : gret lord he schold be, & agreet mayster swyþe wit al, : &yogh;if he most I þe. þo seyd on, but nou&yogh;t þorw him self : but þorw þ e holy gost: t in gost und wost hat ein Schleifchen, welches e be|deuten könnte, hier aber wol bedeutungslos ist . þis child schal be conquerour : of þing þ t þ u wost, t in gost und wost hat ein Schleifchen, welches e be|deuten könnte, hier aber wol bedeutungslos ist . For þing þou louist most(!) : þis child haue chal, & þer þorw&yogh; oure hy&yogh;e god&es; honour : he schal doun fal. þis þing of hym self : ne seyde he no þing, But þorw þe holy gost, : þat tau&yogh;t hym þis tokenyng. Vor tokenyng ist tyding wegpunktirt . þo þis ilke king : was in wraþþe & in care, For he nyste noþing : how he scholde fare, Ne he nyste on lyue : wher he my&yogh;t hym do. A chaumbir ondir erþe : he leet make þo. & anon his &yogh;onge sone : he leet do þer inne, For he ne schold of crist here : be no maner gyinne. þe feyreste childrin of þe lond : he leet to hym do, & bad nomon to hym spek, : of no maner sorw ne wo, Ne of no þing : þat my&yogh;t do hym care, But in alle wyse : make hym mery to fare. Of ihū crist he for bad : me scholde speke nou&yogh;t, Lest he in any tyme : tornyd to hym his þou&yogh;t. Of seknesse & of elde : he heet hem al so þat þey ne speke, & &yogh;if any : þ t w t hym were I do Were in syknesse or in sorw&yogh;, : do a wey þo, & nym an oþer in his sted, : þat ne ferd nou&yogh;t so: So þat he were In ioy&yogh;e : þorw alle þing, & þat he þou&yogh;t nou&yogh;t : on noþing to comyng. In þ t tyme was wit þe king : amon wel preue, Dieser Mann heisst im Mhd. Ged . Barachias. þat preuely louid wel ihū crist, : as þe book telleþ me. Wit þe king on aday : he went on hontyng. By þe wey þey founde : apore mon gronyng; Of abest he was hort : in his foot wel sore. Help he hym be sou&yogh;te : & seruise, for godd&es; ore. þe king rood forþ his wey, : & no kep ne took, But lou&yogh; & made game, : & vtterliche hym for sook. þis oþer aly&yogh;te of his hors : anon in þilke stounde &, as he my&yogh;t, : bond vp his soor wounde. þe pore hym be sou&yogh;t : seruise pur charyte, & seyd: I may par awenture : in some þin helpe þe. — þin st. þing. þou I þe vndirfong, : I not what þ u ca(n)st do. — Ms. cast st. canst. þe pore mon hym answerid : & þ&es; he seyd hym two: I am leche of word&es;, : & þer of helpe I can; &YOGH;if any man Is hort : of word of man, þou he be so hurt : þ t hym greue sore, I hym wole hele, : & he do be my lore. þis kny&yogh;t hym ondirfong, : & told þis for nou&yogh;t, & sent hym to his hous : & haþ hym to hele brou&yogh;t. Wit þe king were men þo : ful of enui&yogh;e, þat gonne þis good kny&yogh;t : wel foule be ly&yogh;e. Of some þing þey seyde sooþ, : as I &yogh;ow telle can: For þey seyd þat he was : a cristin man; But wel I woot þey seyde lees : of an oþer þing: þey seide he was aboute to nym : þe kingdom of þe king, & þat he procurid þe baroun&es; of þe lond ffor to putte out þe king : w t schame & wit schond. & &yogh;if þ u wolt, þey seyde, : þer of wite þe soþe, Send after hym to morw&yogh; : þat he come to þe; Tel hym: þis world, : as þe þinkeþ, is nou&yogh;t, þerfore to holy lyf : þ u wolt torne þy þou&yogh;t, &, for þ u leuist on ihū crist, : monk þ u wolt be come: So þ u my&yogh;t his wille : knoue al & some; Wel þou wost, leue syre, : &yogh;if he rad þer to, þat þe þing is al sooþ : þ t we þe tel to. þo þe king hadde al do : þ t þey gonne hym rede, þe kny&yogh;t fel to þe king&es; feet; : sore weping he sede: Ihū críst of heuin, þonkid moot þ u be, þat hast my lord soch reed I sent, : as he here telleþ me. I wis, he seyde, leue syre, : triste me ne may To þis false world : þ t chaungeþ ech day: Nou &yogh;e seþ þe wedir is hoot & now cold, fehlt: nach der ersten Halbzeile, wie v. 121. 289. 295. 477. 480. 513. Now aman in his &yogh;ouþe is : & now he is old, Now aman is ryche : & now in pouert I sete, pouert st. pouerte auch v. 164 und 166, aber pouerte v. 162 . Nou aman is in gret chele : & nou brenneþ for hete, Now me is in gret wele : & now me is in wo; þis world is vnstedfast, : ffor al þing faryþ so; nach is ist vs wegpunktirt . þerfore me þinkeþ I wis : it is þe beste reed, þat þ u folwe þy þou&yogh;t : þat þ u me hast I seed. þe king answerid: : I wene wel þat þ u do, Worse þ u woldist do by me, : &yogh;if þ u my&yogh;tist come þer two. Hom he wente to his hous, : & be þou&yogh;t anon þ t þe king in wraþþe : tok his word&es; echon, & þou&yogh;t he scholde be harmyd : þorw þ t ilke speche, But he were holpe of hym : þ t was of word&es; leche. To hym he gan segge : þe wraþþe of þe king, & how his oune word&es; : were þe be ginnyng. Wete it wel, quaþ þis oþer, : þe king haþ ondirstonde þ t þ u art aboute : to dryue hym out of londe; Arys vp to morwe erlich, : & kot about þin ere, & alle þy cloþ&es; chaunge : & cloþe þe in here! Go erliche to þe king : in þe morw&yogh; tyde! Whanne þou comyst to his bed, : stonde a whyle be syde, & aske hym wel fayre : wher he redy be, & sey: syre, redy I am, : here þou my&yogh;t se; In merþe we haue longe, : þou wost, to gedir be, þerfore I am redy to go : w t þe to pouerte; For im my rychesse : þ u hast me feyr founde, Ms. im st. in. I am redy wit þe : in pouert to be bounde; Wel þ u wost in þy wele : þ u madist me þy make, þerfore in þy pouert : I nele þe forsake; &YOGH;if þer any þing be : þ t greuous is to þe, & we to gedir ben, : þe ly&yogh;ter it schal be. As þis good mon tau&yogh;t : þis kny&yogh;t haþ I do, & seyd he was al redy : wit þe king to go. þe king lay & herde : how he seyde þis; Moche wondir hym þou&yogh;t : of þis þing I wis, & seyd: artow redy : for to go wit me? fforsoþe, quaþ þis oþer, : syre, þ u my&yogh;t se &yogh;e; Me for to go wit þe, : I woot it is ry&yogh;t, þer fore þ u my&yogh;t se : þer to I am dy&yogh;t; & &yogh;if þer oþer wey be : þ t þ u wilt to take, I segge þe forsoþe, : I nele þe forsake. Wend a&yogh;en, quaþ þe king, : I wille be þenke me; Haue þis in conseyl stille, : til I speke more w t þe. þe king wel ondirstood : by þis ilke þing þat alle here word&es; : nere but lesing, & euer he gan þe kny&yogh;t : þ e more honour do, & euer more þer after : þe more trist hym to. Iosaphat, þe king&es; sone, : maystris hadde of lore, þat, þou he were so be loke, : tau&yogh;t hym euere more. On þis world he gan þenche, : þou he it say selde, Ms. scheinbar ho st. he. For he was ny of tyme : of fyftene &yogh;er elde. Nach &yogh;er ist er wegpunktirt . A child þ t hym was preue : wit speche swyþe softe, Whan he was in preuete, : he gan aske ofte, Why he was so be schit : & ne moste out go, & seyd: whan he þou&yogh;t þer on, : his herte was ful wo. Ne þer nys mete ne drink þer fore : þ t me doþ gode. þe child hym answerid : wit wel mylde mode: Syre, of þis reson, : I woot, þ u most be stille; ffor I woot þ u art here : þorw&yogh; þy fadir wille, & wel þ u wost a&yogh;en hym : we ne mowe nou&yogh;t be; þer fore, syre, make þe glad, : for loue I bidde þe. Mafey, quaþ þis oþer, : I wille gon out & pley&yogh;e, Er I ete mete, : þ u I for hongur dey&yogh;e. Die Abkürzung ur st. er ist sehr selten, vgl . wondur 256, 288 . þe child dede þ e king to wit : of þis ilke þing, How nomon my&yogh;t his sone : bring in glading. Swyþe sory was þe king, : þo he herde þis. His sone he sette a day : to wende out I wis. Boþe hous&es; & stretis : so feyr he leet dy&yogh;te, þat he ne scholde finde no þing : þ t greuid his sy&yogh;te; Fayre hors he purueyed, : þ t he on ryde scholde, & greyþid hym to his wil : al þat he haue wolde. As he rood on atym, : twey seke men he mette, Ablind mon & amesel, : þ t ful fayr hym grette. Anon he clepid his mayster : & þus seyde hym two: Sey me for my loue, : what beþ þese ilke two? Seke men, he seyde, : þey beþ boþe I wis. Schal ech mon, quaþ þis oþer, : þ t leueþ, þole þis? Nay forsoþe, quaþ þis oþer. : þe child seyde þo: May me knowe þilke men, : þ t it schal come two? Nay I wis, quaþ þis oþer, : þe soþe of þis þing No man may wite : but god, heuin king. Hom þey went w t þ t word. : þ e child was sory, ffor he ne knew nou&yogh;t þis þing; : he nyst what do þer by. But euer, whan his fadir : & he to gedir were, In as moche as he my&yogh;t : he made glad chere. On a tyme as he rood, : an old mon he fond, wlaffing ist richt. Lesart, v. wlaffen = blaffen, to stammer. [Note added from Berichtigungen (p. XLIV); original note read: Ms. wlaffing mit unten verdicktem l, als ob dieses aus oder in e oder a corrigirt wäre; ist waffing oder waaffing = wavering (ags. vafjan) zu lesen? ] Bleryid & wlaffing : & stouping to þe ground, Schabbid he was, his nose dropping, : loþliche on to se. þis child askid anon, : what þis my&yogh;te be. Vor be ist se wegpunktirt . His maystir hym answerde: : so old mon he is, þat for pure elde : hym is come al þis. þe child askid anon: : schal ech mon þ&es; be falle? Nay I wis, quaþ þis oþer, : but ofte it doþ valle; Whan aman leuid so long, : þ&es; he wole fare.
