Schal he leue long, quaþ þis child, : er he come to þis care? — In foure score &yogh;er or an hondrid, : þow men it leue selde, & seþþe after, to soþe, : we wytyþ of elde. &YOGH;e moot me segge, quaþ þis child, : þe ende of þis þing. I wis, he seyde, to soþe : deþ is þe ending. Ms. þey seyde st. he seyde. þo seyde þis good child: : scholle men dey&yogh;e echon? &YOGH;e I wis, quaþ his mayster, : þer may ascape non. his aus þis corri|girt . Her on þou&yogh;t þis &yogh;ong child : boþe ny&yogh;t & day; So moche was his care : þ t telle it I ne may. Whan he was afore his fadir, : he made good chere, & pleyid & gamyd, : as hym no þing nere; Whan he was by hym self, : he gan to syke sore, & of þis ilke þing : fayn he wold lerne more. A monk þ t wonyd in desert, : þ t wel holy lyf ladde, Barlam he was hote, : þ t moche god dradde, He wiste þorw þe holygost : al þe child&es; þou&yogh;t. Abyt of marchaund he hym nom, : & god hym þedir brou&yogh;t. þe wey toward þis gode child : so longe he haþ nome, þ t to þe child&es; mayster : ry&yogh;t he is I come. Wel fayre he hym grette, : & seyde to hym þ&es;: Aryche marchaunt I am, : of ferne lond I wis; Apresyous ston I haue, : þ t &yogh;eueþ þe blinde sy&yogh;t, Deue men to here, : my ston haþ þ t my&yogh;t, Doume men for to speke, : halte men to goon, Fol&es; for to make wyse; : ne is þis a wondur stoon? Hedir I it haue brou&yogh;t : for þe child&es; sake; Ms. ursprünglich wyuis sake; dies ist wegpunktirt und child&es; sake dahinter geschrieben . &YOGH;if þ u makist me speke wit hym, : I wole it hym be take. þe child&es; mayster answerid: : broþer, leet me se & aproue þat ston, : &yogh;if he soch be, So þou hast me fore told; : ffor erst, be my leute, To take hym to iosaphat : tit þe no leue of me. Do wey, quaþ þis good mon, : I swere be my sleue: &YOGH;if þ u sey þ t ston, : he þe wold greue; þe übergeschrieben . ffor, þey my ston in some kind : be boþe good & ryche, In an oþer kind he harmyþ, : I segge þe trewelyche: Ms. segegge. He þat seþ my stoon : in clene lyf moot be, & clene y&yogh;en & gode haue, : or, I segge þe, He hym wole make blind anon, : or don hym harm more; & me þinkeþ to soþe : þ t þyn y&yogh;en beþ sore. Wel, quaþ þis child&es; mayster, : seþþe it so is, In clene lyf am I nou&yogh;t, : I know it wel I wis, & myn y&yogh;en beþ sore, : wel I woot, al so, þer fore I nele þy ston se, : lest he me harm do; To my lord I wille go : & do þe hym come to; þan my&yogh;tow þy fayre ston : schewe ry&yogh;t so. þo he com to Iosaphat, : þ e child fayre hym grette, & vppon þe bench : fayre he hym sette. Of o þing, quaþ barlam, : syre, þou has wel wrou&yogh;t: þat to þing þat semyþ feyr : þ u &yogh;euist þy wille nou&yogh;t. ffor a ryche king was sumtyme, : þ t rood in his chare Nobeliche about, : boþe her & þare. Pore men he mette aday : by þe wey gon. þou he were ryche king, : to hem he leep anon, þow þey were pore : & loþlich on to se. þe king to hem wel myldelich : sat adoun a kne, & dede hem wel gret honour. : þe men þ t w t hem were þer of hadde wondur : & speke to gedir þere: þat soche a king as he was ne scholde nou&yogh;t do so; But þer was non of hem : þ t dorst ondirneme hym þo. To his broþer þey told : afterward þis þing, & þe broþir askid seþþe, : why he did so, þe king. þe king answerid: to morwe : come hedir erliche to me, & I wille of þis þing : þe soþe telle þe. þis king hadde a wondir wone to hy & to lowe: Whan aman damnyd be, : þe king wolde blowe At his &yogh;ate, þ t were dampnyd, : atrompe; þ t fel þer two, To schewe þ t he were tretour, : & dampnyd al so. þe king anon on euin : his troumpour haþ sent To bloue at his broþer &yogh;ate, : to schewe his iugement. Allas, quaþ his broþer, : what haue I mys do nowe? I here my lord&es; trompour : at my &yogh;ate blowe, Now I woot to soþe : þ t I worþ vndo; God woot þ t I haue : nou&yogh;t agilt þer to. þis mon gan hym dy&yogh;te : & mad his testament, ffor he wend to soþe : to be hangid or schent. In foule cloþ&es; on morw&yogh; : to þe king&es; &yogh;ate he com. þo þe portor it wist, : fayre he him in nom, & haþ hym fayre anon ry&yogh;t : to fore þe king brou&yogh;t. To fore þe king he fel on kne, : & fayre hym be sou&yogh;t: I noot what I haue þe agilt : in word ne in þou&yogh;t; Haue mercy on me : for his loue þ t þe bou&yogh;t! þan seyde þe king: : arys! what eyliþ þe? I noot noþing þ t þ u hast : mys do a &yogh;en me; Syre, me þinkeþ þ u dredist : þe blast of my beme, I au&yogh;t to dred sorere, : &yogh;if þ u took &yogh;eme, þilke lord&es; beme : þat god & mon is, To whom boþe ny&yogh;t & day : I do to moche amys; I may deme þy body, : of þy soule haue I no my&yogh;t, & he may boþe body & soule : to his wille dy&yogh;t; þy bodylich pyne : wold be doon in a day, But þe pyne of þe soule, : þ u wost wel, lastiþ ay. þou me askedist &yogh;ister day : a wel wondir þing: Why I honourid pore men, : & I am so hy a king? Im Ms. ist was wegpunktirt und I am übergeschrieben . þat my lord&es; trompour&es; : I woot to soþe it were, þat boþe day & ny&yogh;t : bloueþ in myn ere, & biddiþ me þ t I schold : come to mendement, Lest I be to helle dampnid : þorw&yogh; pure iugement. Allas þilke hard doom, : þat mon schal so be schent, Whan þe wrecche soule : is to helle went! Now wost þe reson, : þ t þ u me askedist er; hinter wost fehlt þow. Sykir, leue broþer, : I dede it for fer. þe king leet make : foure fatis anon. þe twey&yogh;e he leet gilde wit out : & feyr be goon, Of stinking bon&es; : þeke he leet fille, hinter he fehlt hem. Vnneþe me dede hem þer in, : so foul it gan smelle. þe oþer twey he leet smere : wit pych & ter al so, & wit gold & ryche ston&es; : filde hem bo. After þilke wreyeris : he leet sende þere, & askid, of þe fatis : woch þe rycher were. & þey hym answerid : & seyd anon: þilke two þ t were : wit gold so be gon. þe king heet anon ry&yogh;t : þat þey were vndo; Soche asmel þer com out : of þo fatis two, þat vnneþe anyman : my&yogh;t þer a boute byde. þus it fariþ, quaþ þe king, : by þis world&es; pryde; Feyr it gloriþ w t oute, : wit inne it is nou&yogh;t; Mony monn&es; soule : to helle it haþ brou&yogh;t. þo leet þe king anon : vndo þ t oþer two; Gold ryche & ston&es; : me fond in hem þo. þus it faryþ, quaþ þe king, : by pore men I wis, þ t wit gode verteuis : winnyþ heuin blis; Wit oute þey beþ loþlich, : w t inne ryche, For þey leue hard lyf : & hat sinne treuliche. Here &yogh;e mowe þe soþe : alle men I se, Wheyþer of þese two vesselis : schold honourid be; hinter two ist ein w wegpunktirt . But þe world doþ a mys : & honouriþ rychesse, & takiþ wel lyte kep : to come in any goodnesse; þerfore mon moot nede, : þ t wole to god be take, Leue his oune wille : & þis world forsake. After þat þis king seyd, : Iosaphat, I rede þe, þat þ u loue ihū crist, : þ t deyde on þe tre. &YOGH;it barlam hym told : an oþer þing I wis: Ihū crist hym selue, : þat god & man is; He haþ in hym self : fayr kynd&es; þre, Holy writ w t nessiþ it : & haþ I told it me: I vor told ist undeutlich . ffadir he is, & ek sone, : & ek holy gost; & alle þing he made : þ t þ u seyst & wost. seyst = siehst, wie v. 437 . Mon he made to haue be : euer in paradys, Amon it a gilte : þorw an appil I wis; God hym seyde þat he schold : euere leue in wele & blisse, & of his oune wille : neuere more to mysse; But an oþer þing þer to : god to mon be heet: þat he scholde dey&yogh;e, : &yogh;if he þe appil eet, & lese alle merþe : & þole alle wo. & out of paradis I cast : sekir he was so, ffor he ete þe appil : þorw þe deuelis spelle; Vor ete ist ein h wegpunktirt . God hym &yogh;af an hard doom, : his soule went to helle, & al þat of hym com, : for soþe ich segge þe, So wroþ was god w t mon, : þat he nold hym se. Mon hadde god for&yogh;ete, : þat on hym þou&yogh;t he nou&yogh;t, But w t his oune hondin : he haþ hym I wrou&yogh;t; & honouriþ &yogh;it, so þ u sest, : his oune werching, & forsakiþ þilke god : þat made alle þing. A boue mon wente atyme : & wit his bowe pleyde; ff. Diese Erzählung fehlt im Mhd. Gedicht . Alytil brid he cau&yogh;te, : þ t reuelich to hym seyde: I bidde þe for þy lord&es; loue, : haue mercy on me! For lytil good þ u schalt winne, : þo u þ t þ u me sle; Leet me freliche leue : & in my wey fle, & I þe wole teche anon : wisdom&es; þre; & &yogh;if þ u hem holde, : þ u schalt þe beter be. Do sey, quaþ þis oþer, : & þ u schalt haue lyf of me. — Ne leue þ u neuer alle þing : þ t þ u my&yogh;t here, For men lyeþ ofte moche, : whan þey speke I fere; Ne sorwe þ u nou&yogh;t to sore : for þing þat is lore, &yogh;if it ne may be found, : ne sorw þ u nou&yogh;t þer fore; Ne desire þ u neuer þ t þing : þ t þ u my&yogh;t haue nou&yogh;t, For I wis al soche wil : comyþ of idil þou&yogh;t. Mafey, quaþ þis good mon, : soþ þ u seyst to me. & wit þilke word : þe brid he leet fle. þo it was vp on hy, : þ e brid hym seyd to: I wis þ u dedist gret foly&yogh;e, : þo þ u leet me go, ffor among my gott&es; : I haue aryche ston, Also gret as an ey&yogh;, : gret verteu is þer on; Hadde þ u me slaue : & þ t ston take, Euere þ u haddist be ryche : for þ e ston&es; sake; But for þ u hast þe ston lore, : I wis þ u hast mys do. þo þ e mon þis herd, : sykir hym was ful wo, & for þe lore of þis ston : he gan to syke sore, & þou&yogh;te how&yogh; he my&yogh;te : þe brid cacche more. Brid, he seyde, cum to me, : &, whil þ u art alyue, I wole þe finde at þy nede, : at hom w t my wyue; Afeyr cage I wille make : for þe loue of þe, & in ioy & in myrþ : þer in þ u schalt be; Moche þ u schalt her after : haue þy wille; Ne be þ u noþing a drad : þat me schal þe spille! fforþ fley þis lyte brid, : & nold no leng abyde. þis &yogh;ong mon wente wit his bou&yogh; : euere be syde, & prouid al þ t he my&yogh;t, : þ s bryd for to sle. þ e wisdom&es;, quaþ þ e bryd, þ t I þe tau&yogh;t : þ u hast lore alle þre; Herkene now how, : & I þe wolle telle. Beter Is haue þan weche(!),: & go, &yogh;if þ u schalt dey&yogh;e, þa n dwelle. A ston, so gret as an ey, : how my&yogh;t in my wombe be? Al my body is nou&yogh;t so gret, : as ech mon may se. þ u schet for to haue þ t , : þou ne my&yogh;t come þer two, Vor þ u fehlt wol þou. For I þe segge þ u ne schalt : haue me neuere me. Wel I woot þ u art sory, : for þ u me hast lore; þ u dost þer of foly&yogh;e, : I for bede it þe be fore. þ&es; it fariþ be men of þis world, : þat leueþ amys Vppon here false god&es;, : þ t here oune werk is; þey sekeþ help of here god&es;, : þ t mowe nou&yogh;t do, & bydde of hem mony þing, : þ t þey ne mowe come two; Wel me may wite to sooþ : þ t þey beþ deue & doumbe, & hem selue helpe ne mowe, : sekir, in no stounde. þis world is to hem lych; : who so trist þer two, Moche he worþ be gylyd, : al day we fynde so; þ u seyst þ t þis world : tornyþ vp so doun; Now mon is in feld, : & now he is in toun, I ne finde nomon : þ t may dayis þre ffor noþing þat he may do : in one stede be; For þe flesch is so lostful : þ t synnyþ, ech day It falliþ in to sinne, : forsoþe telle I may. So þat mon moot hym self : & þis world forsake, &YOGH;if he wille hym self : redy to god make. I woot þ t þey beþ I lyche, : þ t þis world louiþ þ&es;, To amon þ t me telleþ of : in prouerbis I wis. Amon wente atyme, : so we fynde in geste, Hym self for to pley&yogh;e, : in wilde foreste. An vnycorn hym mette, : þat þou&yogh;t hym to sle. For doute of þe deþ : þis mon gan to fle. þe vny corn ran swyþe, : þe mon fley&yogh; euer mo; So þ t he com to a dep pit; : he fel wel ny&yogh; þo. By abou&yogh; of a lyte tre : anon he hym hent, & held hym swyþe faste, : þat he a doun ne went. To þe ground of þe pit : he gan to loke þo: Aswyþe grisliche dragoun : he sey on grounde go; For to cacche þis mon : he &yogh;enede faste; Fer com out of his mouþ : at eueriche ablaste. Vppon þ e rote of þe tre : twey mees he sey&yogh;, þ t hadde al þe rote : frete wel ny&yogh;; þ t o mous was whit, : þ t oþer blak was; Me þinkeþ þis mon : was in a wondir cas. In þat stede þer he stood : he say&yogh; addris foure, þ t pot out of þe erþe here hedis : & on hym gonne loure. In þe crop of þe tre : he say an honys drope; For þe swetnesse þer of : þer on he cast his hope; Al þe peril for &yogh;at he, : þ t he was in I do, For þ e swetnesse of þe hony : þ t he say þer þo. Who my&yogh;te aske þilke mon, : &yogh;if he ne did foly&yogh;e? I wene neuer mon, : but he wolde ly&yogh;e. By þe ony corn, þat I of telle, : deþ I ondirstonde, þat hontyþ boþe man & best, : & al þ t is in londe; þou he fle neuer so fast, : ech mon dey&yogh;e schal; Deþ ne spariþ noþing, : I woot, it chastiþ al. þe pit is þis world, : þat is so ful of wo, Of couetyse & enui&yogh;e : & of wraþþe al so, & of oþer sinn&es;, þ t beþ many & fale; Nys nomon on lyue : þ t hem may telle by tale. þe lytil tre is monn&es; lyf, : þ t is so vnstedefast, þat wit mony perilis a doun is I cast: Wit syknesse & w t elde : & w t slau&yogh;t also; Nys no mon on lyue : þ t may triste þer two. þe dragon in þe pitt&es; ground, : helle mouþ it is, þat &yogh;enyþ after mann&es; soule : ny&yogh;t & day I wis; þer is boþe pyne & wep, : þ t lastiþ w t oute ende; Wo is hym on lyue : þ t þedir schal wende. þe whyte mous & þe blak, : þ t han þe tre I bete, Beþ þe ny&yogh;t & þe day, : ech man may wite; Ech of hem amossel takiþ : of monn&es; lyf; How he may be glad, : I not, for child ne wif. þe foure addrin beþ foure element&es;, : þ t be trende þe tre, & by here my&yogh;t wilwid : þat it I schortid be; Foure tym&es; of þ e &yogh;er : þey mowe be al so, þat euerich schortiþ monn&es; lyf, : go wher euer he go. þe lytil hony, þ t he say, : is þis world&es; blis, þat wel lytil is worþ, : ech mon woot þis; For þer was here ne ellis whare : neuer no mon : doppelt, nach ne und nach whare. þat leuid on erþe þre dayis : wit oute care non. Lo þese &yogh;onge childrin : þat ondirstonde nou&yogh;t: By here wep me may wite : In care þey be brou&yogh;t. Whan me seþ it is lyte worþ, : þis wikkid wor(l)d&es; blis, Ms. word&es; st. world&es;. Me þinkeþ þ t eche mon doþ : al to moche amys, &YOGH;if he for a lyte swetnesse : trist to moche þer two, & for&yogh;ete þe perelis : þ t he is in I do. Ms. perelis, e scheint in i corrigirt . How man may triste lyte to þis world, : by on lytil spelle, Who so wole vndirstonde, : forsoþe I may telle. Aman lyuid a tyme : þ t hadde frend&es; þre; More he louid þat on þan hym self, : &yogh;if it my&yogh;te be; As moche as hym self : þ t oþer he louid þo, & wold by his my&yogh;t : euere for hym do; þe þridde he louid a lyte : & for hym he did. þis good mon was bayly : of aryche sted, þer he lyuid long, & hadde his wille I wis long überge|schrieben . Of þ t ilke ryche stede : & alle þ t þer inne is. I wreyid was seþþe þis good mon : to þ e king wel faste. þe king hym ofscnte, : his acount&es; to caste. þo nyste þis good mon : what on erþe to do; He caryd boþe ny&yogh;t & day, : & þolid moche wo, By hym self he wep : & made moche mone, ffor he ne hadde of his acount&es; : knowleche none. þer nas clerk þ t coude þo : help hym þer two, & nedis his a count&es; : he moste &yogh;eue þo. To my frend&es;, he þou&yogh;t, : I wille anon go & look, wher þey wole now&yogh; : any help me do; My frend&es; þey were, : þey seydin er þis, Whil I hadde my wille : of þese world&es; blis; &yogh;if þat þey beþ kynde, : &yogh;it þey beþ al so, þey nelle me nou&yogh;t forsake, : þou I be falle In wo. Anon to þilke frend : he wente be fore. þat he louid as hym self, : & aparty more. Ly&yogh;tliche he was wel comyd, : as hym þou&yogh;te þare, So men beþ comeliche : þ t beþ falle in care. comeliche st. comenliche. þis mon seyd : leue frend, : moche I triste to þe, þ t þ u me helpe in my (nede) : for loue I bidde þe; hinter my fehlt nede im Ms. þenk vppon þe gret loue, : þ t þ u hast louid me, In my grete nede, : for loue I bidde þe; For I me drede sore : lest þ t I be schent, To &yogh;ild myn acount&es; : þe king me haþ of sent. & he hym answerid schortly: : what is þ t to me? &YOGH;if þou hast wel I do, : þe bet þou schalt be; Euil moot he falle : þ t afoot wit þe go! I knowe þe nou&yogh;t, : what schold I wit þe do? Oþer frend&es; I haue, : to dwelle w t I wis, Hem I wille glade, : & make ioy & blis, For w t me þey dwelliþ : al þis longe day; Good mon, dwelle nou&yogh;t, : but go forþ in þy way! þis good mon be þou&yogh;t hym, : & was aschamyd sore, & þou&yogh;te þ t to þilke frend : he my&yogh;te triste na more. &YOGH;ern he bad godd&es; help, : sykir hym was ful wo; & to his oþer frend sekir : he gan go. To hym he seyde : leue frend, : þ u wost wel, or þis þ u me louedist moche, : þo I was in my blis; Help me in my tene, : for loue I bidde þe! To &yogh;ilde myn a count&es; : þ e king haþ sent for me. Sertis, quaþ þis oþer frend, : þy tene greueþ me sore; & wel þ u wite to soþe : þat I nele do na more: To þe castel &yogh;ate : wit þe I wille go, & seþþe torne hom a &yogh;en, : whan I haue do so; So moche I haue to done, : þ t I ne may tent to þe; þ u most do þy beste, : &yogh;if it þy wille be, ffor, be þou sykir, I nele, : for no maner sake, Let be myn oune werk : & to an oþer take. Carful was þis good mon : & wente þenn&es; þo; Helples he was in his nede : for hem boþe two. Me þinkeþ þ t his loue : was euil be sette; I rede ech man his loue : to be set bette. To his þridde frend : þis sely mon is go, & al haþ to hym told : his care & his wo. Leue frend, he seyde, : it greueþ me wel sore, Whyl I was of my&yogh;t, : þ t I ne did for þe more; But for þe lyte loue, : þat I haue louid þe, In my grete nede I : bidde þ u helpe me; My lord haþ after me sent, : þer of me stont drede, & I woot, wit oute þe : ne may I nou&yogh;t spede. Be stille, quaþ þis oþer, : þer of is non ey&yogh;e; I wole þe helpe : by alle þilke wey&yogh;e: Be fore þe lord my self : I wole wit þe go, & &yogh;ilde þe þy mede, : þ t þ u hast for me do; For ech peny worþ good, : þ t þ u hast me do, I wole þe &yogh;eue an hondrid, : seþþe þ u hast nede þer two, & I wole þe helpe, : be þ u nou&yogh;t a gast! þat þ u ne schalt for no þing : In presoun ben I cast; & be sykir euere mo, : whil þ t I may stond, þou ne schalt be take : in to þy fomen hond. þis was a good frend, : for to triste to; Leuere I hadde soch afrend : þan þe oþer two. þe ferste frend þ t was so fals, : þat I of told, þ t amon more þan hym self : on erþe loue wold, It is world&es; catel, : þ t fayliþ at þe nede; fayliþ aus falliþ corrigirt; Ms. urspr . ne nede, zu nede cor|rigirt . He þat most it gadirit : most liueþ in drede, ffor worldis good hem doþ : in peril & in wo, & mony mon for world&es; good : beþ to deþe do; mon st. men. þou amon it loue moch, : it &yogh;ildiþ liþer mede, & mon þ t it seruiþ : ne may to heuin spede, ffor mon ne may I fere, : for nou&yogh;t þ t he may do, Serue wel þe false world : & oure lord also; þerfore mon haþ fre wille, : þ t he may wel chese ffor to winne heuin : oþer to lese. þat oþer frend þat I of spak : ofte me seþ, ffor monn&es; wif & childrin : & erþelich þing it beþ; To þe pitt&es; brinke : wit þe dede þey wille go, & seþþe torne hom, : here ded&es; for to do. Gold, seluer, & lond : þou he haue be &yogh;ete, Wit inne twey &yogh;er or þre : sone he worþ for &yogh;ete. Asely almesse bred for hym : oþer whyle me wole &yogh;eue, Wherþoru þe sely soule : mow þe beter leue; So may þe sely soule : ligge wel long In þe pyne of purgatory, : & be pynyd strong, Er eny of his frend&es; : ary&yogh;t hym wil helpe. þat þey beþ gode frend&es;, : I not he may &yogh;elpe. undeutlich, ob he oder ho. þe þridde frend þ t I of spak, : þ t was trewe & gode, þat þis mon In is wele : wel lyte ondirstode: Ms is In wele, st. In is wele. Hope loue & truþe : & oþer almes dede, fehlt it beþ. þat mon scholde loue wel : þat scholde good lyf lede. But þese gode þeuis : of lond beþ dreue echone þorw&yogh; wraþþe pride & couetyse, : þ t beþ here fone; þerfore þis fals world : goþ by experment; & men for defaute of loue : ofte beþ I schent. þe preson, þ t he schold in be do, : þ t is þe pyne of helle, þ t for defaute of acount&es; : mon schal in dwelle. þe dedis of his lyf : schal his acount&es; be; þer to ech mon mot tak kep : þat hopiþ sauid to be. Good is þ t ech mon þenk, : þ t he ne fayle nou&yogh;t, How he haþ his lyf leuid, : in werk word & þou&yogh;t. þ e soumme of his a count&es; : man mot a &yogh;er take Swyþe mony tym&es;, : good acount&es; to make; For at euery tyme : þ t mon haþ sinne do, Forme of a count&es; : he moot make þer two; ffor euery mys dede : In dette he is I wis For to &yogh;eue acount&es;, : & ellis he doþ amys. But þe tayl be to broke : & þe gilt for &yogh;eue, Monn&es; soule may nou&yogh;t : in heuen blisse leue. Ech day mon be houiþ : his tayl to breke, Er, I woot to soþe, : in helle he schal be steke; er st. or. Oþer at on a count&es; : amon may breke echon, But beter it were, me þinkeþ, to breke on & on. þe fomen, fro whom he wold hym kep, : þe deuelis beþ I wis, þ t makiþ monn&es; soule : euer to don amys; Ist bodi st. soule zu lesen? þ u þe soule it witsegge, : & þe dede be I do, For þ t ilke dede : to pyne þey scholle bo; Worse fon þer beþ none, : þan þey beþ I wis, For þey fondiþ w t here my&yogh;t : to make men don amys. þerfore I rede ech man : kepe hym fro his foon, & purchase soche frend&es; : þat he mowe triste vppon. How mon hym schal dy&yogh;te : her in world þis, &YOGH;if he wole wit hele : come to heuin blis, By atale me my&yogh;t lerne, : who so wold here, Vor here ist lerne wegpunktirt . þat he my&yogh;t his lyf lede : in þ c beter manere. A maner was in a contre, : þ t ech &yogh;er chese þey wold A prince, astrong mon : þ t hem gouerne schold; þat man king scholde be, : ac at serteyn tyme I wis, But nomon scholde wite : woch were tyme his; For þ e men of þe contre, : whan here tyme com, Out of þe lond hym wold fleme : al w t oute doom In to aserteyn yle, : þer he schold dwelle, To suffre sorwe & wo : more þan I may telle. On atyme it be fel, : astrong mon þey tokin & made hym king of þe lond, : hem alle for to lokin. þis man hym so be louid : w t men of þe contre, & suffrid ech of hem : his mayster to be: Al þ t þey wold rede, : al þ t þey wold do, Ms. þey in der letzten Hlbz. st. he. & wende hem fynde frend&es;, : & fond hem as fo; For, þo þey sey here tyme, : þey nom hym at þ e last & wit moche schame : out of þe lond hym cast. þer he lay wel longe : & þolyd pyne & wo, Ms. rorw&yogh; st. sorw&yogh;. Ne my&yogh;te nomon telle þe sorw&yogh; : þ t he þolid þo. þo þis man was out cast, : an oþer þey ches anon To be king of þe lond : & weld hem ech on. þe king, þo he was chose, : was wel war By þ e king afore hym, : þ t was mad so bar : In to þe yle, þ t I of spak, : þ e tresour he hent, Ms. Ihc st. he verschrieben . Wit wel trewe messager&es; : anon þedir it sent, In moche wele & ryches : for he wolde lyue, Whan he were par auenture : in to þis yle I dreue; þerfore he haþ in þe yle : his tresour I do. Al redy he it fond, : þo he com þer two. þe contre þ t I of told, : þe foule world it is; þe borgeys of þe contre : sinn&es; it beþ y wis, As pride gloteny & couetys, : & oþer sinn&es; also, þat euere dwelliþ in þis world, : go mon wher he go. þe strong mon þ t is king, : þ t is, I ondirstonde, Euerymon & woman : þ t leuiþ in þis londe. Kyng þey beþ chose I wis : hem self for to gy&yogh;e, & to do wel oþer wroþerhele : he hadde þe maystry&yogh;e. þis yle, wel I woot, : purgatory&yogh;e is, þat mon schal inne dwelle, : after he doþ amys. þ e tresour is worldis good, : þ t ech mon w t his my&yogh;t Strengþith hym to winne : boþe day & ny&yogh;t. &YOGH;if he send his tresour : be fore in to þe yle Ms. int mit weg|punktirtem t. By pore men for godd&es; loue, : he noot woch whyle Ech peny & peneworþ : þer he schal fyinde, & he may loke after þat, : þat he leueþ be hinde. I rede þerfore þ t nomon : triste to haue socoure Of non erþeliche frend, : ne of non secatoure, But do so þ t he mowe : his tresour finde wel, ffor þ t he leueþ be hinde hym : he leseþ ech a del; & þou me wele hym ou&yogh;t &yogh;eue, : it worþ late & long, þou þ e soule ligge : in peyne swyþe strong. þo he hadde al þis I seyd, : þe child hym answerid anon: Syre, god &yogh;ilde þe þy reed! : w t þ e I wele goon, &YOGH;if it be þy wille, : I nele neuere mo Parte out of þy company, : for wele ne for wo. Barlam hym answerid : : &yogh;if þ u do þis, To aryche monn&es; sone : þ u art lych I wis: A gret lord&es; dou&yogh;ter : to wyue he schold take. Ms. þ u schalt st. he schold. He answerid & seyd, : he nolde haue no make. & for he nold in no wis : to here I spousid be, Out of his fadir lond : wel fer he gan fle. Forþ he went in his wey, : as god hym had dy&yogh;t, & at alyte pore hous : his in he took any&yogh;t. þo it be fel to þe tyme, : he to his bed gan go; & þo he hadde a whyle I ley&yogh;e, : be syde he lokid þo, & sey þe pore monn&es; dou&yogh;ter, : þ t &yogh;he knelid a doun & þonkid god swyþe : in here orysoun. Moche wondir hym þou&yogh;t : þat &yogh;he dede so, For hym þou&yogh;t þ t god here had : lyte good do. Ms. hele st. here. To þe mayde he spak þer of, : & askid, how it were þ t &yogh;he þankid so god : for lytil good þere; & seyd to here : þou þy god : þe hadde &yogh;oue gold & fe, þ u ne my&yogh;tist hym more þonk, : al so þinkeþ me. þe pore mayde answerde : & seyde to hym þis: þe hy&yogh;e god of heuene : I wile honoure I wis, For, as lytil medesyne : gret euil doþ a wey, Al so alyte world&es; good : wel moche helpe may. To maner godis, I find, : þer beþ in world þis : þ t on nys nou&yogh;t oure, : I woot wel I wis, þ t oþer is oure oune, : whil godd&es; wille is: þ t beþ oure fyf wittis, : þ t he leneþ vs I wis; To some men he lenyþ some, : & to some men echon; þ e more þat he vs lenyþ, : þ e more þonk is þer on. þe worldis good is nou&yogh;te oure, : for nou&yogh;t it wele go, Ms. it nou&yogh;te:, mit wegpunktirtem n, u . t in nou&yogh;te aus r (oder þ) corrigirt; es ist wol zu lesen is nou&yogh;t(e); in der 2. Hlbz. sollte es heissen for for nou&yogh;t. & for it wole by on whyle : a&yogh;en come vs two; & now it wole al clene : erþelich men forsake, u . 4 Im Ms. nicht deutlich ob wole oder wele zu lesen . & now it wole holliche : to aman hym be take. To an heep of snow&yogh; : likene it I may, þ t is to day wel breme, : & to morw molt a way. Erþeliche good he haþ me be nome, : þ t me ne trist nou&yogh;t, But myne fyf witt&es; : he haþ be nome nou&yogh;t. After his lyk nesse : he haþ mad me, & to my seruise &yogh;oue : al þ t I may se; He haþ me grantid : þat I haue knowleching Of good & of harm, : to kepe me fro sinnyng. To his blis he haþ me clepid : þorw his holy grace, & in heuin he haþ mad : þ t I haue aplace. þerfore I hym wole honoure, : as ry&yogh;t is, For þilke grete &yogh;(i)ft&es;, : ellis I dede amys. Ms. &yogh;ft&es; st. &yogh;ift&es;. þo he þis herd, : his wil com hym wel blyue þat þis pore mayde : he wold haue to wyue. To here fadir he went, : & haþ of hym I bede þat he hym to wyue &yogh;eue : his dou&yogh;ter in þe stede. þe pore mon answerid: : vnkinde it were to þe, Hinter to ist me wegpunktirt . Soche apore womon : þy wif for to be. Euer more þis child : bad wel &yogh;erne I wis; & þe fadir answerid : & seyde to hym þis: I ne may þis mayde : &yogh;eue þe nou&yogh;t to spouse, &YOGH;if þ u here wole lede : to þy fadir house; For I ne haue no dou&yogh;ter, : þou wost wel, but here on, & I woot wel þat gret eld : is come me vppon; &YOGH;if þou wolt here haue, : sekir I segge þe þat &yogh;e moot boþe : dwelle here wit me. þis &yogh;ong mon answerid : wit speche wel stille: Wit þe I wille be leue : & be at þy wille. His ryche cloþ&es; he of did, : & oþer abit to hym nom, & to þis old pore mon : wel bouxum he be com. þis &yogh;ong mon he be tok : his dou&yogh;ter to wyue. Boþe þey hym seruid : wit here my&yogh;t wel blyue. þo þis old man had : þis &yogh;ong mon asayid & in his seruise : swyþe wel apayid, In to his chaumbir on a day : þis &yogh;ong mon he ladde, & scheuid hym þe tresour : þ t he þer in hadde. þo þis &yogh;ong mon it say, : to wondre he be gan; Hym þou&yogh;t rycher tresour : hadde neuer no man. Now&yogh;, quaþ þis old mon, : for þ u hast seruid me, Al þis tresour anon : I wole it &yogh;eue þe, þat & moche more : I wille her after schewe; þ t þ u hast seruid me, : ne schal þe noþing rewe. Allas, quaþ Josaphat, : þis is seyd be me, & wel I woot to soþe, : it au&yogh;te wel to be, & wel I woot to soþ, : of me þ u my&yogh;t it make; þerfore, &yogh;if it were þy wille, : I wold me be take. & &yogh;if it were þy wille, : I wold wyte of þe Of hou mony &yogh;er&es;: þ t þ u old be. I wot, quaþ þis oþer, fyf & sixty &yogh;er : myn elde is. &YOGH;e I wis, quaþ iosaphat, : & more I wis, ffor I it may segge : al wit oute wene þ t þ u art of elde : sixty &yogh;er & tene. Sykir, quaþ barlam, : þ u hast wel ondirstonde I wis Alle þe &yogh;er&es; þ t I haue : leuid in world þis; But fyue & syxty &yogh;er : I haue cristin mon be: þilke I au&yogh;t acounte, I wis, : so þinkeþ me; þe oþer a counte I nou&yogh;t, : ne nele neuere mo, For I woot þ t I was : in mys be leue þo; & I wone forsoþe : in þe wildirnes of samar. Wolde god, quaþ iosaphat, : þat we were boþe þar! & þedir I wole now&yogh; : wit þy leue go w t þe. Wite it wel, quaþ barlam, : it may nou&yogh;t so be, ffor wel I woot to soþe, : fro me þ u worst take, & mony holy men slawe : schol be for þy sake; But þou schalt at þy wille : come þedir to me; But cristni þe I wille, : &yogh;if þ u wolt it so be. I wis, quaþ þis oþer, : al redy I am þer two; Swyþe glad were I, : were þ t I do. Josaphat was cristenyd : þ o of barlam. & after he hym kiste, : þo he his leue nam: In to desert he went, : godd&es; wil to abyde. þat Josaphat was cristenyd : anon me wiste wyde. So þ t it com sone : to auenne þe king. Im Anfange, vor so, steht im Ms. ein o, welches zu tilgen . Wel I woot, sory he was, : þ o he herd þe tyding. Allas, seyde auenne, : my sone is for lore; Me for þinkeþ þ t euer : he was I bore; & I ne haue, wel &yogh;e witeþ, : sone but hym on, & þou I wolde, quaþ þe king, : þat his lyf dayis were doon. I wold, quaþ þe king, : he were brou&yogh;t afore me, þat I my&yogh;t þ e soþe wite, : what his encheson be. Anon wit þilkc word : Josaphat me nam & askid, who hym tau&yogh;te. : he seyde: barlam. Arachis het a gret lord : þat w t þe king was þo. I woot, he seyde to þe king, : ful wel what þ u schalt do: An old ermyte I knowe, : in þy lond nys non soche, In body he is & in spech : barlam I liche, He be leueþ trewliche : on oure lawe; &YOGH;if þ u after hym send, : he wole be wel fawe; Send after hym quiklich : þ t he come þe two, & al þ t barlam haþ seyd, : I woot he wol vn do; vor vndo ist do wegpunktirt . fferst he schal him feyne : þ t he cristin is, & after he schal ben ouer come, : & wel suffre þis. Arachis & þe king þo : in to wildirnesse gan wende, For to nyme barlam, : &yogh;if þey my&yogh;t come hym hende. þo þey sey þ t þey ne my&yogh;t : barlam finde nou&yogh;t, Nacor for hym þey haue nome : & to þe court brou&yogh;t. Al þ t he schold do : þey tau&yogh;t hym be þe wey&yogh;e. He seyde, he wold gladlich, : & leue for non ey&yogh;e. Anon þo þe king was : hom to court I come, Me tolde to Josaphat : hou barlam was I nome. Sore wep þis &yogh;ong mon : þo for þilk tydinge, His y&yogh;en he cast vp to heuin : & his hondin gan wringe. Lord, he seyde, ihū crist, : what schal barlam do? I woot, my fadir wold fayn : þ t he were for do; I nold in no wise : þ t he deyd for me, Fayn I wold hym helpe : on lyue to be. Wit þat ilke word : an aungel to hym aly&yogh;te. þe &yogh;ong mon was a gast, : for he schon so bry&yogh;te. Josaphat, he seyde, : ne drede no þinge þe! Barlam is in þe stede : þer he au&yogh;t to be; Ms. barlan st. barlam. It is nou&yogh;t barlam, : but it nacor is, þat þy fadir haþ of sent, : to gyle þe I wis; þerfore doþ god þe to wit : þat þ u ne be a gast, For þorw&yogh; þe schal nacor : of þis lyf be cast. Wit þat ilke word : þe aungel to heuin went. Josaphat þonkid god : of grace þ t he sent. vor grace fehlt þe. þe fadir wente to his sone : & to hym seyde þis: I haue nome barlam, : þ t tau&yogh;t þe of ihesus; þe aus me corrigirt . I noot wher þ u it finde : to anoy&yogh;e so me: So feyr I haue be my my&yogh;t : euer honourid þe; Wel þ u wost how þ u hast : chaungid my fare, ffor þ u hast my moche wele : tornyd in to care; Myn hore lokk&es; þ u hast mad : me for to drawe, & I ne may þonk þe more : þan þou me haddist slawe; þe ly&yogh;t of myn y&yogh;en : þ u hast mad aslake, For þou hast take to god : & myne god&es; forsake. ffadir, quaþ iosephat, : god þ u þonke my&yogh;t: I haue forsake derknes : & am I come to ly&yogh;t, ffro al manere falsnesse : I me haue dy&yogh;t, & þorw þe help of ihū crist : I am take to ry&yogh;t; Ms. ilū st. ihū. þerfore I þe bidde, : on ydil trauayl þou nou&yogh;t, For þ u schalt fro ihū crist : neuere torne my þou&yogh;t; Whan þ u my&yogh;t heuin : areche wit þin hond & drey&yogh;e þ e water of þe se, : so þ t þ u se al lond, þan my&yogh;tow, forsoþe, : fadir, I segge þe, ffro crist&es; seruise : ry&yogh;t so bringe me. Allas, sone, quaþ þe king, : who haþ do me þis sorwe? But I þ t haue foluid þy wil : on euin & on morwe? Nas neuer king þ t my&yogh;t : his sone do More þan I haue do to þe, : & þ u seruist me so! þerfore, I se, þou art : a&yogh;en myn heed aryse; se aus so corrigirt . Wel au&yogh;t here afterward : oþer men by me agryse ffor to do his sone honour, : as I haue do þe, Lest he aryse a&yogh;en hym, : as þ u art a &yogh;en me. Wel seyde þe clerk&es;, : þ t tolde me fore In þe tym þ t þ u wer : of þy modir bore: Vn buxum, þey seyde, : þ u scholdist be al þy lyf, & a&yogh;en alle oure god&es; : w t þy my&yogh;t strif. þerfore I segge: : but þ u do after me, Euer more her after : þy foman I wole be; þer was neuer fomon to oþer : þ t dede so moche wo, As I wole her after : wit my my&yogh;t þe do. Josaphat answerid: : &yogh;if þ u art fadir myn, &yogh;if I torne to gode : it is manschipe þin; But ech fadir for his sone : ou&yogh;t glad be, Whan þe sone to gode tornyd, : I wis, so þinkeþ me; & I þe segge for soþe: : &yogh;if þe ruiþ my gode, I ne hold þe nou&yogh;t my fadir, : but I hold þe wode; þerfore I þe segge, : & wite it to soþe: &yogh;if þ u me greuist her after, : I nele nau&yogh;t come to þe, But, as þ u were an addre : þ u woldist me stinge, fehlt wol & in der 2. Hlbz., oder þ u st. þ t. I wole þe fle, but þ u þ e chast : of þis ilke þinge; Ne I nele neuere more : fadir clepe þe; þerfore do what þy wille is, : & tak no kep of me! þan wente þe king, : þo (he) herde þis, vor herde fehlt he. What for sorw & for wraþ, : ny wood I wis. To arachis, his gode frend, : he told al þis þing; & he wit fayre word&es; : þ&es; seyde to þe king: For I wene me schal : childrin w t fayr speche Beter chastise, þan me schal : wit beting & w t wreke . . . . . fehlt ein Verspaar . þo on morwe be king com, : & kyste his sone swete, & bad hym þ t he schold : his foly for lete. Leue sone, he seyde, : lo myn hed is hor; þ t þ u me hast gramyd : þin hert au&yogh;t be sor; Woldistou leue þy foly&yogh;e : & do after me, Boþe vs my&yogh;t on lyue : þ e beter þanne be; þou wost wel þ t þy be leue : au&yogh;t be ry&yogh;t nou&yogh;t, For who þer on be leuiþ, : to deþe he is sone brou&yogh;t; & ech sone to his fadir au&yogh;t buxum be; þerfore let be þy pride, : & be buxvm to me! Loue me, & I wolle þe (do) : as ry&yogh;t is to done, hinter þe fehlt do. & but þ u wolt, an oþer þing : I wil do wel sone. Josaphat hym answerde: : tyme to loue it is, & tyme is to hate, : þ t wot ech man I wis; Of werre þer is tyme, : & of pes also; & þ t falliþ to tyme : ech mon au&yogh;te to do; Schame it were, &yogh;if aman : schold fro god wende To a deuil of helle, : þ t wold his soule schende; For god seyþ hym self: : fadir & modir he is, Who so fro hym tornyþ, : I wis, he doþ amys. þo answerde þe fadir: : now&yogh; I þe soþe se, þat þ u nelt in no wise : worche after me, Wole we go I fere : doun in to þe toun, & þer we mowe here afayr : disputacioun Of barlam, þy mayster : In game & in plawe, þat schal despute wit clerk&es; : þ t beþ of þe lawe; Amessager al so : fram me schal out wende, By whom I wole clerk&es; : of oure lawe of sende; & þer þey scholle despute : fulle dayis þre. &YOGH;if barlam þorw&yogh; his queintys : mowe mayster be, I wole my self & my lond : torne þan to þe; sind im Ms. umgestellt. & &yogh;if barlam be ouer come, : torne þ u þan to me. sind im Ms. umgestellt. fforþ went þis good child : wit his fadir þo. & þo þey come to þe stede : þer þ e ded schold be do, þe child seyde to nacor: : a(r)tow barlam? Ms. atow st. artow. &YOGH;e I wis, quaþ þis oþer, : þ u wost wel I it am. Barlam, quaþ iosephat, : oþing I warne þe: þ u schalt despute for þe fey : þ u hast tau&yogh;t me; Lok þ t þ u despute : for þe fey ary&yogh;t, Oþer, be þilke lord : þ t made day & ny&yogh;t, &YOGH;if þ u in þis desputasioun : now ouer come be, I wole al myn anoy : my self wreke on þe, I wole draw out w t myn hond : þin herte & þy tonge & þrowe hem to hound&es;, boþe olde & &yogh;onge; Oþer scholle euere her after : be war be þe To be gyle any man, : as þ u be gylist me; & &yogh;if þ u in þe lawe : haue þe maystry&yogh;e, I wole euer more : loue þy company&yogh;e. Nacor of þese word&es; : gan þo to be a gast, & þou&yogh;t, hym was beter, : to be stedfast & be leue wit þe child : & leue in goodnesse, þan suffre ben ouer come : & dey&yogh;e in schennesse. þerfore in his herte : he gan to syke sore, & wel sore aþou&yogh;t : þ t he be gan þis lore. Vp ros a gret clerk, : þat wit þe king was þo: Artow þilke barlam : þ t hast wrou&yogh;t þis wo? þe king&es; sone, þ t here is, : þ u hast brou&yogh;t in foly&yogh;e þat he forsakiþ oure god&es;, : & þat is velany&yogh;e. Wel I woot, quaþ nacor, : þ t I am barlam; ffro foly in to truþe : þe king&es; sone I wan, ffor wel I wot to soþe : þat foly is it non To honoure ihū crist : & forsake þe dede ston. How is þ t ? quaþ þe clerk, : I here a wondir þing: Ms. hele st. here. Houre god&es; honouriþ : erl, baroun, & king, þ u spekist of anewe god : & of anewe lawe; þer fore haþ mony mon : be brou&yogh;t of dawe; How is it þ t þ u darst : oure god&es; do deshonour? Artow beter þan any erl, : king, or emperour? Quaþ nacor: I wis, þ u most lern : to preche þy gyge, ffor þis ilke resoun : nys nou&yogh;t worþ afyge; Some men honouriþ god&es; : þ t beþ wit hond&es; wrou&yogh;t Of ston, tre, gold, & seluer; : here be leue is nou&yogh;t; Dede men in some contre : me clepiþ god&es; al so, As iubyter & plato, : þ t is mys I do; & I be leue on ihū crist, : þ t is ful of my&yogh;t, þat wold fro heuin for vs in to erþe aly&yogh;t; & of amayde he was bore, : þo he hidir com; Of seint ihon, þe baptist, : he fong cristindom; Of þe blis of heuin moche he gan preche, & þ t he was soþfast god : w t fayre meraklis teche; At þe last men hym nome : & dede hym on þe rode, Gilt, I woot, had he non, : it was for oure gode. þ&es; prechid nacor al day : of þe fey wel ry&yogh;t, þat þer nas no sara&yogh;yn : þat hym answere my&yogh;t. ffor þis predycacyoun was : Josaphat glad þo, þat cristindom was prechid : þorw&yogh; ihū crist&es; fo. þe king was for þis dede : in herte ful wo, & bad þ t þe company : departid were in two, To fond a &yogh;en on morw&yogh; : to be þenche more, To torn þis child&es; þou&yogh;t : þorw&yogh; nacor Is lore. þo seyde iosephat: : my mayster þ u most me take, þat we mowe to gedere : of þis þing speche make; & tak wit þe þy conseyl, : as þ u au&yogh;tist to do, Some conseyl &yogh;e mowe make, : &yogh;if &yogh;e sentiþ þer to; But þ u graunte þis, : þ u worchist nou&yogh;t þe ry&yogh;t; Wel þ u my&yogh;t vs dele a two : þorw&yogh; þy grete my&yogh;t. Now&yogh; þe king grantiþ : þ t nacor wit hym go, & nau&yogh;t but for he hopiþ : his beleue he schal vn do; Ms. hoþiþ st. hopiþ. þe king þan grantyþ : þat þey go her in fere, & come on morw to þe court, : for he hem wold here. So þey went to gydere. : Josaphat to hym seyde: I woot þ u art nau&yogh;t barlam, : as my fadir seyde, Nacor is þy ry&yogh;te name; : drede is in þe steke, Ms. stoke st. steke. þat þ u ne darst for al þe world : a word a&yogh;en me speke; þow&yogh; þ u haue al day : prechid cristindom, I woot wel, of þy good wil : no þing it ne com; But &yogh;if þ u wolt, nacor, : do by my lyste & lete þy false god&es; : & leue on ihū criste, þou my&yogh;t saue þy self, : & þy soule al so; I wot þ u schalt dey&yogh;e, : but þ u it wolt do; For I woot þ u schalt : nou&yogh;t ascape fro me In no maner wyse, : but it þy wille be þ t þ u leue on ihū crist, : & do after my lore, & be trewe cristin man : here after euer more. Apreue prest he hadde, : þ t to hym gan gon & þorw here beyre reed : cristenyd nacor anon. Nacor forþ went, : þo he had moche of age, In to þe desert of samar, : & tok an ermytage. þo þe king herde þis, : sykir hym was ful wo. A, mahound, he seyde, : lord, what schal I do? My sone me haþ smyte : wit acarful wounde, & noman me helpe can : þ t I were þer of vn bounde. vor vnbounde ist bound wegpunktirt. Theodas, a gret lord, : herd telle of þis cas; Abeter clerk in þat lond be þ t tyme ne was. Syre, he seyde to þe king, : þo he to hym com, I can make þy sone : leue his cristin dom; &yogh;if I make, to &yogh;oure god&es; : þ t he torne a&yogh;e, Sey me wit good wil : what þ u wolt &yogh;eue me. &yogh;if þ u wolt do þ t , quaþ þe king, : I wole lete make an image, To whom men scholle aloute : of alle maner age, & I my selue wille make : to þe offringe þere, In alle manere wyse, : as þ u a god were. Wel þan, quaþ teodas, : þ u most þy sone bring After my red : in to an oþer wonyng; þe fayresse women of þe lond : to hym þ t þey brou&yogh;t be, fayresse st. fayreste. So þ t he haue no þing : but hem on to se; A sprit I wole hym sende, : þ t hym schal tempte so, vor so ist sore wegpunktirt. þat he ne schal haue no þou&yogh;t : but lechery to do; þer is nomon on lyue : þat so tornyþ monn&es; þou&yogh;t, As wyme, whan aman : among hem is I brou&yogh;t. wyme st. wymen. ffor a kyng was a tyme, : þ t a sone hadde, & lest he lore his son&es; lyf, : sore he hym dradde. Lechis he of sente, : þat scholde hym consayle. lechis aus leshis corrigirt. & þey to hym seyde, : sykir w t oute fayle, þat, &yogh;if his sone sey&yogh;e : sonne oþer mone, þ e ly&yogh;t of his y&yogh;en : he scholde lese sone. þe king in an erþe hous : let his sone do. So þ t he ne say sonne ne mone : neuer mo Ten &yogh;er oþer more, : so þ t he knew no þing, Name of man ne best. : & seþþe þorw&yogh; þe king He was fro þe stede brou&yogh;t: : me let hym þing&es; se, For he schold to soþe wite : what ech þing scholde be. Women me brou&yogh;t afore hym; : he askid what þey were. Me seyde: it were deuelis : þ t he say þo þere, þat gyliþ mann&es; soul&es; : & bringeþ hem in wo, For moche in þis world : þey haue harm I do. þe king clepid his sone : & seyde to hym þ&es;: Woch þing louistow mest : of þat þ u sey er þis? þe child seyde : þilke deuelis : þ t I say er whyle, þ t wole mann&es; soule : w t here my&yogh;t be gyle, For at þ e ferste tyme : þ t I hem sy&yogh;, Me þou&yogh;t of wit I was : for lore wel ny&yogh;. By þat I woot to soþe : þ t he (ne) worþ ouer come, Ms. soþe mit der Abkürzung für er. Vor worþ fehlt ne. But his þou&yogh;t þorw&yogh; women : mowe hym be by nome. As þis clerk haþ seyd, : al me haþ I do; þe fayreste women of þe lond : hem me brou&yogh;t hym two. þe sprit, þ t was hym sent, : brende w t inne hym fast, þe women hym tempte so wit oute, : þ t he was sore a gast. Oft he be sou&yogh;te god, : help hym for to sende; He fond þat his flesschis lost : þer wit a wey wende. A ryche king&es; dou&yogh;ter : his fadir hym gan sende, Saue þ t &yogh;he was fadirles, : his þou&yogh;t for to wende. þis child here prechid of crist : & of heuin blis, & &yogh;he hym answerid : & seyd anon I wis: þou ne schalt neuer mo : to þy laue torne me, But þ u & I to gedere : raþer spousid be; ffor spoushod is grauntid, : cristin men witiþ þis: sind im Ms. umgestellt, aber ihre richtige Folge ist mit b a bezeichnet. Patryark&es; & prophetis : spousid were I wis, sind im Ms. umgestellt, aber ihre richtige Folge ist mit b a bezeichnet. & seynt peter, þ e apostil, : spousid was al so. þe &yogh;onge mon answerde : & þ&es; seyde here two: Of al þing þ t þ u seyst : þ u seyst soþ to me, But of hem þ t han auouid : to hold vergynyte: þilke ne mowe in no wyse : to womon spousid be, For holywrit it for bit, : sykir, I segge þe. For al þ t , quaþ þis woman, : &yogh;if þ u wolt þat I sauid be, þou most on&es; haue : fleschlich to don w t me, For, &yogh;if þ u haue wit me to done, : to morw erlyche I wole afong cristindom, : I segge trewliche; For of þing þat is write : in oure lawe soþ is: For o sinful man : heuen is in more blis, Whan he tornyþ to good : & lat his sinne be & vndirfongiþ penaunce : & lyueþ in charyte, þan for an hondrid holy men, : þat nede naueþ non For non of here synn&es; : penaunce to don. Moche my&yogh;tou to heuin : of ioy & blys bring, &YOGH;if þ u my&yogh;t torne þe synful : w t so lyt aþing. Moche wondir þis mon : had of þis wenche, & here for to helpe : &yogh;erne he gan hym þenche. þe sprit, þ t w t inne hym was, : &yogh;erne hym atende; þo he þou&yogh;t þis þing do, : so þis wenche hym blende. Glad was þis mayde, : þ o &yogh;he þis sy&yogh;. To here felauis &yogh;he seyde: : we haue hym wel ny&yogh;; Go we aboute hym quikliche, : I woot we mowe spede, ffor I haue wel ny : I do alle oure nede. To þis &yogh;ong mon : þey wente alle quikliche. þo he sey&yogh; here fayrnesse, : sore he gan to syche, ffor he nyste on lyue : how here to helpe þo; Loþ hym were his maydinhood : scholde be vndo. vor loþ fehlt wol &. In to an herne preuiliche : he went hym þer fore, & bad help of ihū crist, : & gan to wepe sore. So he wrong his hond&es; : & his þou&yogh;t to heuin cast, þ t amydde his sorwe : he fil on slepe fast. Amon, hym þou&yogh;te as he slep, : þenne hym gan lede Wit flour&es; & w t gras : to a wel fayr mede; Tres þer were many : þ t nobil frut bere; Ms. maiy st. many. Noman may telle þe ioy : þat he fond þere; Swyþe sote was þe smel, : þ e eyr was ful gode, Rychere frut þan he say : ne my&yogh;te be, he ondur stode. ne im Ms. doppelt; hinter dem ersten ne ist ein b wegpunktirt. Segis þer were set, : þat were swyþe ryche, Hym þou&yogh;t in al þe world : nas non hem lyche; Welle strem&es; þer among, : þ t ronne wel stille; Bedd&es;, þat were ryche, : to restin on at wille. Seþþe he lad hym forþ : as in to a toun; Of swyþe mery song&es; : þer he herde þe soun; Alle þe wall&es; were of gold : & of ryche stone; Hym þou&yogh;t in al þe world : soche toun nas þer none. To hym he scyde : þis sted, : þ t þ u my&yogh;t here se, þis is þe stede þat þey scholle in wone : þ t scholle sauid be. þo me wold hym þenne lede, : Josaphat seyde : pur charyte, Lede me nou&yogh;t henn&es;, : but let me here be! let aus het corrigirt. Do wey, quaþ þis oþer, : þ u ne hast nou&yogh;t so wrou&yogh;t þ t þ u mowe dwelle her, : þerfore þou spekist for nou&yogh;t; &YOGH;if þ u mowe þy selue chast, : I segge þe at þe frome, ffro sinne & fro veleny&yogh;e, : hedir þou schalt come; Moche is þe penaunce : þ t þ u most þole er, & so doþ alle oþer : þ t wilueþ to wone her. Seþþe he nom iosaphat : & forþ hym ladde To aswyþe derk stede, : þer of he hym dradde; Al þe sorw&yogh; & þe wo : þ t man of telle may, In þat grisliche stede : hym þou&yogh;t þat he say. þan seyde þe man, : þat was w t hym þo: Sestou þis stede : þat is so ful of wo? I þe sey&yogh;e for soþe, : her inne þey schulle be pult þat han vppon erþe : wit sinne god agylt; þerfore þ u my&yogh;t chese : here after, leue broþer, Wheyþer þe is leuer þis stede, : or ellis þ t oþer; ffor, &yogh;if þ u lyuist in sinne, : þ u schalt winne þis, &, &yogh;if þ u lyuist in clene lyf, : þ t oþer þ u getist I wis. After þis ilke word : iosephat gan a wake. þe fool semblaunt of þe women : clene he gan for sake. þese wome cam aboute hym : & gonne hym clippe faste; cam übergeschrieben . Here hond&es; he sore handlid : & gan hem fro hym caste. He be took hym to ihū crist, : & blessid hym wel swyþe. þo þ e women þis sy&yogh;, : iwis þey were vnblyþe. þe wikkede gost&es;, : þ t to hym were I sent þorw&yogh; teodas nygremauncy, : to don hym turment, þo iosaphat hym hadde blessid, : þey held hem schent echon. & to teodas, here mayster, : a &yogh;en þey beþ a gon. Teodas hem askid, : what þey hadde don. & þey hym answerid : & seyde þus anon: Er he hym gan blesse, : we hadde ny þe maystry&yogh;e; W t þ e cros he vs ouer com, : wher to scholde I ly&yogh;e? We seggeþ þe for soþe, : we ne mowe þe nou&yogh;t do; þe in der 2. Hlbz. wol st . hym. ffonde þ u , &yogh;if þ u my&yogh;t, : whan þ u wolt to hym go. To Josaphat wente þo : þe king & teodas. Josaphat preched so, : þ t teodas cristned was, vor so ist þo wegpunktirt . & good lyf gan lede : & his folyis for sook. þ&es; he was take w t þe fysch, : þ t he þou&yogh;t take w t crok. þorw&yogh; conseyl of his frend&es; : þe king gan do wel, & &yogh;af Josaphat his sone : þe kingdom haluendel. Sumdel a &yogh;en his wille : þe lond&es; he took: þo he hem fong bodyliche, : wit soule it for sook; he fehlt vor it. He took hem, for he wolde : echin godd&es; lawe, & alle þe false god&es; : out of his lond drawe. ffayre emagis of þe cros : in ech toun he leet verche, & ordeynyd bysschop&es; & prest&es;, : to singe in holy cherche. þe meste party of þe lond : to crist he haþ brou&yogh;t. & euere he fondid day & ny&yogh;t : to torne his fadir þou&yogh;t. So at þe ende, : as god &yogh;af þ e cas, þe king tornyd to god : & cristenyd was. Now haþ iosaphat : moche to his wille; þer of he þonkid god : boþe loud & stille. þe king &yogh;ald vp þo : al þe kingdom In to his son&es; hond, : & he it nom. þis olde king sone after : drou&yogh; to his ende, & þorw&yogh; godd&es; grace : his soule to heuin wende. Josaphat þorw&yogh; godd&es; my&yogh;t : þe folk to heuin gan wyse, & bad hem do here wel : to godd&es; seruise. To barachy&yogh;e, an oþer king, : þ t good mon was & fre, (þ t ) þorw&yogh; destene of erytage : his eyr scholde be, Im Anfange fehlt & oder þat. Hym he sente to segge : preuilich in consayle, How he wold to wildirnesse : wende w t oute fayle, & þat he was in wille : al þis world for sake; & bad hym to þe kingdom : good kep take, & tech wel cristin dom, : as he hadde er do. But of þis be stille he bad, : fort he were ago. Ofte he þou&yogh;t ascape, : but long it was for nou&yogh;t, vor it ist he weg|punktirt . For euer of his oune men : a&yogh;en he was I cau&yogh;t. At þe last he scapid, : & went forþ his way, þ t in to þe wildirnes : of samar ry&yogh;t lay. As he wente in his way, : apore man he mette, & w t fayr speche : anon he hym grette, & seyd: leue broþer, : for loue now&yogh; I bidde þe vor for ist anon wegpunktirt . þat þ u þy cloþ&es; to day : chaunge wit me; þo u myne be þe beter, : I hem þe wille &yogh;eue; þ u my&yogh;t hem dere selle, : & longe þe beter lyue. þe pore mon took þe king : his cloþ&es; anon I wis, & wente forþ in his way : myldeliche syþ. þe fend brou&yogh;te Josaphat : anon in gret doute, In þe desert of samar : þ o he went aboute: Ofte in fourme of man : grislich he hym mette, & w t swerd I drawe : of his wey hym lette, & swor grete oþ&es; : þat he hym wolde sle, But he to his kingdom : tornyd hom a &yogh;e. In fourme of a wilde best : he hym turnyd al so, Al redy w t his my&yogh;t : to don hym alle wo. He hym blessid al wey, : whan hym by fel so, & þer wit cuere more : he ouer com his fo. Ofte Josaphat seyd: : whyl þ t god helpiþ me, I ne drede nomon ne best, : what euer he be. Twey &yogh;er in desert : Josaphat wente so, Er he fond barlam, : þ t he was wery of go. þo he com to þe caue : þat he in was, Josaphat seyde for ioy&yogh;e: : deo gracyas. Wit oute þe dore he stood, : & loude gan to cri&yogh;e: Blesse me, fadir, blesse me, : for þy cortesy&yogh;e! þo barlam herde þis, : out he gan gon, & w t moche blisse : kissid hym anon. &YOGH;osaphat told barlam : how&yogh; he hadde fare, & hou he hadde at hom : lyuid in sorw&yogh; & care. þere he lyuid w t barlam : &yogh;er&es; many & fale, In fasting & in orysonys, : In hete & in cale. Barlam deyde seþþe, : I woot wel I wis, þre hondrid &yogh;er & ey&yogh;ty, : after god was bore for vs. & fyue & twenty &yogh;er Josaphat : was in his king dom, & fyue & þritty &yogh;er In desert, : after he þer to com. After, þo he deyde, : his holy body me nom & beryid it be his mayster, : þ e gode barlam. þo barachy&yogh;e, þe gode king, : her of herde telle, Wit his company&yogh;e þedir : he wente wel snelle; Boþe bodyis he nom vp, : w t ioy & wit blis, & brou&yogh;t hem to toune, : as ry&yogh;t was I wis. He beryed hem rychely : in þorw mad of ston. þer god haþ for here loue : many merakle don. Now&yogh; bidde we god of heuin, : þat euer was & is, þat he vs for here boþe loue : bring to heuin blis. amen.

0.1: SEyn patric com þoru godes grace : to preci in irlonde, preci st. prechi. Seint. þorou. prechi. yrlond. To teche men hor ri&yogh;te bi leue : on Ihū to vnderstonde. &yogh;hare ri&yogh;t. of ihū crist. onþer|stonde. So uol of wormes þ t lond he fond, : þ t nomon my&yogh;te gon fol. ne my&yogh;t. In some stude uor wormes, : þ t he nas Iuenymed anon. stede. for. y uenemid. S. patric bed our lord crist : þ t þe lond deliuered were sein patrich. oure. deþ lond. Of þulke foule wormes, : þ t non ne come þere. none. Our lord hurde is bone anon, : þer ne my&yogh;te neuereft come herde his. No foul worm in Irlond, : þ t is lif him nas bi nome. him fehlt. Ech tre þ t in þe lond groweþ, : & erþe of þe lond also, þ t lond. Ne þoleþ no uenym in no stude : nei him be ido; ben. No foul worm comeþ þerto : þ t nys anon lifles, þer ney. lif les. bbote alute schort euete, : & &yogh;ut heo is tailes. Ms. tailes st. tailles. lite. &yogh;et he. tail les. Muche clannes & muche good, : hoso deþ him vnderstonde, Moche clannesse. god. Vor þe loue of s. patric : our lord dude to al Irlonde. dede. to alle yrlond. A good mannes scep was istole, : to s. patric com tydynge; a god man schep. tidyng. He het, hoso hit hadde Inome, : a&yogh;en it scholde bringe. hit fehlt. bring. þis gode mon het at chirche so ofte, : ac a&yogh;en ne com it no&yogh;t. so at cherche ofte. h t nou&yogh;t. In an heie day, as al þ t folc : to chirche was ibro&yogh;t, a hei dai. S. patric het, &yogh;if in þe chirche : eny mossel were &yogh;et in þe cherche &yogh;if. morsel. Of þe scep, þ t it scholde blete : among hem alle þere. þ t hit stele (!) blete. &yogh;am st. hem. þo gon it blete in is wombe : þ t hadde þ t scep istole, gan. Among alle þis men, þ t it ne my&yogh;te : noleng be ihole. longer. hole. Sore was þe þeof aschamed : þ t men uor þeof him knewe; þ t def. for men þ t þef. He was iknowe, & mercy bad, : & bicom good & triwe. Nou hadde s. patric awone, : ofte & ilome now. lome. To aloute to euerich crois, : war he euer come. eny cros. whare. A day, as he wende aboute : prechynge in þe londe, wente. preching. S. patric loutede to euerich crois : þ t he sei owar stonde. patrik. loute. eueri. ower. A crois þer stod, þ t men iseie, : ac he ne sei it no&yogh;t, cros. seieþ no&yogh;t. þer uore ne aloutede he no&yogh;t þer to. : men wondred in hor þo&yogh;t, louteþ. wondreþ e. &yogh;hare do&yogh;t. & ecste wi he nolde aloute : to þe crois bi him þere. eskeþe whi. þis gode mon bi huld aboute : & escte wer it were : þis holiman. bihelþe. exseþe whare. He ne my&yogh;te þe croys no&yogh;t ise; : in gret þo&yogh;t he stod. ne fehlt. cros. þo&yogh;te. Gret wonder hadde þ t folc þo, : & wende he were wod. wenþe þ t. þo sede auois vndererþe: : ne mys þenche &yogh;e no&yogh;t! þe erde. þ t þe holi mon ne se þ t crois, : no&yogh;t ne wondre &yogh;e in &yogh;oure þo&yogh;t, þei þe holiman sei nou&yogh;t þ e cros ne wondre &yogh;o ri&yogh;t no&yogh;t. Vor it is uor myne sunnen : þ t myne bones liggeþ here, fore min senne. myn. As i c was ibured, & wiþ &yogh;ou speke : þis holi mon to skere; vor speke fehlt i c auch in Cott. u. Bodl. ich. wit &yogh;o. Saraceyn i c was wule anerþe, : in helle my soule, is; a sarsin. wule fehlt. Vor myne bones beþ so ney þe crois, : he ne sucþ it no&yogh;t iwis. min. cros. seiet no&yogh;t y wis. As preching þis holi mon : þe contrei out sou&yogh;te, fehlt : im Ms., wie V. 55. 84. 232. 237 u. ö. contre. A wilde stude he fond & bar, : þ t no frut uorþ ne bro&yogh;te; a wilþe stede he vond wilþ & bar. fruit. þei me sewe & sette þer alle þing, : þer com noþing uorþ þere. þere al þyng. þer ne com nout forþ noþing dere. tokning whi. S. patric bed our lord &yogh;erne : toknynge, wi it were. In þe erþe he made wiþ is staf : a sercle al aboute: Ms. serche. cercle. þer bicom aput swiþe dep, : þ t men hadde of gret doute. pet. suiþe. dowte. þis gode mon nuste wat it was, : ac an angel him sede: what. þ t þer was aput of purgatorie, : þ t ech mon mi&yogh;te of drede; pette. man. Somme soules were þer Inne ido, : hor sunnes uorte bete þer som soules were inne ido hore sennes for to bete. þ t hi ne betten no&yogh;t anerþe, : ar hi þis lif lete; bette nou&yogh;t. &, were aman quic oþer ded : þ t þer Inne come, He ne scholde habbe oþer purgatorie : uorte þe day of dome, nou&yogh;t st. uorte. Ac aftur he scholde to heuene, : &yogh;if he were good, iwende, heuen. god wende. & also, &yogh;if he luþer were, : to helle wiþþouten ende. & as god as he luþer were (!). w t oute. Our lord tok s. patric : þen staf is owe honde, Im Ms. fehlt : nach der Hlbz. Auch Ms. Cott . his owe honde, ohne wiþ. þ t he fond wiþ þulke purgatorie, : ihered be is sonde. þilke. hi hereþ. In Irlond is &yogh;ut þulke staf : wiþ nobleie iwust Inou&yogh;, þilk. wist y now. & for relik iholde, : & elles it were wou&yogh;. riche relik. wo. S. patric in þulke stude, : as þis purgatorie is, Am Rande: patric purgatory. Of religion bigan an hous, : þ t &yogh;ut stont iwis, stond y wis. & chanouns þer Inne made, : as &yogh;ut beþ also. Ms. chanons. þen put he let wel uaste close, : þ t nomon necome him to. com st. come. In þe chirche&yogh;ard is þulke put, : ri&yogh;t toward þe est side, Euene est fram þe heie weued, : as men secheþ wide. euen est fram fro (!). scheteþ. l walled he is uaste aboute, : & uaste iloke þ t &yogh;at; fast. &yogh;ate. & uaste þe prior witeþ þe keie, : þ t nomon comeþ In þer at. ne com. Al bi s. patrikes daie : men wende þer In I lome, patrichis dai. wente þer inne lome. & seþþe also monyon, : ac vewe up þer come. suþþe. op. Ac þulke þ t þer com a&yogh;en, : of þ t hi seie, tolde, come. of þ t y seie. As it is in þe hous iwrite : & priueliche iholde. priuiliche. þe maner is of ech man : þ t þer Inne wend, euer ich. wenþe. þ t it be to bete is sunne, : &yogh;if our lord him grace send. sinne. sende. To þe biscop of þe lond : he schal him uerst scriue, bischop. schriue. & bidde leue to do þe wei, : to amendement of is lyue. Ac þe biscop him rat þer a&yogh;en, : & resons him wole scewe, rad. wolþ e. & segge þ t mony þuder wendeþ, : & comeþ a&yogh;en uewe. deþer wente. Ac, &yogh;if he is stable in is þo&yogh;t, : uor al þ t he haþ ibede, bi st. is. for alle alle (!). þe biscop wole him littres make : to þe maister of þe stede. him wil lettres. þe prior him wole ek rede Inou&yogh; : uorte chaunge is þo&yogh;t; wil. ek fehlt . chonge. Ac, wenne he sucþ him studeuast, : þ t he nele it bileue no&yogh;t, ff. Im Ms. Laud folgt nach V. 80 zuerst 83 u. 84, dann 82, 81; letztere Reihenfolge ist gewiss die richtige, wie auch aus der folgenden Erzählung (vgl. Wiþ gret procession of prestes : to þe put he worþ ibro&yogh;t. pette. werþ. Ac &yogh;if me ne may þe &yogh;ut : uor noþing chaunge is þo&yogh;t, change. In to chirche hi wolleþ him lede : & sette him adoun akne; & þere he schal viftene dawes : in Orisons be. Im Ms. fehlt : nach der Hlbz . daues. þe procession schal turne a&yogh;en, : as ri&yogh;t is to done, torne. & amorwe þulke tyme : þuder come efsone; &, bote he be þanne icome, : wiþ gret deol & sore þan. Hi turneþ a&yogh;en, & siker beþ : þ t he ne comeþ nammore. comþ. Hit biuel bi kyng steuenes dai, : þ t nou late was, Am Rande ist nota klein nebengeschrieben . bi steuene kynges day. Of aknyit, þ t het Owen, : a wel wonder cas. oweyn. To þe biscop to scrifte : owen, þis knyt, com, & gret repentaunce uor is sunnen : & deol & sorwe nom. fehlen . þe biscop bi gan to chide him uaste : of þ t he hadde mysdo, & sede, he was mon worst, : uorte sunegi so, fehlen . þ t me ne my&yogh;te do him so muche wo, : þ t he nere worþi more. him do. ne worþe nere. þe kny&yogh;t sat wiþ deo(l)uol herte, : & si&yogh;te & weop sore. Ms. deouol st. deoluol. fehlt . Wenne, he sede, icham mon worst, : & manne worst habbe ido, whanne. he sede fehlt . & man. & to sunne þ t grettest is : mest penaunce mot be to, In Mss. Eg. u. Laud fehlt & im Anfang . mot to, be fehlt . Wenne i c among alle men : mest sunuol am, alas, whan. most. þe strengost penaunce icholle take : þ t euer ifounde was: Ichulle take godes grace : & in is name wende Icholle. In s. patric purgatorie, : sende wat he me sende. patrikes. O, beu frere, quaþ þis biscop, : be stille! wi saistou so? Ou. whi seistu. Crist uorbede þ t þ u neuer : such folie ne do! fore for beþe (!). Vnneþe eny comeþ a&yogh;en : of þulke þ t þuder doþ wende; Nolde god þ t þ u þe dede dust, : bodi & soule to scende! to (!) deþe dest. Ac wend in to religion, : & bilef þer þin lyues ende: þer fehlt . & þ u schalt wel þin sunne bete, : & god wole þe grace sende. Certes, sire, quaþ þis kny&yogh;t, : þ u my&yogh;t as wel be stille, Vor ichulle þe dede do, : do god bi me is wille; Vor so muche as i c habbe of serued, : Ine mi&yogh;te no&yogh;t habbe of wo; ichabbe y serueþ. my&yogh;t. þer uore say wat i c schal do, : uor ichulle siker it go. sei. sal. siker icholle. þe biscop prechede him uaste Inou&yogh;: & sede him resons Inowe, Im Ms. fehlen hier durch Versehen des Schreibers 4 Verse nach der 1. Hlbz., die in den übrigen Mss. stehen, s. u. Cott. hat hier, wie die and. Mss., 4 Verse mehr: þe bischop precheþ e him fast ynow . for to change his dou&yogh;t Ac at laste þo he i sey . þ t hit was al for nou&yogh;t To þ e prior of þe stede . his lettres he made sone þ t he scholþe bi him do . as bi such man was to done þe prior precheþe him faste y now . & seþ c him resons y nowe . . . &YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te chaunge is þo&yogh;t, : þ t he him wiþ drowe. alle for nou&yogh;t. at ende. Ac is preching was al uorno&yogh;t, : as he sei wel aten ende: He nolde bileue uor noþing : þen perilous wei to wende. be st. bi. þe prior him nom bi þe hond : & in to chirche him bro&yogh;te. þere he uel adoun akne : & our lordes grace biso&yogh;te; In uastynge & in orisouns : uortene ny&yogh;t he lay, fasting. To bidde our swete lordes grace; : & (þe) vifteþe day Im Ms. fehlt þe vor vifteþe. oure suete. þ e vifteþ e. þe couent com aboute him, : & oþer prestes also & clerkes wiþ þe procession, : þe seruice to do. þe vor procession fehlt in den and. Mss. u. ist zu tilgen . w t procession. Vor him (hi) songe an heie masse : & on god cride uaste, Nach him fehlt hi im Ms . him hi song. hei. Our lordes flecs & is blod : hi toke him ate laste, flesch. atte. & sprende him wiþ holi watur, : & hor orisons sede. & sperng (!) him wyt. &yogh;hare. Wiþ crois & procession : to þe put hi gonne him lede, putte. him gonne, hi fehlt . & heieliche songe þe letanye, : & holi water wiþ hem bere, heilich song. wiþ hem fehlt . & godes halwe alle bede : þ t hi is help were. alle godes halwe. þe prior vnlek þe puttes dore, : & among hem echon: & vor among, nur noch in Ms. Cott., fehlt in d. and. Mss . vnlok. hom st. hem. Beu frere, he sede, her is þe wei : þ t (þ u ) seist þ u wolt gon; Im Ms. fehlt . þ u nach þ t . þ t þ u seist þ t þ u. Ac &yogh;if þ u wolt do bi oure rede, : þ u schalt þi þo&yogh;t wende be. & in oþer manere þi sunne bete, : as god wole þe grace sende; Vor uewe þer comeþ a&yogh;en of hem : þ t her Inne wende biuore, hom. here. Ac were uor torment & uor wo : bodi & soule uorlore. tormens. lif & soule were lore (were doppelt). Certes, sire, quaþ þis kny&yogh;t, : rede wat þ u me rede, I c nyme þen wei agodes name : to bete myne mysdede; þen wei ich nime. Ac, uor his loue þ t ous dere abou&yogh;te, : biddeþ uor me echon! Lyf & soule i c him bi take, : & in is name In gon. in gon lesen auch die and. Mss., nur Laud hat ichulle in gon. He blessede him, & wende him In, : & bi tok god flesch & bon. blesseþ. wente. þe prior him sprende wiþ holi watur, : & lek þe dore anon. sprengþe. loc. þis gode kny&yogh;t him wende uorþ, : baldeliche & uaste, bbi an holwe wei vnder erþe, : & vp god is herte caste; He ne sei noþing uor derchede, : ac naþeles no&yogh;t him agaste. & st . ac. ne a gaste. So longe, him þo&yogh;te, þ t he sei : wel uair li&yogh;t ate laste. long. feir. atte. þuderward he wende baldeliche, : so þ t he com þer ney. þe uairest feld þ t mi&yogh;te be : at þe weies ende he isei. fairost. atte. hende. sey. þer Inne he wende murie Inou&yogh;; : amydde þe feld he fond merie. þe noblest & uairest halle : þ t my&yogh;te be In eny lond. Ms. noblestc, mit angefangenem aber nicht ausgeschriebenem e. þe nobleste & þe fairost. Ri&yogh;t cler nas þ t weder no&yogh;t, : bote ri&yogh;t as it were nei eue. To biholde þ t noble work, : an stounde he gan bileue; þe st. þ t. a st. an. þe walles nere no&yogh;t þer on Ihol, : ac þer aboute iwis dorou st. þer on. Queynt pylers & arches were, : as monekes cloister is. quinte. monkis cloistre. In he wende agodes name, : & sat him al one an hei, al a lone. & bihuld aboute in ech hurne : & þis quinte werk isei. bi helþ. in euerich angle. worc. As he bihuld al þus aboute, : þer com In at on ende aten on. Tuelf men in wite uestimens, : swiþe uair & hende, white vestimentes. Hor crounen alle newe iscore. : swiþe uaire hi him grette, &yogh;hare. nwe y schore. & sete hem alle uaire adoun, : & þis kny&yogh;t bi hem sette. sette ham al fair. bi hom. þo spak on, as hor prior, : mildeliche & stille: bbeu frere, ihered be god, : þ t sendeþ þe such wille, bi god. & lete þe þ t þou hast bigonne : uor is grace wel ende! þ u. Beu frere, wen þ u wolst þes wei : uor þyne sunnen wende: wolst ist Imperf., dafür sonst auch wost; vgl . whan þ u wost þis. þin. Oþer þ u most be studeuast : & in none manere turne þi þo&yogh;t, in no. Oþur þ u worst lif & soule : a deuelwei i bro&yogh;t; Vor, as sone as we beþ henne iwend, : þe deuelen luþer & wicke i went. deuele. Wolleþ come anon aboute þe : In þis hous wel þicke, & do þe tormens & wo Inou&yogh;, : & bihote þe wel more, Ac hi wolleþ bi hote þe Ioie Inou&yogh;, : &yogh;if þ u wolt leue on hor lore; wollet. y leue. & &yogh;if hi þe þoru eny biheste : mowe þe ouercome, þe doppelt, wie auch in Ms. Cott.; das erste þe ist zu tilgen . ac &yogh;if. Siker þ u worst lif & soule : adeuelwei Inome; Ac &yogh;if þ u art stable of bileue, : & in ihū crist dest þenche, þost. Ne uor heste ne uor wo : fram him nelt blenche, uor biheste. þ u worst quit of alle þin sunnen : þ t þ u hast er iwro&yogh;t, wost. sinne. euer st. er. & þ u schalt ise alle þe Ioien : þ t godemen beþ Inne ibro&yogh;t, ioie. & þe pyne þ t luþermen habbeþ : uor hor mysdede; Ac, in wat wo þ u art, : þench on god, i c rede, in what wo so. þen st. þench. &, wanne hi þe turmenteþ muche, : cri ihū mylce & ore, whan. dust st. dudest. &, &yogh;if þ u art studeuast in þi bileue, : hi ne scholleþ þe defouli namore; scholle. nammore. We bitakeþ þe ihū crist; : i c rede, do our lore. þo nuste þe kny&yogh;t war hi bicome. : he sat & si&yogh;te sore, whare. Elyng he bileuede al one, : & cride on godes mi&yogh;te, elenge. & armede him wiþ holi beden, : a&yogh;en þe deuel to fi&yogh;te; On þe holi gost he criede uaste, : þ t he ne scholde him no&yogh;t faile. cride. He lokede, wen þe deuelen come, : him uorto asaile. whan. As he sat þus in godes name, : as bataile uorto abide, þer com a sori reuuol cri : aboute in eche side, rufol. in euerich. As þei al þe world to borste, : &, as him þo&yogh;te, also, alle þ e worle to borste & breke: þ t , þei al þe bestes of þe world : to gadere were ido alle. worl. & as grisliche as hi mi&yogh;te : &yogh;ollynge alle were, grislich. &yogh;ollinde. Hi ne mi&yogh;te among hem alle : make so grislich bere; þ t , &yogh;if is herte on Ihū crist, : & is hope þe more nere, Anon he hadde wod bicome : & ilore is wit uor fere. þo come hi alle aboute him : þicke & grisliche þere, hi In, alle fehlt . þik. & &yogh;onede & grennede ek : wiþ wel sori chere. & im Anfang fehlt . &yogh;oniinde & grenning. Belamy, quaþ on of hem, : þ u hast ri&yogh;t ido; þou. a ri&yogh;t a do (!). Wel au&yogh;te we honouri þe, : uor alto vewe doþ so, we alle honoure. alle to few. Vor alle oþer men wolleþ abide, : forte hor lif hem be bynome, fol st. vor. for to. hom. & &yogh;ut it is a&yogh;en hor wille, : ar hi wolleþ to ous come; &yogh;it. wollet. & þ u comst al by þyne lyue, : & bi þyne gode wille also; comest. be þin. bi dyn. asso. Wel au&yogh;te we þyne mede &yogh;ulde : & gret þonk þe do; þin. Wen þ u hast boþe bodi & soule : bitake ous by þyne lyue, bi dyn. Sauns faile we were vnkunde, : bote we it &yogh;olde þe blyue; þe fehlt in den and. Mss., Cott. hat &yogh;ol þe st. &yogh;olde. saun. vnkende. &yogh;ol þe (!) bliue. Ac naþeles, &yogh;if þ u wolt anerþe : habbe &yogh;ut Ioie more, Vor þe kunhede, þ t þ u to us comst : al by owe lore, sind im Ms. Laud umgestellt . kenþeþe. þ t þu to ous come alle be din owe lore. Siker ous an hond þ t þ u wolt : on oure seruyce bileue, sind im Ms. Laud umgestellt & we wolleþ to þe erþe þe lede a&yogh;en, : al sauf, ar it be eue: to erde. saf er. þ u schalt habbe þer Ioie Inou&yogh;, : in halle & ek in boure, Vor none men beþ so murie þer : as þulke þ t beþ of oure; nommen. dere. þilk. Hei mon & noble þ u worst, : & men scholleþ honouri þe; scholle. & wen þ u art ded & to ous comst, : þe tid as good as we. comest. þis kny&yogh;t þo&yogh;te euer on ihū crist, : he nolde chaunge enes is wille, þe knyt þoute. chonge. Vor prechinge ne uor uair bi heste, : ac sat him euer stille. for þreting ne fair. þo he nolde hem granti no&yogh;t : þ t he wolde to hem wende, Hi &yogh;onede & grennede on him foule, : & astrong fur gonne tende. þis kny&yogh;t hi bounde hond & fot, : & amydde þe fur him caste; fet. fer caste, him fehlt . Wiþ irene oweles & wiþ pikes : hi to drowe him wel uaste. owles. þis kny&yogh;t, wan he sei is neode, : loude he cride anon: &yogh; in kny&yogh;t übergeschrieben . þ o st. wan. nede. Ihū, (Ihū), help me nou, : & schulde me fram myne fon! Ms. Ihū einmal, so auch Ms. Cott.; die and. Mss. haben Ihū Ihū ( oder Ihū crist. Bodl .), wie auch das Versmass fordert; s. V. 574 alas. schil þe me fro my fon. Anon so þ t word was ised, : þ t fur quente ech spronke; euerich. þe deueles ne drowe him namore. : our lord he gan þonke, þ e þeuelin him droue nommore, ne fehlt . & þe hardiere was Inou&yogh;, : þo he þis isei, he st. þe. hardiore. & þe lasse of þe deuelen dradde, : þ t were him so nei. Wel grisliche þe screwen &yogh;olle, : þo hem failede hor my&yogh;te, grislich. hore. & flowe echone out of þis halle, : & drowe wiþ hem þis kny&yogh;te. flow echon. þrow. Hi drowe him wel harde a&yogh;en þe gronde : boþe fet & honde, droue. Swiþe ver, him þo&yogh;te, & longe, : al in awaste londe. longe aboute. So blac & derk was al þ t lond, : þ t noþing he ne sei dorc. bbote þe deuelen þ t him drowen, : þ t so þicke were him nei. deuelin. drowe. Ac asofte wynd þer was, : þ t he hurde vnneþe, & so scharp & cold he bleu : þ t it bro&yogh;te him nei to deþe; hit blew. Ri&yogh;t cold it wende nei þoru&yogh; is herte, : & þoru is bodi also, nei findet sich in keinem Ms. und ist wol aus dem vorigen V. eingedrungen . colþe. nei fehlt . þ t him were leuere þen al þen world, : þ t þe pyne were ido. leuer þan alle þ e worle. þus colde hi drowe him, as him þo&yogh;te, : ri&yogh;t uorþ est iwis, As þe sonne arist in somer, : wen þe day lengost is. þo hi come þuder, as him þo&yogh;te, : ri&yogh;t to þe wordles ende, þuder nur noch in Ms. Cott.; Ms. Bodl. hat þere. Hi turnde hem bi abrod ualeie, : & sou(þ)ward gonne wende, Ms. souward st. souþward. turneþ e him. faleie. sout ward. Toward þe stude as þe sonne : at mydwynter deþ arise, þ t wo was þe kny&yogh;t uor drawe : & ipyned on alle wise. þis st. þe. an st. on. þo þo&yogh;te him þ t he hurde uer, : bi uore him as it were, Swiþe deluol cri & wop, : & swiþe reuuol bere; Euer þe ner þ t hi come, : þe reuloker was þ t cri. So longe hi drowe him, as him þo&yogh;te : þ t hi were ri&yogh;t þer bi. Statt as haben die and. Mss . þat. long. þo come hi in to awilde feld; : non more ne my&yogh;te be, l in feld ist übergeschrieben . so st. þo. a vor wilde fehlt . mi&yogh;t. So longe he was in euerich side, : þ t me ne my&yogh;te non ende ise. long. eueri. mi&yogh;t. Of men & wemmen þ t feld was : fol in ech syde, Ms. fold mit wegpunktirtem d. wimmen. eueri side. þe wombe naked toward þe gronde : abrod isprad wel wide, þe fet & honden al abrod : to þe erþe uaste ibounde hond. Wiþ nailes of ire, al a fure, : ismyte þoru out þe gronde. Auch Ms. Cott. liest þoro ut þ e grounde; die and. Mss. richtiger þorw to þe grounde, Laud þoru&yogh; heom to grounde. þis wreche gostes, al uor pyned : wiþ ire & wiþ fure, pineþ e. So deoluol cri & bere made, : þ t deol it was to hure; delfol. Hi criede mercy deoluoliche, : ac me nolde hem non do; cride. Vor anguise h(i) gnowe þe colde erþe : & hor tonge also. Ms. h st. hi. anguische. knoue (!). herde. tong. þe deuelen orne al aboute, : & pulte hem to gronde, ourne. : & op on hom to grounde. & wiþ kene oweles hem to drowe : wiþ mony adeope wounde. & fehlt . dep. Alas, wi ne beþ we her iwar : our sunnes her to bete, be we er. here to. Ar we come to purgatorie : & wiþ þe luþer gostes Imete? gestes mete ( ohne I). Vor in purgatorie þe screwen beþ : as wel as in helle, & worþeþ uorte dai of dome, : telle wat me telle. forte þe. þe deuelen seden : as þis men : pyne þ u schalt also, sede. schat st. schalt. bbote þ u wolt þi þo&yogh;t wende : & aftur our red do. wolle. þo he nolde in none manere, : to gronde hi him caste, in no. To tormenti him, as þe oþer were, : & to naili him uaste. Ac he cride to ihū crist anon, : þo him smerte sore: þer nas non of þe screwen þo : þ t my&yogh;te him greuy more. mi&yogh;the. þo þe screwen ne mi&yogh;te no&yogh;t : hor wille habbe þo, mi&yogh;t. Hi drowe him in to anoþer feld, : uol of wel more wo: Of men & wemmen he was uol, : up ri&yogh;t isprad to gronde, ffet & honden upri&yogh;t to drawe, : to þe erþe uaste ibounde honde. Wiþ furi nailes of ire, : ynailed uaste þerto; nailes fol of ire. Al furi neddren up hem sete, : & crapoudes also: Somme of þe neddren hem bi clupte : so uaste al aboute, som. be clepte. þ t hem þo&yogh;te hi scolde to berste, : so uaste hi gorden wiþoute; Im Ms. nicht deutlich, ob gorden oder gerden. breste. gurþe. Somme seten on oueward hem, : & hor wreche flesch uor gnowe, som sete anoward. wrecche. & wiþ kene teþ al furi : wombe & breste to drowe; womb. Somme nome hor scharpe tonge : & þoru þe herte smyte, some. tong. Somme bounde, somme stonge, : & somme gnowe & bite. some bounde & some stong. som. þe crapoudes ek, þ t were so foule, : on ouerward þe herte sete, anoward. & stonge hem þoru out þe herte : wiþ hor wrottes so grete. stong. þorou ohne out. hore. þe luþer gostes ournen also : aboute hem Inowe, gestes ourne. & aboute. & wiþ oweles & wiþ scourges : þe wreches al to drowe. þe wreche gostes, al uorpyned, : in such torment ibro&yogh;t, & in suich. Hi &yogh;olle & cride deoluolliche; : ac al ne halp hem no&yogh;t. del|folliche. alle ne help. þe deuelen nome þis seli kny&yogh;t, : & wolde him pyny also, Ac, þo he cride on ihū crist, : hi ne bro&yogh;te him no&yogh;t þerto. ac þo hi (!). &yogh;ut þe deuelen eft him nome : & to þe þridde feld him drowe. þer he sei in strong turment : wreche gostes Inowe, sei ek. I sprad to þe erþe al abrod, : & ismyte þoru out echon þoro ut. Wiþ as þicke nailes in ech syde, : as þer my&yogh;te stike on, eche stede. stiki. þ t me ne scholde fynde an empti place : in al þ t bodi so lute, ampti. þe bodi so lite. þ t me my&yogh;te uor þicke nailes : an vyngres ende pute. putte. A smart ek wynd to oþer wo : on hem bleu so uaste, ek hinter wynd zu versetzen . wynd ek. þ t hem þo&yogh;te hi uorbarnde : þoru out at eche blaste. for brende. þe deuelen ornen al so aboute : fram ech to oþer Inowe, ourne. & hor wreche flesch to oþer wo : wiþ oweles to drowe. þis wreche gostes, so uorpyned, : in such turment ibro&yogh;t, for pineþ e & in suich. Reuliche cride as hi my&yogh;te, : ac vnneþe me hurde hem ou&yogh;t, reulich. herde hom nou&yogh;t(!). Vor hi were so clene ouercome, : þ t hi my&yogh;te vnneþe Brynge eny uois, bote as aman : up þe poynt of deþe: bring. Al in þe þrote hi cride hasewe, : as hor strengþe hem were bynome aswe. Myd þe muche pyne, as no wonder : þei hi were ouercome. w t moche, þe fehlt ; as nas no. þe deuelen nome þis seli kny&yogh;t : & to gronde him caste, sek st. seli. & swore, bote he turnde is þo&yogh;t, : among hem to naili uaste. In he bihuld at þis &yogh;at, : þo he com þer nei: More clernesse ne mi&yogh;te be, : him þo&yogh;te, þen he sei. þan st. þen. As he wolde þer Inne wende, : a&yogh;en him þer com gon com som (!). A procession uair Inou&yogh;, : of noble men echon, Wiþ crois & wiþ taperes, : wiþ baners swiþe clere, baneris. þ t folc bi hynde ireuested, : ech bi is Iuere: wit folc bi hinde resteueþ resteueþ euerich bi his iuere (!). Biscops somme & erchedekenes, : & monekes & frere, bischopes some. erchedeknes. monkis. & ech, him þo&yogh;te, in þe abit : þ t hi werede anerþe here. & euerich. he st. hi. Mit þe meste Ioie þ t mi&yogh;te be : þis kny&yogh;t hi gonne auonge, Miþ. mi&yogh;t. afong. & ladde him In wiþ Ioie Inou&yogh; : of solas & of songe. In fehlt . song. þo þis murie song was ido, : to him sone þer come & þo. meri. Tweie, as it maistres were, : & bi þe hond him nome, Hi wilcomede him wel mildeliche, : & þonked our lord uaste, hij welcomeþe. þonkeþ e. þ t &yogh;ef him so good bileue, : þ t so studeuastliche ilaste. Hi ladde him aboute & scewede him : þ t lond uer & nei: hij. So muche clernesse & oþer Ioie : him þo&yogh;te neuer he ne sei; ne of ioie (!). him þo&yogh;te him (!). Vor, as þe sonne bi nemeþ þ t li&yogh;t : of þe candele aboute mydday, candle. Al so it bynom þe sonne leom, : þ t li&yogh;t þ t he þer isay. þe li&yogh;t. þere. So brod & long þe place was, : þ t he ne mi&yogh;te non ende ise, Al murie med & suote fluores, : swettere ne mi&yogh;te non be, al meri. sote. swetter. Tren also wiþ noble frut, : þ t swote smulde Inou&yogh;. tres. fruy&yogh;t. smelþe sote. So gret swotnesse al aboute : of ech place drou&yogh;, suetnesse of al aboute of eche. þ t þer wiþoute mete & drynke, : him þou&yogh;te, euermo He mi&yogh;te libbe wiþ alle Ioie, : &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te þer among go. &yogh;if he mi&yogh;t. Ac þ t ne laste bote lute stounde, : þ t þe leme ne wiþdrou&yogh;; Ac naþeles, þei it lute laste, : hi were alle uolle Inou&yogh;. fol y nou. þis kny&yogh;t stod & bihuld aboute, : & ri&yogh;te stat vnder stod; Vor ri&yogh;te stat fehlt his. biholþ. & his ri&yogh;t. So uol he was of þis holi leom, : þ t so dilicious was & good, leme. delicious. þ t , þei he lyuede, him þo&yogh;te, euermo : & neuereft mete ete, ne ete. He ne scholde neuer to mete luste, : so good was þe leom & swete. him ne scholle. leste. Lo, sede þis oþer gost : þ t him scewede al þis place, scheweþ. Nou þ u hast somdel iseie : of our lordes grace: oure.
