Of pynes þ t wreche gostes : habbeþ uor hor mysdede, of pine. wrecce. & of Ioie þ t gode gostes : In parays doþ lede, paradis. & somdel ek of þe grete Ioie : þ t In heuene is; heuen. & ech day we beþ yued enes : wiþ such Ioie & blis, eche dai. & þenne beþ we al day uolle Inou&yogh;, : uorte our lord ous more sende: þan be we. for st. uolle. forþ oure. Ac such Ioie hi þ t in heuene beþ : habbe wiþoute ende, Vor such Ioie ist in wegpunktirt; die Originalhandschrift las wol : in such Ioie — beþ, wie Mss. Cott. Laud u. Bodl.; darauf deutet auch in Ms. Eg. in vor more. ac in such ioie hi þ t in heuen beþ: beþ wit oute ende. & &yogh;ut somdel more, : uor hit ne woneþ hem neuermo; in more. waneþ him (!). & we ne beþ aday bote enes Iued, : uorte þ t we þuder go, &, wenne þ t we þuder comeþ, : we scholleþ wiþouten ende, whan we, þ t fehlt . wit oute nende. & þ u , &yogh;if þ u it wolt aseruy : þuder uorte wende; & &yogh;if þ u hit wolt of serui. forto. As þi wille is þ u mi&yogh;t do, : wen þ u comest to erþe iwis, wil. & þuder þ u most a&yogh;en, : uor al tyme it is; alle. & &yogh;if þ u wolt þer good lif lede, : þi mede þ u mi&yogh;t ise, Ms. lete st. lede. þere. lede. & also, wat pynes þe abideþ, : &yogh;if þ u wolt luþer be. & fehlt . A&yogh;en þ u most wende anon; : go uorþ a godes name, & go sikerliche, uor þe deuelen : mowe do þe nammore schame: ne mowe þ e do namore. Adrad hi beþ wel sore of þe, : & aschamed in ech side; of schamet. A godes name go uorþ þi wei, : uor þ u ne mi&yogh;t no leng abide! A, sire, mercy! quaþ þis kny&yogh;t, : wat so me euer bitide, what me so. A fot Inele fram &yogh;ou go, : wrechede goþ so wide, i nel fro &yogh;o gon. wrechede fehlt . Ac let me bileue wiþ &yogh;ou her, : uor, &yogh;if i c fram &yogh;ou wende, me let. w t &yogh;ow &yogh;er (!). fro &yogh;e. Adrad icham of þe deuel : þ t he myd sunne me scende. me fehlt . Nai, beu frere, quaþ þis oþer, : þ u mi&yogh;t as wel be stille; A&yogh;en þ u schalt to erþe anon, : þ u mi&yogh;t do þer þyn wille; steht unten am Ende der Seite; der Anschluss ist mit a — b bezeichnet. Nach V. 572 fehlen hier durch Versehen des Schreibers 2 Verse, die in allen and. Mss. stehen; die erste Halbz. von V. 573 muss heissen : a godes half wend a&yogh;en anon, so in d. and. Mss. — dere. Nach 572 folgen die Verse: & &yogh;if þ u seruest wel our lord siker þ u mi&yogh;t be a&yogh;en come hider to ous & suþþe to heuen fle a godes half wenþ e a&yogh;en a non . for siker þ u schalt so. A&yogh;en þ u schalt to erþe anon, : uor siker þ u schalt so. Alas, (alas,) quaþ þis kny&yogh;t, : wat schal i c nou do? Ms. alas ein|mal; alle and. Mss. alas alas, wie auch das Versmass verlangt . alas alas. now. Al þe Ioie þ t i c habbe iseie, : nou it worþ me bynome, alle. ich abbe. & to þe wrechede þ t is anerþe, : alas, schal i c come. schal ich nou come. Al wepynde out ate &yogh;ate : hi bro&yogh;te him ate laste; hat Ms. Laud je einen Vers mehr. weping. atte. at laste. & anon, so he was wiþoute, : þ t &yogh;at hi made uaste. hat Ms. Laud je einen Vers mehr. & fehlt. þer wit oute. As he com er, wiþ dreri mod : þe wei a&yogh;en he nom. þen wei. Ac, wen eny deuel þ t pyned him er : a&yogh;en him awer com, As wode screwen (hi) flowen him uaste, : hi ne dorste abide him no&yogh;t. Im Ms. fehlt hi vor flowen. hi flowe. Atelaste þis kny&yogh;t was : to þe halle ibro&yogh;t, Im Ms. fehlt :. at þe laste. As þe holi companye : þuderward to him wende. company. Adoun he sat softe þer, : uorte our lord him grace sende. sente. As he sat & bi huld aboute, : þer come In sone þer Al þis noble companye, : þ t a&yogh;en him com er. compani. come. Alle hi honourede him uaire : & herede him wel uaste, wel faire. & ihū also, godes sone, : þ t is bileue so wel ilaste. laste. Beu frere, he sede, wen þ u hast : so strong penaunce idriue, he sede auch in Mss. Bodl. u. Eg.; Cott. hat hi, Laud heo sede; hi ist wol richtiger . hi sede. such st. so. Siker be þe þ t þyne sunnes clanliche : beþ uor&yogh;iue; þe auch in Ms. Eg.; die and. Mss . þou. siker þ u be. þin sinnes. þe beþ. Loke, wen þ u comst to erþe a&yogh;en, : clene lif þ t þ u lede, lok. comest. þ t þ u neuereft in pyne come : uor sunne ne mysdede; ne come. ne for mis dede. þ u most do þe henne anon, : uor atom in þyne londe athom. dyn. It daweþ cler, & is nei day, : as i c vnderstonde, dawet clere. & þe priour wiþ procession : to þe &yogh;ate comeþ sone, prior. To loke war þ u be icome, : as ri&yogh;t is uorto done; wher. &, bote he þe fynde þer, : he wole make þe &yogh;at anon & be siker þ t þ u ne comest nammore, : & hamward dreri gon. ne fehlt . þis kny&yogh;t hi bro&yogh;te out of þis halle, : & blessed him echon, blesseþ e & biteite him god, lif & soule, : uel & flesch & bon. bi tok. Vorþ he wende dreriliche, : bote as he moste nede do. wente. &, ri&yogh;t as he com to þis &yogh;at, : þe priour com also A&yogh;en him wiþ procession, : to loke hou it were. Anon so he hadde þe &yogh;at vnloke, : þe kny&yogh;t he fond þere. þer was Ioie & blisse Inou&yogh;, : þo hi to gadere come. hij. Wiþ song & wiþ orisons : þen kny&yogh;t out hi nome, Ms. orisous. & ladde him to chirche anon, : & herede our lord uaste. him forþ. þis kny&yogh;t biuore þe heie weued : akne adoun him caste, a fore þe heie hauter. anon st. adoun. & uaste in is orisons : viftene dawes he lay, Ms. orisous. & herede our swete lord uaste : boþe ny&yogh;t & day. boþe fehlt. & suþþe in is bare flech : þe holi crois he nom flesch. & wende to þe holi lond, : & holi mon bicom, wente. & ne tolde neuer of þe world, : bote as he were in þo&yogh;te, neuereft. as he euer were in þou&yogh;t. & wende him uorþ er simpliche, : as him noþing rou&yogh;te. er, in Ms. Cott. fehlend , = euer. went. er fehlt. ne rou&yogh;te. Al ofte he tolde of alle men : þ t in parais were; Al wol st. ac. ac ofte. As him þo&yogh;te, greie monekes : in mest Ioie he sei þere, grei monkes. None men in so gret Ioie, : ne in so gret honur he ne sei: non men. hous st. honur. Ne no wonder sikerliche, : uor þe ordre is noble & hei. Wen &yogh;e habbeþ nou alle ihurd, : hou our lord send is grace ou hour (!) lord sende. S. patric, þulke purgatorie : to vynde in þulke place, Vorte warny men aboute : hor sunnes her to bete, for to. hor st. her (!). Vor þe loue of ihū crist : & is moder suete: & of his. Beteþ alle &yogh;oure sunne her, : as god wole &yogh;ou grace sende, þ t we wiþþoute oþer pyne : to parais henne wende. we st. &yogh;e. þ t &yogh;e.

1.1: Seint patrik com þorw god . to prechi in yrlonde, To teche þe ri&yogh;te bileue . of ihū to vnderstonde. So fol of wormes was þe lond, . þ t mon ne mi&yogh;te gon In som stude for wormes, . þat nas wemmed an on. Seint patrik bad oure lord . þat lond deliuered were Vor lond fehlt þe oder þat. Of þe foule wormes, . þat non ne come þere. Oure lord herde is bone, . vor þer mi&yogh;te neuer eft come No foul worm in þat lond, . þat is lif nas bi nome. Gras þat groweþ in þe lond, . ne erþe of þe lond al so, Ne þoleþ no venim in þe lond . nei&yogh; hem beo ido; No worm ne comeþ þer, . þat he nis anon lif les, Bote alute schort euede, . & &yogh;ut it is tail les. Muche clannesse and muche god, . whose vnderstonde, Vor þe loue of seint patrik . oure lord dude in þat londe. A god monnes schep was stole; . to seint patrik com tidinge; He het, whose it hedde istole, . a&yogh;en hit to bringe. þe gode mon het so ofte, . ac a&yogh;en com hit nou&yogh;t. Am Rande : Miraculum. In an hei&yogh; day, as þe folk . to chirche was ibrou&yogh;t, Seint patrik het, &yogh;if in þe chirche . ani mossel were Of þe schep, þ t it scholde blete . among hem alle þere. þo gan it blete in is wombe . þ t hedde þe schep istole, Among þe men, þat it ne mi&yogh;te . no leng ben ihole. Sore he was aschamed . þat men for þef him knewe; He bad milce and ore, . and bicom wel trewe. Now hadde seint patrik . awone, ofte ilome To aloute to ech crois, . whar so he euer come. Ueber crois ist im Ms. † geschr . A day, as he wende aboute . prechinge in þe londe, Seint patrik aloute to ech crois . þ t he sei&yogh; owhare stonde. A crois þer stod, þ t men sei&yogh;e, . ac he ne sei&yogh; it nou&yogh;t, þer fore he loutede not þer to . . men wondrede in here þou&yogh;t, And ashte whi he loutede no&yogh;t . to þ t crois þere. þis holi mon bi heol aboute . and ashte whare it were: bi heol st. bi heold. He ne mi&yogh;te þis crois seo; . in gret þou&yogh;t he stod. Gret wonder hedde þe volk, . and wende he were wod. þo seide a vois to hem: . ne misbileue &yogh;e nou&yogh;t! þei&yogh; he ne mowe hit iseo, . ne wondreþ in oure þou&yogh;t, oure = &yogh;oure, vgl. V. 259. Vor hit is vor mi sunne . þat mine bones liggeþ here, And mid &yogh;ow i speke, . þis holi mon to skere; A sarzin ich was on erþe, . mi soule in helle is; Vor mine bones liggeþ so nei&yogh;, . he siþ not þe crois iwis. Euere þe gode mon prechinde . þe contrei out sou&yogh;te. A stude he fond bare, . þ t no fruit forþ ne brou&yogh;te; þau&yogh; me sewe and sette, . þer ne com forþ non þere. Seint patrik bad oure lord . tokninge, whi it were. In þe erþe mid is staf . he made a cerle aboute: Ms. cerle st. cercle. Ms. he made a cerle he made; das 2. he made zu tilgen . þer bicom a deop put, . þat men hedden of gret doute. þis godemon wondrede whi it was, . ac angel him sede: Vor angel fehlt an. þat þer was apurgatorie, . þ t ech mon mi&yogh;te of drede; Ms. þat mit Zeichen der Abkürzung von er über þ. Soulen weren þer inne ido, . here sunnes vorto bete þat heo ne betten not on erþe, . ar heo here lif lete; And, were aman quik oþer ded . þ t þer inne come, He ne scholde habbe oþer purgatorie . ar þe day of dome, Ac after he scholde to heuene, . &yogh;if he were god ifounde, And al so, &yogh;if he luþer were, . into helle grounde. Oure lord tok seint patrik a staf . wiþ is owne honde, a staf auch in Ms. Bodl. (u. Laud). þat he fond wiþ purgatorie, . iheried beo godes sonde. In yrlonde is &yogh;et þat staf . wiþ nobleie inow, And vor relike iholde, . and elles were wow. Seint patrik in þulke stude, . as þis purgatorie is, Of religion bi gan an hous, . þat &yogh;ut stont iwis, And chanons made þer, . as &yogh;et beþ also. þe put he lette vaste close, . þat nomon come þer to. In þe chirch&yogh;ard þe put is, . toward þe est side, Est vram þe hei&yogh;e weued, . as men scheweþ wide. Walled hit is aboute, . and vaste loke þe &yogh;at; þe prior witeþ þe kei&yogh;e, . þat non come þer at. Ms. nom st. non. Biseint patrikes dai&yogh;e . men wende þer inne ilome, And suþþe also moni on, . ac fewe a&yogh;en þer come. And þilke þat come a&yogh;en, . of þat heo sei&yogh;en, tolde, As hit is in þe hous iwrite . and priueliche iholde. þe manere is of ech mon . þ t þer inne went, þat it beo to amende is sunne, . &yogh;if oure lord him grace sent. To þe bischop of þe londe . he schal him vurst schriue, And bidde leue to go þat wei, . to amende is liue. Ac þe bischop rat a&yogh;en, . and resons wole schewe, And seþ þat vele þider goþ, . ac a&yogh;en comeþ bote fewe. &yogh;if þe mon be stable . of þat he haþ ibede, þe bischop wole lettres make . to þe priour of þe stude. þe priour wole eke rede . vorto change is þou&yogh;t; Ac, whanne he siþ him studefast, . þat he nele leuen nou&yogh;t, Mid gret procession . to þe put he worþ ibrou&yogh;t. And &yogh;if me ne mai þere . &yogh;ut change is þou&yogh;t, Into chirche hi wolen him lede . & setten him on kneo; þere he schal vif(t)ene dawes . in is orison beo. Ms. vifene.
1.2: þe procession schal turne a&yogh;en, . as ri&yogh;t is to done, And after þe fiftene dawes(!) . bringen him þider eft sone. Anders die and. Mss. Bote he come in certein time a&yogh;en, . wiþ gret deol and sore Heo torneþ a&yogh;an, & siker beþ . þat he ne comeþ na more. Ms. a&yogh;an st. a&yogh;en.
1.3: HJt bi fel bi king steuens day, . þ t now late was, Ms. Eg. u. Bodl. haben hier eine Initiale. Of akni&yogh;t, þat het owein, . awel wonder cas. To þe bischop to schrift . þat kni&yogh;t owein com, And repentaunce of is sunne . & deol and serwe nom. þe bischop him gan to chide . vor þat he hedde mis do, And seide, he was manne worst, . vorto sunge so; Me ne mi&yogh;te do him such wo, . þat he nere worþi more. þe kni&yogh;t mid sor herte . wep and si&yogh;te sore. Whanne, he seide, icham monne worst . & worst habbe ido, To þe sunne þat grettest is . mest penaunce mot þer to, Whanne among alle men . mest sunfol icham, alas, Strengest penaunce ichulle take . þ t euere ifounde was: Ichulle take godes grace . and in his name wende To seint patrikes purgatorie, . sende what god me sende. Ou, beu frere, quaþ þat bischop, . beo stille! whi seistou so? Crist for bede þat þou neuer . such folie ne do! Vnneþe comeþ ani a&yogh;en . þat þider deþ wende; Nolde god þ t þou it dust, . bodi and soule to schende! And wend into religion, . & lef þer to þi liues ende: And þou schalt þi sunne bete, . such grace god wole þe sende. Certes, sire, quaþ þe kni&yogh;t, . þow mi&yogh;t as wel beo stille, Vor ichulle þat dede do, . do god bi me is wille; So muche as ichabbe iserued, . ine may habbe of wo; þer fore sei what ischal, . vor siker ichulle it go. þe bischop prechede him faste, . vorte change is þou&yogh;t; Ac ate laste, þo he sai&yogh; . þat it was al for nou&yogh;t, To þe prior of þe stude . lettres he made sone, þat he scholde bi him do, . as bi such was to done. þe priour of þe stude him prechede vaste . & seide resouns inowe, &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te chaunge is þou&yogh;t, . þ t he þer of wiþ drowe. Ac al was for nou&yogh;t, . as seiþ(!) ate nende: Vor seiþ fehlt hit. He nolde for noþing leue . þat perylous wey to wende. g in noþing überschr . þe priour him nom biþe hond . and to chirche him brou&yogh;te. þer efel adoun akneo . & oure lordes grace bi sou&yogh;te; In fastinge and in orisons . viftene ni&yogh;t he lay, To bidde oure lordes grace; . & þe vifteneþe day, þe couent com abouten him, . & oþer prestes al so And clerkes, wiþ procession, . þe seruise vorte do. Vor him heo songen an hei&yogh; masse. & on god crieden vaste, Oure lordes vlesch and is blod . heo &yogh;euen him ate laste, And sprengden him mid holi water, . & here orisons sede. Wiþ crois and wiþ procession . to þe put heo gonnen him lede, And hei&yogh;e songe þe letanie, . & holi water bere, & alle godes halewen beden . þat heo is help were. þe prior vnlek þe puttes dore . among hem echon. Beufrere, eseide, her is þi wey . þat þ u woldest gon; &yogh;if þow wolt do bi red, . þi þou&yogh;t þou schalt wende And oþer manere þi sunnes bete, . as god wole grace sende; Vor vewe þer comeþ a&yogh;en . of hem þat wenden yn bifore, Ac for tormens and for wo . lif & soule for lore. Certes, sire, quaþ þe kni&yogh;t, . rede what þow me rede, þe wei ich nime in godes name, . to amende mi mis dede; Vor is loue þ t vs bou&yogh;te . biddeþ vor me echon! Lif & soule i c him bitake . & in is name yn gon. He blessede him, & &yogh;eode yn, . & bitok vlesch and bon. Nach bitok fehlt god. þe prior sprengde holi water, . & lek þe dore anon. þis gode kni&yogh;t wende forþ, . baldeliche and vaste, Bi an holw wey vnder erþe, . on god is herte ecaste; He ne sei&yogh; not vor derkhede, . ac nou&yogh;t he him agaste. So longe, him þou&yogh;te, þat e sai&yogh; . vair li&yogh;t ate laste; þideward ewende, so þat ecom . þere nei&yogh;. Ms. þideward st. þiderward; auch 241 . þe faireste feld þat mi&yogh;te beo . ate wei&yogh;es ende e sei&yogh;. þer inne he wente murie; . amidde þe feld e fonde þe nobleste halle þat mi&yogh;te beo . a whare in ani londe. Ri&yogh;t cler nas þe weder nou&yogh;t, . bote as it were nei&yogh; eue. To bi holde þat noble werk, . astounde he gan bi leue; þe walles were lowe, . ac þer aboute iwis steht unten am Rande. Cointe pilers þer weren, . as monkes cloistre is. In he &yogh;ede a godes name, . & sat al one an hei&yogh;, And bi huld abouten . and þ t werk isei&yogh;. As he bi huld þus aboute, . þer com yn at þe on ende Twelf men in white vestimens, . swiþe fair & hende, Heore croune vaire ischore, . & vaire heo him grette, And seten alle faire adoun, . & þis kni&yogh;t bi hem sette. þo spak on, þat was maister, . mildeliche and stille: Beu frere, hered beo god, . þat sende þe such wille, And lete þat þou hast bi gonne . þorw is grace wel ende! Beu frere, now þou wolt þis wey . vor þi sunne wende: Oþer þou most beo studefast . and nou&yogh;t torne þi þou&yogh;t,
1.4: Oþer þou worþ al ilore . & adeuelewey ibrou&yogh;t; Ms. ilorore. Vor, whanne we goþ henne, . deueles luþere and þicke Die Reime sind umzustellen. Wolleþ come aboute þe . in þis hous wel wicke, Die Reime sind umzustellen. And do þe tormens inowe, . & bihoten þe wel more; Joie heo wolleþ bi hote þe, . &yogh;if þou wolt leuen here lore; And heo mid bi heste . mowe þe ouer come, Siker þou worþ lif and soule . a deuele wei inome; &yogh;if þou art stable in þou&yogh;t . and in ihū dest þenche, Ne vor biheste ne vor no wo . vram him neltou blenche, þou worþ quit of þi sunnes, . þ t þ u hast euere iwrou&yogh;t, And þou schalt seo þe ioie . þ t gode soules beþ inne ibrou&yogh;t, & þe pine þat luþere men . habbeþ for here misdede; Ac, in what wo þat þou art in, . þench on god, ich rede! Whanne heo þe tormenteþ, . crie ihū milce and ore, And, &yogh;if þou beo studefast, . hi ne schule tormente þe na more;
1.5: We bi takeþ þe ihū crist, . we redeþ þ u do oure lore. þo nuste he war heo bicome. . he sat and si&yogh;te sore, Elinge he sat al one, . ecriede on godes mi&yogh;te, And armede him mid holi bedes, . a&yogh;en þe deuelen to fi&yogh;te; On þe holi gost e criede, . þat he him ne scholde faile. He lokede, whanne deuelen come, . him forte asaile. He sat in godes name, . bataile vorte abide. þer com a sori deolfol cri . abouten in eche side, As al þe world to borste, . and, as him þou&yogh;te, also: þei&yogh; alle þe bestes of þe world . to gadere weren ido An as grisliche as heo mi&yogh;ten . alle &yogh;ellinge were, Hi ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t alle make . so grisliche a bere; &yogh;if his hope & is herte . þe more in ihū nere, He hedde wod bicome . and lore is wit for fere. Heo comen þicke abouten him . & grisliche þere, &yogh;ellinge and grennynge . mid wel sori chere. Belami, quaþ on of hem, . þ u hast ari&yogh;t ido; We au&yogh;ten wel honure þe alle, . vor to vewe don so; Oþer wolleþ abide, . vorte here lif be hem bi nome, And &yogh;et hit is a&yogh;en here wille, . ar heo hidere come; Ac þou comest bi þi self, . & wiþ gode wille al so; Wel au&yogh;te we þi wille &yogh;elden, . & gret þonk þe do; Whan þou hast bodi and soule . bitake vs liue, Saun&yogh; faile we were vnkunde, . bote we it &yogh;olde bliue; &yogh;if þou wolt on erþe . ioie &yogh;et habbe more, Vor þ u þus to vs art come . al bi þin owe lore, Sikere vs þ t þou wolt . in oure seruise bileue, And we wolleþ a&yogh;en þe lede, . ar it come eue; þow schalt habbe ioie inow, . in halle and in boure, Vor non nis so murie þer . as þilke þat beþ oure; Noble mon þow schalt beo, . & men schulen honure þe; Whan þ u art ded and hider comest, . þ u schalt fare as wel as we. þis kni&yogh;t þou&yogh;te in ihū crist, . he nolde change is wille, Vor þreting ne vor bi heste, . ac sat him euer stille. þo he nolde grante nou&yogh;t . þat he wolde to hem wende, Heo grenneden on him foule, . & fuir heo gonnen tende. þe kni&yogh;t heo bounden fot and honden, . & in þe fuir him caste; Wiþ irene hokes & newles . heo to drowen him faste. þis kni&yogh;t, þo he sei&yogh; nede, . loude criede anon: Ihū, ihū, help me now, . & schilde me vram mine fon! Anon þo þis was seid, . þe fuir aqueinte ech spronge; Ms. spronge st. spronke. þe deuelen drowe him na more. . oure lord he gan to þonke, And þe hardiere he was, . þo he þis isei&yogh;, And þe lasse þe deuelen dradde, . þ t weren him so nei&yogh;. Grisliche þe schrewen &yogh;olle . þat hem failede here mi&yogh;te, Heo vlowen out of þe halle, . & drowe mid hem þe kni&yogh;te. Heo drowen him a&yogh;en þe grount . boþe fet and honde, Swiþe fer aboute . into a gret wast londe. So blak and derk it was, . þat he noþing ne say Bote deuelen þat him to drowe, . þ t were him þicke & nei&yogh;(!). Ac a softe wind þer was, . þat he herde vnneþe; So scharp and cold it blew, . hit brou&yogh;te him to deþe; Hit wende þorw is herte . and þorw bodi al so, Vor bodi fehlt is. þ t him were leuere þan al þe world, . & þe pine were ido. þus heo drowen him, as him þou&yogh;te, . ri&yogh;t forþ est iwis, As þe sonne ariseþ, . whan þe day lengest is. þo heo comen, as him þou&yogh;te, . ri&yogh;t to þe worldes ende, Heo tornden bi abrod valei&yogh;e, . & souþward gonnen wende, þideward as þe sonne . at midwinter deþ arise; Wo was him for drawe . & pined on alle wise. þo þou&yogh;te him þat he herde fer, . bifore him as it were, Swiþe deolfol cri . and swiþe reuþfol bere; Euer þe ner þat he com, . þe reulokere was þe cri; So longe þat him þou&yogh;te . þat heo weren þer bi. þo comen heo in to a feld; . more ne mi&yogh;te non beo, So long it was in eche side, . þ t he ne mi&yogh;te non ende seo. Of men and wimmen þis feld . was fol in eche side, þe wombe toward þe grounde . abrod isprad wel wide, Vet and honden al abrod . to þe erþe faste ibounde Wiþ nailes of yre, al furi, . ismite þorw to þe grounde. þes gostes þus ipined were . wiþ yrenes al of fure; So deolfol cri heo maden, . þat it was deol to hure; Heo crieden merci deolfoliche, . ac me nolde non hem do; Vor anguise heo gnowe þe erþe . & here tonges al so. Deuelen ourne aboute . vpe hem al to grounde, Wiþ newles heo hem to drowe . wiþ moni a dep wounde. Alas, whi ne beo &yogh;e war, . oure sunnes her to bete, Ar &yogh;e come to purgatorie, . wiþ luþer gostes to mete? Vor in purgatorie heo beþ . as wel as in helle, And worþeþ forte þe dai of dome, . telle what me telle. Heo seiden : as þou sist þese men pined, . þ u schalt al so, Bote þ u þi þou&yogh;t turne . and after vs do. þo he nolde in no manere, . to grounde heo him caste, To turmenten him, as oþer weren, . & to nailen him faste.
1.6: Ac he criede to ihū crist, . þo him smart so sore: þer nas non of hem þo, . þ t mi&yogh;te greuen him more. þo þe schrewen ne mi&yogh;te . here wille habbe þo, Heo drowen him into anoþer feld, . ful of more wo, Of men and wimmen fol, . vpri&yogh;t sprad to þe grounde, Vet and honden vpri&yogh;t . to þe erþe ibounde, Wiþ furi nailes of yre . nailed vaste þer to; Eddren furi vpen hem sete, . and toden grete al so vpen st. vpon. Die and. Mss. crapoudes st. toden. Somme eddren hem bi clipte . so vaste al aboute, þat hem þou&yogh;te hem scholde berste, . so hei grunte(!) wiþ oute; hem vor scholde st. heo.
1.7: Somme sete anowarde, . and here vlesch to gnowe, And wiþ al furi teþ . wombe & breste to drowe; Summe bounde, somme gnowe, . & somme stronge bite.
1.8: þe todeden, þat weren so foule, . vpe here hertes sete, Ms. todeden st. toden. And stongen in þe hertes . wiþ here hertes grete. das 2 te hertes st. wrottes verschrieben . Luþere gostes ourne al so . abouten hem inowe, Wiþ newles and wiþ scorges . þe wrecches al to drowe. þe wrecche soules, þat weren . in þe pines brou&yogh;te, in überschr . Heo &yogh;ollen & crieden deolfoliche, . & hem help ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;te. þe deueles nome þe kni&yogh;t, . & wolden him pine also, Ac, þo he criede on ihū crist, . heo brou&yogh;ten him not þer to. &yogh;ut deuelen him nome . & to þe þridde veld him drowe. þer he sei&yogh; in tormens . wrecche gostes inowe I preoned to þe erþe . & ismite þorw out echon, As þicke nailes in ech stude, . as þer mi&yogh;te stiken on, Im An|fang fehlt wol wiþ. þ t me ne mi&yogh;te finde place . in here bodi so lute, þat me ne mi&yogh;te for þicke nailes . afingres ende pute. ne, auch in Ms. Bodl., ist zu tilgen. A smart wind to oþer wo . on hem blew wel faste, þat hem þou&yogh;te heo for barnden . þorw out mid eche blaste. Deuelen orne aboute . vram on to oþer inowe, And here vlesch to oþer wo . mid newles al to drowe. So weren þe wrecches ipined . & in tormens brou&yogh;t; As heo mi&yogh;ten heo crieden; : vnneþ c me herde hem ou&yogh;t, Vor heo weren so ouercome, . þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten vnneþe Bringen out ani vois, . bote as aman vpe þe point of deþe: Al in þe þrote heo crieden, . as here strengþe were bi nome
1.9: Mid muche pine, & no wonder . þei heo weren ouer come. Deuelen nomen þis kni&yogh;t . and to grounde him caste; Heo sworen, bote he tornde is þou&yogh;t, . heo wolden him naile faste. Ac he criede on ihū crist, . and nempnede is name; þe deuelen nadden no power . to don him more schame. Heo nomen & drowen him . in þe ferþe felde, Of brimston al berninge, . hei&yogh;e sprong þe spelde. Ech pine þat mi&yogh;te beo . in þilke felde he sei&yogh;: Somme wiþ irene cheines, . al furi, henge an hei&yogh;, Somme bi arme, somme bi fet, bi þe necke mani on, And henge in strong fuir . of pich and brimston; Sume hunge bi hokes, . iput in eiþer ei&yogh;e, And þorw þe þrote somme . weren ihonged hei&yogh;e, Somme þorw þe derne limes, . & somme þorw þe tete; Hem were leuer þan al þe world, . here lif to lete; Somme on gredirens of yren . irosted weren al so: Summe as gees in spites, . þorw out hem ido, Somme lei&yogh;en vpard, . &yogh;eninde wel faste, Deuelen wellinge led and bras . in here hei (!) caste. He ne mi&yogh;te no pine þenche, . þat he ne sei&yogh; þere. Him þou&yogh;te he sei&yogh; monie þer . þ t he knew on erþe here. Deuelen him casten a doun . among þe oþere echon, Ac he criede on ihū crist, . & deliuered was anon. &yogh;ut deueles þis kni&yogh;t . to anoþer place drowe. þer inne he sei&yogh; agrisliche whel . wiþ longe spoken inowe, þe on ende toward þe grounde, . þe oþer vp an hei&yogh;, Aboute was fol of pikes, . as he þere isei&yogh;. Vor was fehlt hit. þese hokes & þes pikes . weren riuen al so Wiþ wrecche gostes also (!), . þer on weren ido. Statt also haben die and. Mss. aboute. Vor þer on fehlt þat. Al berninge was þe wheol, . & stinkinge of brimston; þe gostes þat þer on were . berninge were echon. þe deuelen wenden forþ . & hokes þeron caste In eiþer side, and wheol . turnde aboute so vaste, Vor wheol fehlt þe. þat þe gostes þ t þeron honge . nou&yogh;t heo ne sei&yogh;e, So vaste turnde þe wheol . aboute(!) berninge lei&yogh;e; Nach aboute fehlt bote. Ms. scheinbar bei&yogh;e st. lei&yogh;e. Ac deol foliche heo crieden . & &yogh;olle ech in is ende. Allas, whi nelle men beo war, . ar heo henne wende? Her heo mid lute pine . mi&yogh;ten beten here mis dede, & þere heo schulen deore abugge, . alas, þ t wrechede. Vendes nomen þis kni&yogh;t . & on þe wheol him caste, And mid oþer gostes him turnde aboute vaste; He criede on ihū crist, . and deliuered was anon. þe deuelen stoden & him bihelde . mid dreri mod echon. &yogh;ut heo nome bitterliche . & ferþere him ladde, Heo harleden him forþ, . & loude &yogh;olle and gradde. A gret hous he sei&yogh; stonde, : long and brod inow; þe stench & hete, þ t þer out com, . him þou&yogh;te almest him slow. He wiþ stod, & nolde is þonkes . vor stench go no ner. Vorþ þ u schalt, þe deuelen seide, . þ u ne schalt abiden her; A baþ it is þat þ u sist, . þer inne þou schalt beo And baþie mid oþere þere, . þou ne schalt not vleo. þe gostes þat þer inne were, . deofoliche heo criede And loude, as he herde, . abouten in eche side. þe kni&yogh;t mid deueles . into þis hous com. Of tormen þat he þer sei&yogh; . gret &yogh;eme he nom; Vor vol of puttes & of diches . þ t hous wiþ inne was, And al fol of tormens, . empti non þer nas: He weren fol of well(i)nge led, . and of brimston, Ms. wellnge st. wellinge. Of bras, and of oþer tormens, . berninge euer vchon. Wrecche gostes þer inne he sei&yogh;, . turmens tilde so hei&yogh;e: hei&yogh;e mit unorgan. h, vgl. v. 322. Somme al aboue þe heued, . & somme to þe hei&yogh;e, Somme to þe nese, somme to þe mouþ, . & summe to þe swere, And somme to þe brestes, . heo bou&yogh;ten here sunnes dere, Somme to nauele, . and somme dounere more, And somme to þe kneo, . heo crieden and wepten sore.
1.10: Now þou sist, þe deuelen seden, . whoder þou schalt gon, Bote þou anoþer speke . & to vs torne anon. Heo casten him in a put; . on ihū anon he criede, And com vp al sound, . him ne luste no leng abide. þe fendes in grete wraþþe . harleden vorþere more fehlt him nach harleden. And brou&yogh;ten him vpon agret hul, . ful of sorwe and sore. He bi huld al aboute, . þo he com vp an hei&yogh;; Him wondrede of so fele gostes . þat he þer isei&yogh;e, þat alle þat he sei&yogh; raþere . þer a&yogh;en no&yogh;t nere; Vpe here ton heo seten i clu&yogh;t, . & quakeden for fere. In þe souþ half of þe hul . a dep water was & lowe, þat voule stank & caldere was . þan ani ys oþer snowe; A norþere wind þer blew, . him þou&yogh;te is vlesch rende. fehlt þat vor him. Euere sete þe gostes . & a&yogh;en þe wind hem wende, And quakeden vaste . vor drede & pine stronge, And abide as who sei&yogh; (!) time, . þe deþ vorte afonge. Lo, quaþ a foul fend, . þ u nost not what þis is; Bote þ u þi þou&yogh;t turne, . þ u schalt wite iwis. He nadde bote þat word sed, . þ t þer ne com awind blowe And smot alle þe gostes . into þe water al lowe. þe norþerne wind hem blew adoun, . alle mid one blaste, þe gostes & þe kni&yogh;t . a midde þe water caste. More pine ne mi&yogh;te beo . of chele and of stenche, þan þe gostes þer hedde, . þer ne mi&yogh;te non ablenche. þo þe kni&yogh;t þis stronge pine . of þis water felde, He gan to crie on ihū crist, . þat failede him wel selde: Anon wiþ oute lette out of þe water edrow. fehlt . nach der Halbz. Ac þe gostes bi leuede þer in wo and serwe inow, fehlt . nach der Halbz. Vor in þe water, so colde, . & so stinkinge al so, þe gostes swommen vp & doun, . here wo was neuer ido. Deuelen orne on þe water, . as men doþ on londe, And, whanne ani clambrede vp . mid vet and mid honde, Anon heo drowen hem adoun,.þ t þer ne mi&yogh;te ascape non; þer was wo and serwe inow . among hem echon. &yogh;ut þe deuelen wenden forþ, . & þis kni&yogh;t heo nome And drowe him in to astude, . þer heo nou&yogh;t er ne come. Heo comen and stoden ouer aput, . wid & dep inow; Berninge smoke, þat voule stonk, . out of þat put drow, þat þe kni&yogh;t vnneþe stod . vor sori stench ney. Wrecche gostes vpe þe put . in þat smoke he sey Vlen vp and doun, berninge, . as sparkles doþ of fure, And in to þe put wenden a&yogh;en, . whan heo ne mi&yogh;ten no leng dure. Him þou&yogh;te he was nei&yogh; ouercome . vor þe blast þ t þer of drow, þer bi he wuste þat in þe ground . was wo and sorwe inow. þe deuelen asshden þe kni&yogh;t: . þinkeþ þe her of wonder, Of þe swartnesse(!)þ t her bloweþ, . & what beo her vnder? In þis put is oure woning, . vor helle þer vnder is, And, for þou art come hider, . her þou schalt wone iwis, Vor, who þat serueþ vs wel, . hider he schal wende, And, be þ u her inne brou&yogh;t, . þou worþ wiþ outen ende; þer fore torn þi þou&yogh;t . & do vs here manrede, And þe wei as þou come . al saf we schulen þe lede; And þe tit on erþe al þi lif . richesse & ioie al so, Vor we þe schulen finde, . as ri&yogh;t is þat we do. Ac þo he vor sok here bi heste, . as he hedde do lome, Heo smiten doun in þis put, . & þe kni&yogh;t mid hem nome. þe deppore þat heo þer inne come,.þe braddore þe put was, þ t al þe wo þ t he er sey . þer a&yogh;en no&yogh;t nas. Of stench & of oþer wo . þis kni&yogh;t was so ouercome, þat is wit toward ihū crist . him was almest binome; So muche pine nas neuere, . him þou&yogh;te, as he felde, þ t he was vpe þe point . þe gost vorte &yogh;elde. Ac oure lord in is wo . grace him &yogh;af ate laste, So þat he þou&yogh;te on ihū crist . & on him criede vaste. A smoke þer com out smite, . and mid stronge blaste þis kni&yogh;t aboue þe put, . & moni gostes, caste; þe kni&yogh;t wirlede in þe wing, : as sparclen doþ, wide, Ms. wing st. wind. Ate laste he li&yogh;te a doun . aboue þe put biside. þer he stod and bihuld . as man þ t witles were, Vor pine þ t he hadde . he nuste how he com þere. þo he hedde longe stonde . & biholde aboute, þer com vp of þe put . od deuelen a gret route, Ms. od st. of, durch Assimilation? And alle abouten him stode, . al newe as þei&yogh; e were; He sei&yogh; hem, as him þou&yogh;te, . neuer bote þere. Heo bi hulden him grisliche, . & grenneden al a boute. Whi stanstou þer? heo seiden, . com forþ to oure route! What, tolden oure felawes . þ t þe put of helle was þis? Hit nis not so, ac þou schalt . wite whare it is;
1.11: Or felawes lowen, . þis nis not þe put of helle, Ac þ u schalt þider wiþ vs, . as soþ as we þe telle. Vendes harleden him forþ, . wo was him to drawe: Him were leuere þan ani þing, . he were of lif dawe. So heo comen to awater, . dep and brod inow; A strong mist, þat stonk voule, . out of þe water drow Of brimston & of oþer wo, . such stench he neuer sei&yogh;, Mid alle þe pine of þe world . he mi&yogh;te stonde þer nei&yogh;. Nach he fehlt ne. A brugge was ouer þe water, . smallere mi&yogh;te non beo; þe smoke was so þicke, . vnneþe he mi&yogh;te it seo. Lo, seide þe deuelen, . we siggeþ þe iwis þat vnder þis depe water . þe put of helle is; And þou schalt iwite, . vorþ þ u schalt anon Nach And fehlt þat. And ouer þis swete water . on þat brugge gon; We þe schulleþ sende awind, . amidde þe to caste, And oure felawes bi neþe . schulen þe holden vaste And drawe þe wiþ hem . to helle grounde anon; Cum forþ, & þou schalt . vpe þe brugge gon. Heo nomen þe kni&yogh;t anon . & to þe brugge drowe, And bede him go þer on . wiþ wrecchede inowe. þreo þinges luþere inow . on þis brugge were: þ t on was þ t it was so hei&yogh;, . þ t vnneþe me mi&yogh;te for fere þer vpe go for hei&yogh; . to habbe þat grisli si&yogh;te; for hei&yogh;, mit unorgan . h, = for eie vor Furcht . þ t oþer þat (it) was so narw, . þ t vnneþe me mi&yogh;te Nach oþer fehlt was, nach þat : it. þer vpe setten afot, . þat he ne felle anon; þe þridde þ t heo was so slider, . þ t me ne mi&yogh;te þer on gon, Bote he slide and felle, . so wis neuer he nere. þese þinges brou&yogh;ten . þe kni&yogh;t in grete fere: Narw it was, slider, and hei&yogh;; . how so me euer telle, &yogh;if he slide bi ani side, . he fulle into helle. þer vpon he was brou&yogh;t . & mad þer on to gon. Such drede, as him þou&yogh;te, . nadde neuer mon non. Ac he þou&yogh;te on ihū crist, . þ t ofte him sauede er, He criede on is holi name, . þ t he him holpe þer. He &yogh;eode forþ baldeliche, . & þe innore þ t ecom, þe hardiore he was, . & þe betere herte he nom, And þe braddore was is (wei). . so longe vorþ he &yogh;eode: Nach is fehlt wei. Die Verse 485—567 fehlen im Ms. Bodl. 779 . Hit wax so brod, þ t þer mi&yogh;te . gon acart for nede, And so longe þ t twei cartes mi&yogh;ten . meten wel inow. þis kni&yogh;t wel baldeliche . vorþ as maister him drow. Deuelen stoden bi neþe . and sei&yogh;e him vaste gon. Of al þe wo þ t heo him duden . him ouer com not on. Hoe þou&yogh;ten, it was for nou&yogh;t . after to honti more; Grisliche heo gonnen &yogh;elle, . heo crieden & wepten sore. Of þe &yogh;ellinge þat heo made . he hedde grettore fere, þan of al þe oþer pines, . so grisliche was þe bere. Neules & hokes heo nome . & to him casten an hei&yogh;, Ac non mi&yogh;te him touche, . ne non come him nei&yogh;. So þat al saf wiþ ioie . ouer þe water he drow. Deuelen were bi hinde . wiþ serwe & sori inow;
1.12: Heo letten him go forþ, . & fondeden him na more, And hulden hem ouer come, . & þat hem of þou&yogh;te sore. þe kni&yogh;t wende al saf, . þat he er deore abou&yogh;te, And þonkede &yogh;erne ihū . þat heo him ne siwede nou&yogh;te. þe water he passede wel, . & vorþ is wei nom; þe contrei him þou&yogh;te murie . þ t he ouer com; þe vorþere þat he wente, . þe more ioie he sei&yogh;. So longe þat he sei&yogh; awal, . swiþe noble and hei&yogh;; Such werk nas neuer sei&yogh;e, . him þou&yogh;te, as þat was; A noble &yogh;at he sei&yogh; þer on, . noblere neuer non nas; þe &yogh;at schinede bri&yogh;te, . gold as it were, ffol of preciouse stones, . þat none richere nere. Him þou&yogh;te, ar he þider com, . his wei longe laste. þo he com alutel ner, . he stod & bihuld vaste. þe &yogh;at opnede a&yogh;en him, . & mid þat selue dede þer sprong out aswete smel, . þ t wide gan to sprede, þat him þou&yogh;te, in al þe world . such spices nere þ t suc swetnesse mi&yogh;ten &yogh;eue, . as þat breþ þere. In such ioie him þou&yogh;te he was, . þ t , þei&yogh; ehedde be brou&yogh;t In al þe wo þat he sei&yogh; euer, . hit ne scholde him greue nou&yogh;t. In he bihuld ate &yogh;ate, . þo he com þer nei&yogh;: More clernesse ne mi&yogh;te beo, : him þou&yogh;te, þan e sei&yogh;. As he wolde in wende, . a&yogh;en him þer com gon A prosession fair inow, . of noble men echon, Wiþ crois and wiþ tapres, . wiþ baners swiþe clere, þat volk bihinde reuested, . euer vch bi is fere: Bischops & erchedeknes, . monkes & eke frere, And ech in þat abit . þ t he werede on erþe here. Mid þe meste ioie þat mi&yogh;te be . þis kni&yogh;t heo gonnen afonge, And him yn mid ioie nome . of solas & of songe. þo þe song was ido, . to him sone þer come Twei&yogh;e, as heo maistres were, . & bi þe hond him nome, Heo welcomeden him faire, . & þonkeden oure lord faste, þat &yogh;af him such bileue, . þ t so studefastliche laste. Heo ladden him to schewe . þe lond fer & ney: So muche clernesse and ioie . him þou&yogh;te he neuer sei&yogh;; As þe sonne binimeþ þe li&yogh;t . of þe candel at midday, Also bi nom þe sonne lem . þe li&yogh;t þ t he þer say. So muche þat place was, . þat he ne mi&yogh;te non ende se: A meri mede wiþ floures, swettore mi&yogh;te non be, fehlt . nach der Halbz. Tren al so wiþ fruit, . þat smellede swete inow. So gret swetnesse aboute . of ech place þer drow, þat þer wiþ oute ech mete, . him þou&yogh;te, euer mo He mi&yogh;te euer libbe wiþ ioie, . &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te þer among go. Hit was euer iliche li&yogh;t, . & euere þer was day. So muche folk in o place . neuer he ne say; Ech companie þer . murie to oþer drow Wiþ song & wiþ melodie . & oþer ioie inow, þat ech of oþer mi&yogh;te . þe more ioie afonge. Al mi&yogh;ti god heo herieden . ofte in here songe. And, as somm sterre bri&yogh;tere . þan anoþer is, Al so of hem somme schinede . bri&yogh;tere þan an oþer iwis; Ak he þat derkest was, . him þou&yogh;te, was more cler And bri&yogh;tere þan ani gold . þat he sei euer er. fehlen 4 Verse, s. Ms. Laud.
1.13: Somme hadden crounen of gold . on þe hed ido, Somme in honde beren . &yogh;erden of golde also. Alle þonkeden ihū crist, . þat studefast herte him sende, þat þe kni&yogh;t mid no pine . is herte ne wende. Echone þo for him . in þe more ioie were. He bi huld þat ioie, . as þei no wit in him nere. þo bi gan agret maistere . vndo is mouþ softe, Ms. meiste mit der Abkürzung für er. & welcomede him faire, . & þonkede oure lord ofte, þat such þou&yogh;t him hedde send, . & such herte al so, þat he ne changede no&yogh;t . vor al þat him was do. Beu frere, ihered be god, . þ t þe haþ hider ibrou&yogh;t, And among alle þine fon . so stude fast were of þou&yogh;t. Nach And fehlt wol þat þou. Of þe pine of sunfol men . fonded þ u hast inow; þine sunnes beþ alle ibet, . vor elles it were wow; þow mi&yogh;t here somdel seo, . þat þou wilnest more, Of þe ioie of gode soulen, . þ t comeþ to milce & ore. þis place, þ t we inne beþ, . þ u ne knowest nou&yogh;t: Hit is erþliche paradis, . þ t adam was inne brou&yogh;t; Her inne he was ipult, . ac suþþe for his mis dede I cast he was out vram henne . in alle wrechede; Al þe ioie, þat her is, . he hedde to is wille, Ac, þo he was henne idriue, . hit nas not worþ afille. Of þe wrechede we beþ kend, . & of is sunfol blet come, Ac þat vs is bi godes grace . þorw godes grace(!) binome. þorw godes grace st. þorw oure cristendom verschrieben . And after oure cristendom . þe sunnes þat (we) wrou&yogh;te, Vor wrou&yogh;te fehlt we. On erþe oþer in purgatorie . we it wel deore abou&yogh;te: Vor we alle, as þou sist, . þer forþ hider come, And oure sunnes þer bette, . & harde penaunce nome, We neren not elles her; . as god biþe it is;
1.14: And alle þ t þ u þer isei&yogh;e . hider schulleþ iwis, Ac non not how longe . his bileuing is; Ac, whose in erþe frendes haþ, . þe bet efareþ iwis, Vor mid massen, & gode bedes, . & mid almesdede Me mai here pine alegge . & þer of hem lede. Whan ani hider comeþ, . a&yogh;en him we wendeþ echon, As we come a&yogh;en þe, . & ledeþ him anon. Nach him fehlt in. Ac non of vs nis wurþe . &yogh;ut to heuene wende, Vor wende fehlt to; so auch Ms. Bodl. ; vgl. v. 658. Ne non not whanne oure lord . after him wole sende: Ech þat to heuene schal . þorw purgatorie mot, And suþþe to erþliche paradis, . þer we beþ, ichot; Vor þis (is) oure eritage, . we weren wrou&yogh;t þer to, Nach þis fehlt is. Vorte oure furste fader agulte; . &, &yogh;if he nedde mis do, Vor agulte fehlt it. Here we scholden habbe be bore, . & liued oure lif also, Vorte oure lord vs wolde . in more ioie habbe ido. Ac, whanne men beþ out cast, . her forþ heo moten wende A&yogh;enward toward heuene, . after here liues ende. Ac al þe ioie, þ t her is, . amounteþ not iwis A&yogh;en þe leste ioie in heuene; . wel muche þe meste is. Of heuene þ u schalt somwhat seo . in aplace her nei&yogh;. He ladde him on an hei&yogh; hul, . & bad him loke an hei&yogh;, And aschte of what colour . heuene were þere. He seide: it þou&yogh;te as gold, . þat wellinge were. þei seiden: þat it was . þe &yogh;at of heuene, fehlen in Ms. Laud und Bodl. ; sie sind Zusatz. þer þe soulen, þat gode weren, . scholden in fol euene; fehlen in Ms. Laud und Bodl. ; sie sind Zusatz. þat is þe &yogh;at of paradis, . þat wiþ oute heuene is. þe oþer seide: þis is þe wei . þat geþ to heuene blis. Ech dai somme of purgatorie . comeþ hider vs to, And somme of vs ech day . to heuene went al so, So þ t we waxeþ ech day . & wanieþ þer to; We nuten of vs whoch is next, . bote as god wol haue do. Ech day, while we beþ her, . oure lord vs fet ene Wiþ delicious mete of heuene, . þ t swete is & clene; What þilk mete is, . ar þow henne wende, Wiþ vs þ u schalt wite, . whan god it wole sende. Nadde he bote þ t word seid, . þ t þer ne com a li&yogh;t A maner breþ of heuene, . þat schinede swiþe bri&yogh;t, þat ouer spradde al þat lond, . & a cler leme þer wiþ oute; Vpe ech hed it li&yogh;te . clerore &yogh;et þan aboute, And vpe þe kni&yogh;t eke . þe leme smot anon, þorw ech lime, him þou&yogh;te, . & þorw ech liþ gan gon, þ t in so muche delit and ioie, . him þou&yogh;te, neuer e nas. He stod, as he were inome, . he nuste whare ewas, Ne, &yogh;if he were quic oþer ded, . bote in meting as he were. Lord, muche is þi mi&yogh;te, . as þo was sene þere! Hit ne laste bote astounde, . þ t þe leome ne wiþ drow; 541-625 fehlen in Ms. Ashm. Ac, þei&yogh; it lute while laste, . heo weren ful inow. þe kni&yogh;t stod & bihuld, . & is stat vnderstod; So fol he was of þe leme, . þ t delicious was & god: Him þou&yogh;te, þei&yogh; he liuede euer . & no mete ne ete, He schulde to no mete luste . vor þe lem so swete. Lo, seide þis maister . þat him schewede þat place, Now þou hast somdel isei&yogh;e . of oure lordes grace: Of pine what wrecche gostes . habbeþ for here misdede, Ms. of of pine. And of þe ioie þat gode soules . in paradis doþ lede, And somdel of þe ioie . þat in heuene is; Eche day we beþ ones fed . mid such ioie & blis, þanne we beþ folle inow, . vorte god vs more sende; And heo þat in heuene beþ . han such wiþ outen ende, & &yogh;ut in more, . vor it waneþ neuer mo; in vor more ist zu tilgen . We beþ bote enes ved adai, . vorte þ t we þider go; Whanne we þider comeþ, . we schulen wiþ outen ende, And &yogh;if wolt(!) deserui, . þider vorto wende; As þou wolt þou mi&yogh;t do, . whan þ u comest to erþe iwis; þider þou most anon a&yogh;e, . vor al time hit is; &yogh;if þou wolt god lif lede, . þi mede þou mi&yogh;t seo, And also, whoche pines, . &yogh;if þou wolt luþer beo. A&yogh;en þow most wende, . go vorþ in godes name! Go baldeliche, for no deuel . ne schal do þe no schame: Adrad hi beþ of þe, . & aschamed bi eche side; Vor und nach &yogh;if fehlt þou. A godes name go þi wey, . þ u ne schalt no leng abide! Sire, merci, quaþ þe kni&yogh;t, . what so me euer bitide, A fote inelle henne go, . wrechede geþ so wide; Lat me bi leuen her, . vor, &yogh;if i c from &yogh;ou wende, Adrad icham of þe deuelen . mid sunne wolleþ me schende. In der 2. Halbz. fehlt þat oder heo. Beu frere, quaþ þis oþer, . þou mi&yogh;t as wel be stille, Vor þ u schalt to erþe go, . þer þow mi&yogh;t do þi wille; &yogh;if þou seruest oure lord, . siker þou mi&yogh;t beo A&yogh;en to come to vs, . & suþþe to heuene vleo; In godes half wende a&yogh;en, . vor siker þou schalt so. Alas, alas, quaþ þe kni&yogh;t, . what schal i now do? þe ioie þ t ich now isei&yogh;e . worþ me now bi nome, To þe wrecchede of þe world, . alas, ischal come. Al wepinge out ate &yogh;ate . brou&yogh;t e was ate laste.
1.15: þo he was wiþ oute, . heo maden þe &yogh;ate faste. As he com þideward, . þe wei a&yogh;en he nom. Ac, whanne ani deuel . a&yogh;en him owhare com, As wode schrewen heo flowen . & dorsten abide nou&yogh;t. þe kni&yogh;t was ate laste . to þe halle a&yogh;en brou&yogh;t, þer þe holi companie . to him þere wende. A doun e sat softe, . vorte god him grace sende. As he sat and bihuld, . sone þer comen yn þere Al þe noble companie, . comen as heo duden ere(!). comen überflüssig . Heo honoureden him faire, . & hereden god faste, Ihū crist, godes sone, . þ t his bi leue so wel laste. Beu frere, he seide, now þou hast . such penaunce idriue, Siker be þe þ t þi sunnes . beþ clanliche for &yogh;iue; Loke, whanne þ u comest hom, . clene lif þou lede, þat þ u neuer in pine come . vor no misdede; þou most þe hi&yogh;en, vor atom in þi londe fehlt . nach der Halbz . Hit daweþ cler, & is day, . as ich vnderstonde; Vor day fehlt nei. þe prior wiþ procession . to þe &yogh;ate comeþ sone, To loke &yogh;if þou beo come, . as ri&yogh;t is to done; &yogh;if he ne findeþ þe nou&yogh;t, . he makeþ þe &yogh;at sone anon And lokeþ after þe namore, . ac dreri hamward gon(!). Trotz der Veränderung der ganzen Stelle ist gon stehen geblieben . þis kni&yogh;t heo brou&yogh;ten forþ, . & blesseden him echon, And bitau&yogh;ten him god, . soule, bodi, and bon. Vorþ he wende his wey, . he moste nede do. Ri&yogh;t as he com to þe &yogh;ate, . þe priour com al so A&yogh;en him wiþ procession, . to loken hou it were. þo he hedde þe &yogh;at vnloke, . þe kni&yogh;t he fond þere. þer was ioie and blisse, . þo heo to gedere come. Wiþ song & wiþ orisons . þe kni&yogh;t out heo nome, And ladden him to chirche, . & hereden god faste. þe kni&yogh;t bi fore þe weued . anon on kneo him caste, And stabliche in orisons . viftene dawes he lay, And heriede oure swete lord . vaste ni&yogh;t and day. And suþþe on is bare vlesch . þe holi crois enom, He &yogh;eode into þe holi londe, . & holi mon bicom; And tolde not of þe world, . ac euere he was in þou&yogh;te; He &yogh;ede euer simple liche, . as him nou&yogh;t ne rou&yogh;te. Ac ofte he tolde of þe men . þ t in paradis were; As him þou&yogh;te, grei&yogh;e monkes . in mest ioie he sei&yogh; þere, None in so grete ioie, . ne in so gret honour esei&yogh;: No wonder nis sikerliche, . vor þe ordre is so hei&yogh;. Vor nis fehlt it. Now &yogh;e habbeþ iherd, . hou oure lord sende is grace Seint patrik, to finden . þe purgatorie in þat place, Vor to warnie men aboute . here sunnes to bete, An to leue on ihū crist, . & on is moder swete. Bete we our sunnes her, . as god wole grace sende, þ t we wiþ oute oþer pine . to paradis henne wende. God vs lete oure sunnes bete, . vor is holi wounde, So þat we in purgatorie . bileue lutel stounde. Amen.

2.0: c. aus Ms. Laud 108. Purgatorium sci Patrici abbatis. So der Titel in rother Schrift rechts am Rande; links steht in schwarzer kleiner Schrift De purgatorio sci patrici. Die ersten 2 Verse sind Zusatz.
2.1: Ms. Laud beginnt sofort mit dem Fegfeuer; die in den andern Mss. vorhergehenden 54 Verse fehlen.
2.2: SEint paterik þoru godes grace : makede ane put in Irlonde, þat seint patrike purgatorie is icleoped : &yogh;eot, ase ich onder stonde, Ore louerd him bi tok ane staf : mid is owene honde, þat he fond þulke purgatorie with, : i hered beo godes sonde! In Irlonde is &yogh;eot þilke staf i wust : dereworþeliche i nov&yogh;, For gret relike he is i holde, : and elles it were wou&yogh;. Seint paterik in þulke stude, : þat his purgatorie is, Of religion bi gan an hous, : þat &yogh;eot stant i wis; Ant Chanoynes þare inne he makede, : ase &yogh;eot þare beoth al so. nt in ant ist klein übergeschr. þane put he let faste closi a boute, : þat noman ne come þar to. In þe churche &yogh;erd is þat ilke putt, : ri&yogh;t toward þe Est side, Ri&yogh;t est fram þe hei&yogh;e Au&yogh;ter, : þat manie men &yogh;wylene sou&yogh;ten wide. He is bi walled faste a boute, : and faste i loke þe &yogh;ate; Ms. abooute. And þe prior haueth þe kei&yogh;e in warde, : þat no man ne mot In þar ate. Al bi seint paterikes dai&yogh;e : men wenden þudere i lome, And sethþe also mani on, : and fewe a&yogh;en þare come. Ake þulke þat þare comen a&yogh;en, : of þat heo i sei&yogh;en, heo tolde, Ase it is in þe house i write : and in priue conseile i holde. þe manere is of euerech man : þat for soþe þudere i went, þat it beo to bete is sunnes, : &yogh;if ore louerd him grace (sent). sent am Ende fehlt im Ms. To þe bischope of þe lond : furst he schal him schriue, And bidde him leue þene wey to go, : in amendement of is liue. Ake þe bischop schal rede heom þare a&yogh;ein : and manie resones schewe, heom st. him. And segge þat manie þudere wendeth, : and a&yogh;ein þare comieth fewe. Ake, &yogh;if he is stable in is þou&yogh;t, : for al þat men him habbez i bede, þe bischop him wole is lettre make : to þe prior of þe stude. þe prior him wole al so rede i nov&yogh; : for to chaungi is þou&yogh;t; And, &yogh;wane he si&yogh;kz him studefast, : þat he nele bi leue it nou&yogh;t, In to churche he wole him lede : and sette him a doun a kne; ff. Diese Reihenfolge der Verse ist un|zweifelhaft die richtige. Fiftene dawes he schal þare : in is oresones beo. And &yogh;if heo ne mouwen for no þing : maken chaungi is þou&yogh;t, With gret procession of preostes : to þe putte he worth i brou&yogh;t; Ms. precession. With þe croiz and with þe haliwatur : heo schullen blessi him ech on, Zusatz, fehlen in den and. Mss. Him sulf he schal him blessi al so, : and þanne into þe putte gon; Zusatz, fehlen in den and. Mss. into aus inte corr. And þat procession schal tuyrne a&yogh;en, : ase ri&yogh;t is for to done. A moruwe In þulke tyme : heo schullen come þudere eft sone, And, bote heo finden him þanne a&yogh;en i come, : with gret deol and sor Heo schullen tuyrne a &yogh;ein, and sikere beoth : þat he ne comez a&yogh;en non more.
2.3: Hit bi fel bi þe kingus dai&yogh;e steuene, : þat novþe late was, Of a kni&yogh;t, þat hei&yogh;te sire Ovwayn, : a swiþe wonder cas. To þe bischop þis kni&yogh;t eode, : and to schrifte to him he cam, In grete repentaunce of is sunnes : deol and sorewe to him he nam. þe bischop bi gan to chide faste : for þat he hadde mis do, And seide þat he was manne worst, : for to sunegun so, And seide þat he ne mi&yogh;te so muche schame a fonge, : þat he nere wuyrþe more. þe kni&yogh;t sat with careful heorte, : he si&yogh;te and weop ful sore. Sire, seide þe kni&yogh;t, &yogh;wan ich habbe : manne worst ido, To þe sunne þat grettest is, : mest penaunce mot þar to, And &yogh;if ich a mong alle men : mest sunful am, alas, þe gretteste penaunce ichulle take : þat euere bi founde was: Ichulle me take to godes grace : and in is name i wende Into seint paterikes purgatorie, : and take þat god me wole sende. Ov, beu frere, quath þe bischop, : be stille! &yogh;wi seistþov so? v in seistþov klein übergeschr. Crist for beode þat þov euere : swuch folie do! Ms. eure mit übergeschr. e. Onneþe comez þare ani a &yogh;en : þat doth þare In i wende; Nolde god þat þov þe dede dudest, : bodi and soule to schende! Ake wend into religion, and bi lef þare : to þine liues ende: þine sunnes þou mi&yogh;t bete wel, : &yogh;if god þe wole grace sende. Certes, sire, quath þis kni&yogh;t, : ase wel þov mi&yogh;t beo stille, For þulke penaunce ichulle do, : &yogh;if it is godes wille; For ase muche ase ich habbe of serued, : Ine mai nou&yogh;t habe of wo; Ms. habe st. habbe. þere fore sei&yogh;e &yogh;wat i schal, : for þudere ichulle go. þe bischop prechede him faste i nov&yogh;, : for to chaungi is þou&yogh;t; Ake at þe laste, þo he isai&yogh; : þat it was al for nou&yogh;t, To þe prior of þe stude : his lettres made sone, Vor made fehlt he. þat he scholde bi him do, : ase bi swuch a man was to done. þe prior prechede him faste i nov&yogh; : and schewede him resones i nowe, &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te changi is þou&yogh;t, : þat he him with drowe. Bote is prechinge was al for nou&yogh;t, : ase he sai&yogh; atþenende, þat he nolde lete for no þing : þene perilouse wei to wende. þe prior nam him bi þe hond : and in to churche him brou&yogh;te. þare he ful akne adoun : and ore louerdes grace bi sou&yogh;te; : doppelt, hinter akne und adoun. In fastingues and in oresones : fourtene ni&yogh;t he lai, Forte bidde ore louerdes grace; : and in þe fourteþe dai þat Couent cam a boute him, : and oþere preostes al so And clerkes, with procession, : þe seruise for him to do. For him heo songun þe hei&yogh;e masse : and to ore louerd criden faste, And ore louerdes flechs and is blod : heo &yogh;euen him atþe laste, And spreinden him with holi watur, : and heore oresones heo seide. With Croiz and with procession : to þe put heo gonne him lede, And hei&yogh;liche songun þe letanie, : and holi water with hem bere, And alle louerdes halewe beden : þat heo heore help were. heore st. his. þe prior on lek þe puttes dore : bi fore heom ech on, And seide : beu frere, lo here þe wei : þat þou wilnest for to gon; Ake &yogh;if þou wolt bi ore rede do, : þi þou&yogh;t þou schalt wende And in oþur manere þine sunnes bete, : ase god þe grace wole sende; Fewe here comen euere a &yogh;en : þat wenden here In bi fore, Ake heo beoth for tormentingue and for wo : lif and soule for lore. Certes, sire, quath þis kni&yogh;t, : rede &yogh;wat þov me rede, In ore louerdes name þane wei ich take : to bete mine mis dede; Ake, for is loue þat us deore bou&yogh;te, : biddez for me ech on! Lif and soule god ich bi take, : and In his name ichulle In gon. He blessede him, and wende forth In, : and bi tok god is flesch and is bon. þe prior spreinde him with holi water, : and lek þe dore a non. þis goude kni&yogh;t wende him forth, : wel baldeliche and faste, In one holewe weie onder eorþe, : and to god is heorte caste; Swyþe deork it was, þat he ne say ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t, : ne no þing him ne a gaste. So longe þat him þou&yogh;te he i sai&yogh; : wel feor li&yogh;t atþe laste. þuderward he wende baldeliche, : so þat he cam þere nei&yogh;. þe faireste feld þat mi&yogh;te beo : atþe wei&yogh;es ende he isei&yogh;. Am Rande : pulcher via. þare Inne he wende murie inov&yogh;, : and a midde þe felde he fond þe faireste halle and þe nobleste : þat mi&yogh;te beo in ani lond. Ake þet weder nas nou&yogh;t cler, : bote ase it were nei&yogh; eue. Forto bi holde þat noble weork, : ane stounde he gan bi leue; þe walles neren nou&yogh;t ihole, : ake al a boute i wis With pilers and with qvoynte Arches, : ase þis Monekene cloistre is. v in qvoynte übergeschr . In he wende a godes name, : and sette him al one an hei&yogh;; He bi heold a boute in to eche huyrne : and þat quoyte weork he sei&yogh;. quoyte st. quoynte. Ase he bi heold al so a boute, : þare come In at þe on ende Twelf men in &yogh;wite cloþes, : swiþe faire and hende, Alle heore crounes weren newe schaue; : and suyþe faire heo him gretten, And alle heo seten faire a doun, : and þane (kni&yogh;t) bi heom heo setten. Nach þane fehlt kni&yogh;t. þo seide on of heom, ase þei it þe prior were, : wel mildeliche and stille: Bev frere, ihered beo Ihū crist, : þat on þe brou&yogh;te swuche wille, And late þe þat þou&yogh; agodes name hast bi gonne : for is holi grace wel ende! Leue broþur, &yogh;wane þou woldest þis wei : for þine sunnes wende: Oþur þov most beon studefast and hardi : and in none manere tuyrne þi þou&yogh;t, Oþur þov worst for lore lif and soule : and sone to þe deuel i brou&yogh;t; For, also sone ase we beth heonne i went, : þe feondes luþere and wicke Heo wollez come a boute þe : In to þis hous ful þicke, And don þe tormens and wo i nov&yogh;, : and bi hote þe wel more, And heo wollez also bi hote þe Joye inov&yogh;, : &yogh;if þov wolt leue heore lore; And &yogh;if heo mouwen þoru&yogh; ani bi heste,: oþur enie gile, þe ouer come, For soþe þov worst lif and soule : a deuele wei al clene i nome; Ake &yogh;if þov art studefast of heorte : and on Ihū crist wolt þenche, Ne for bi heste ne for wo : fram him þou nelle blenche, Ms. bi heste heste. þou worst quit of alle þine sunnes, : þat þov hast euere i wrou&yogh;t, And þov schalt iseo alle þe Joies : þat guode men beoth inne i brou&yogh;t, And al so þe pine þat luþere men : habbez for heore mis dede; Ake, in &yogh;wat wo þat þov euere art, : euere þench on god, ich rede, And euere, &yogh;wane heo tormentiez þe, : cri Jesu milce and ore, And, &yogh;if þou art studefast in gode bi leue, : heo ne schullen defouli þe non more; We bi takez þe god of heuene, : and ich rede þov do bi ovre lore. þo nuste þe kni&yogh;t &yogh;ware heo bi comen, : he sat and si&yogh;te sore, Elinge he bi lefte alone : and cride on godes mi&yogh;te, And Armede him with holie beden, : a&yogh;en þe deuelene to fi&yogh;te; On þe holi gost he cride faste, : þat he ne scholde him faile. He lokede euere, &yogh;wane heo comen, : him for to a saille. Ase he sat a godes name, : þe bataille forto a bide, þare cam a sori reuful cri : a boute in eche side, Ase alþe world to borste and to breke; : him þou&yogh;te, it was also, þat, þei alle þe bestes of þe worlde : to gadere weren ido, Ase loude and ase grisliche ase heo mi&yogh;ten, : &yogh;eollinde ech one heo were: Ake heo ne mi&yogh;ten a mong heom alle : make so grisliche bere, Im Anfang fehlt and. þat is hope and is heorte on ihū crist : euere more heo were,(!) Vor þat fehlt wol bote ( oder welle?); die Construktion ist verderbt. Elles he hadde wod bi come : and i lore is wit for fere. þo comen heo a bouten him : þicke and grisliche þere, A. R.: dyaboli. &yogh;eonijnde and grenninde on him : with ful lodlich chere. Bel ami, quath þe on of heom, : þou hast a ri&yogh;t ido; We owez wel alle anouri þe, : for alto fewe doth so, For alle oþere men wollez a bide : þat heore lif heom beo bi nome, And &yogh;eot it is a&yogh;en heore wille : þat heo schullen hidere come, And þov art i come al bi þine liue, : and bi þine guode wille also; Wel ou&yogh;te we þine mede &yogh;elde : and gre(t) þonk also þe do; Ms. gre st. gret. &yogh;wane þov hast boþe bodi and soule : i&yogh;yuen us bi þine liue, Saunt faille we ne beoth nou&yogh;t so onkuynde : þat we it nellez &yogh;elde þe bliue, For þe kundenesse þat þov to us come : al bi þine owene lore; sind in den and. Mss. umgesetzt . Ake naþeles, &yogh;if þou wolt on eorþe : habbe Joye more, sind in den and. Mss. umgesetzt . Sikere us an hond þat þov wolt : In ore seruise bi leue, And we þe wollez a&yogh;en to eorþe bringe, : al sauf, are hit beo eue, And þov schalt habbe þare Joye inou&yogh;, : in halle and eke in boure, For none men ne fareth so murie þare : ase þulke þat beoth ovre; Hei&yogh; man and noble þov schalt beo, : and alle men schullen honouri þe; &yogh;wane þov art ded ant comest to us, : þou schalt habbe ase guod ase we. þis kni&yogh;t þou&yogh;te euere on Jesu crist, : and nolde chaungi is wille, For þretninge ne for fair bi heste, : ake sat him euere stille. þo he nolde graunti nou&yogh;t : to heom for to wende, Heo &yogh;ollen and grenneden on him foule, : and strong fuyr bi gonne forto tiende. þis kni&yogh;t heo bounden honden and fet, : and a midde þe fuyre him caste; A. R.: prima pena. Im Ms. undeutlich ob fot oder fet. With Irene Ovles and pikes : heo to drowen him wel faste. þis kni&yogh;t hadde gret pine; : wel loude he cride a non: Jhesus, Jhesus, help me nouþe, : and do a wei mine fon! Anon so hadde þis word iseid, : þat fuyr a queinte ech spronke, Vor hadde fehlt he. And þe deuelene ne mi&yogh;ten him non more to drawe. : ore louerd he gan þonke, And þe hardiore he was i nou&yogh;, : þo he þis i sei&yogh;, And þe lasse he was of heom a drad : þat weren him so nei&yogh;. Wel grisliche heo &yogh;ollen, þe schrewes, : þo heom faillede heore mi&yogh;t, Ms. urspr. mi&yogh;te, e ist ausradirt . And flouwen echone out of þe halle, : and drowen with heom þis kni&yogh;t. A&yogh;en þe grounde heo drowen him harde : boþe bi fet and honde, Longe, him þou&yogh;te, and swiþe feor, : al a boute in a waste londe. So blac and deork was al þat lond, : þat no þing he ne sei&yogh; Bote þe feondes þat him to drowen, : þat so þicke weren him nei&yogh;. Ake swiþe softe wind þare was, : þat he heorde onneþe, Vor swiþe fehlt a. Ake so scharpe he bleu&yogh; and colde, : þat brou&yogh;te him nei&yogh; to deþe; Vor brou&yogh;te fehlt he. Ri&yogh;t colde he wende þoru&yogh; is heorte, : and þoru&yogh; al is bodi also, þat him were leouere þane al þe world, : þat þe pine were ido. þus colde heo drowen him, ase heom þou&yogh;te, : forth ri&yogh;t est i wis, heom st. him. Ase þe sonne a rist in somer, : &yogh;wane þe dai lengest is. þo heo comen, ase heom þou&yogh;te, : ri&yogh;t to þe worldes ende, heom st. him. Bi a brod valeie heo torneden heom, : and southward gonne i wende, To ward þe stude þat þe sonne : In winter doth a rise; þis seli kni&yogh;t was i drawe : and i pined in fale wise. þo þou&yogh;te him þat he i heorde feor, : bi fore him ase it were, Swiþe deolful cri and wop, : and swyþe revful bere; Euere þe neor þat heo comen, : þe revlokur was þat cri; So longe drowen him, þat him þou&yogh;te : þat heo weren ri&yogh;t þer bi. Vor drowen fehlt heo. þo comen heo into a wid feld; : non more ne mi&yogh;te beo, A. R.: Se(cun)da pena. Ms. wid st. wild. So long and brod in eche side, : þat he ne mi&yogh;te non ende iseo. Of men and of wummen þis feld was : ful in eche side, n in and überschr . þe wombene to ward þe grounde : i spradde a brod ful wide, Hondene and fet al a brod : to þe eorþe faste i bounde With Irene nailles, al fuyrie, : i smite þoru&yogh; heom to grounde. þis wrechche gostes weren so i pinede : with Irene and with fuyre, weren Zusatz . So deolful cri heo maden þare, : þat gret deol it was to huyre; Heo criden merci deolfulliche, : Ake no merci men nolde heom do; For Anguische þe eorþe heo freten, : and hore tongene gnowen al so. þe deoulene ornen opon hem, : and treden heom to þe grounde, And with Ovles swiþe kene : maden heom mani a wounde. Allas, &yogh;wy nellez men beon i war, : and heore sunnes here bete, Are heo comen to purgatorie : and with þe luþere gostes mete? For ase wel beth þe schrewes in purgatorie, : and ouer al, ase in helle, And schullen, for to þe dai&yogh;e of dome come, : telle &yogh;wat men telle. þe feondes seiden : ri&yogh;t ase men beoth i pinede, : þov schalt beo also, Bote þov wolle þi þou&yogh;t wende : and after ovre rede do. And þo he nolde in none manere, : to grounde harde heo him caste, A. R.: tertia pena. And tormenteden him, ase þe oþere weren, : and to þe eorþe naileden him faste. Ake he criede a non to ihū crist, : þo him smert so sore: þare nas non of þe schrewes þo : þat mi&yogh;ten serui him so more. þo þe schrewes i sei&yogh;en þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten : heore wille habben þo, Heo drowen him into an oþur felde, : wel ful of more wo: Of Men and wummen it was ful, : opri&yogh;t i sprad to grounde, Fet and hondene a to i drawe : and to þe eorþe faste i bounde, With glowinde biendes al of Ire : i nailede heo weren þer to; Al fuyrie naddrene ope heom seten, : and foule crapoudes al so: Some of þe naddrene bi clupten heom : so faste al a boute, þat heom þou&yogh;te heo scholden to berste, : so streite heo gurden heom with oute; Some seten ope heom, : and heore flesch alto gnowe, And with kene tieth al fuyrie : wombe and breoste to drowe; Some with hore scharpe tounges : þoru&yogh; þe heorte sore heom smite; Some heo gnowen, and some heo stounge, : and some with scharpe tieth heom bite. Ms. stoungee, aus stounde corr. þe Crapoudes al so, þat weren so foule, : op on heore breostene sete, And stoungen heom þoru&yogh; heore heortene : with heore foule wrottes grete. þe luþere gostes ornen al so : a boute heom i nowe With hokes and with ou&yogh;les, : a with gret eir heom to drowe. a st. and, so auch v. 286. þe wrechche gostes, so for pinede, : in swuch torment weren i brou&yogh;t, Heo criden alle deolfulliche, : ake hit ne halp heom nou&yogh;t. þe feondes nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t, : and wolden him pini al so, Ake anon, so he cride on Ihū crist, : ne mi&yogh;ten heo bringe him þer to. &yogh;eot þe feondes eft sone him nomen : and to þe þridde feld him brou&yogh;te. In stronge pine he sai&yogh; þare wrechche gostes, : þat of heom self luyte rou&yogh;te, þat weren ispradde on þe eorþe abrod, : and i smiten þoru&yogh; out ech one With nailes þicke al abrod, : ase þare mi&yogh;ten stikie one, Vor þicke fehlt as. one st. on. þat man ne mi&yogh;te finde ane amtie place : on al heore bodie so luyte, þat man mi&yogh;te for þe þicke nailles : a fingres ende to heom puyte. A smart wind also to oþur wo : on heom bleu&yogh; wel faste, A. R.: quarta pena. þat heom þou&yogh;te heo weren i barnd : þoru&yogh; out with eche blaste. þe feondes ornen faste a boute : fram ech to oþur i nowe, n in feondes überschr. And heore wrechche flesch with oþur wo : mid Ovles heom to drowe. þeos wrechche gostes, so fur pinede, : and in swuch torment ibrou&yogh;t, Ms. fur pinenede mit weg|punktirtem ne. Revliche heo criden ase heo mi&yogh;ten, : ake it ne halp heom ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t, For heo weren so clene ouer come, : þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten onneþe Ani voiz out bringe, bote ase aman : þat were ope þe pointe of deþe: In heore þrote heo criden dimmeliche, : for heore streucþe heom was bi nome With muche pine, and no wonder it nas : þei heo weren ouer come. þe feondes nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t : and to grounde him caste, And seiden, bote he wolde turne is þou&yogh;t, : heo wolden naili him þare wel faste. Ake he cride on ihū crist, : and nemde is holi name; þe schrewes ne hadden none mi&yogh;te þo : to don him more schame. &yogh;eot heo nomen and drowen him : into þe feorþe felde, Ful of brumston, al brenninde : with stronge lei&yogh;e and spelde. Ech manere pine, þat mi&yogh;te beo, : In þulke felde he sei&yogh;: Some with chaines of Ire, : al fuyrie, hengen on hei&yogh;, Some bi Armes, some bi fet, : and bi þe necke mani on; Heo weren an hangede in stronge fuyre : of pich and eke brumston; Some hengen bi stronge crokus, : I pulte þoru&yogh; eiþur Ey&yogh;e, þoru&yogh; þe þrote some also, : and þoru&yogh; eiþur ere wel hei&yogh;e, And some þoru&yogh; heore derne limes, : and some þoru&yogh; þe tete, þat leuere heom were þane al þe world, : heore lyf to habbe i lete; Some op on grediles of Ire : i rostede weren also: Some, ase gyes, þe spites of Ire : þoru&yogh; out heom i do, Some leyen opri&yogh;t a &yogh;ein þe grounde, : &yogh;eonijnde wel faste, þe feondes welden led and bras : and in heore mouþes caste. He ne mi&yogh;te bi þenche no manere pine, : þat he ne sai&yogh; mo þer. Him þou&yogh;te he sai&yogh; þare mani on : þat he knev on eorþe her. þe feondes him casten a midde þis pine : a mong þis oþere ech on, And he cride on Jesu crist, : and was deliured a non. &yogh;eot þis feondes þis selie kni&yogh;t : into an oþur place huy drowe. A. R.: Sexta pena. þare Inne he isai&yogh; a grislich &yogh;weol : with spokene longe i nowe, þat on ende hangede toward þe grounde, : þat oþur op on hei&yogh;, Ful it was of hokes and pikes : wel þicke, ase he i sei&yogh;; þis hokes and þis pikes weren : faste i riuen also With wrechche gostes al a boute, : þat þaron weren ido. Al brenninde was þis sorie &yogh;weol, : and stinkinde of brumston; þe wrechche gostes þat þar on hengen : brenninde weren ech on. þis feondes wenden forth a non : and heore hokes þaron caste In eiþur side, a turden a boute : þis sori &yogh;weol so faste, a st. and. turden st. turnden. þat of þe gostus þat þaron hengen : no þing heo ne sei&yogh;e, So faste heo torneden þat &yogh;weol a boute, : bote þe brenninde lei&yogh;e; Ake deolfulliche heo criden and &yogh;ollen, : euer ech in is ende. Alas, &yogh;wi nellez men beon i war, : are heo heonnes wende, &yogh;wane he mi&yogh;ten here with a luytel pine : bete heore misdede, And þare heo schullen so bitere a bugge, : alas, þe wrechhede? þis feondes nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t : and on þis &yogh;weol him caste, And with þis oþere wrechche gostes : torneden him a boute faste; Sone he cride on Ihū crist, : deliuered he was a non. þe feondes stoden and bi heolden : with dreori mod ech on. Eft heo nomen him bitterliche : and ferrore &yogh;uyt him ladde, A. R.: septima pena. And harleden him forth wel revfulliche, : and loude &yogh;ollen and gradde. Bi fore him he sai&yogh; an hous stonde, : long and brod i nov&yogh;; Stunch and hete, þat þarof cam, : him þou&yogh;te al mest a slou&yogh;. Vor a slou&yogh; fehlt him. He with stod, and nolde is þonkes : for stunche gon non ner. Ferrore þov schalt, þe fendes seiden, : þou ne schalt nou&yogh;t a bide her; A bath it is þat þov isijcst, : and þarinne þov schalt beo And baþi with oþere þat þare beoth; : ne schalt þov nou&yogh;t so fleo. þe gostes þat þare inne weren : wel deolfulliche cride And &yogh;ollen loude, ase he i heorde, : a boute in eche side. þis kni&yogh;t with þis foule wi&yogh;tes : Into þe grete house cam. Of tormens, þat he þare isai&yogh;, : gret gome with alle he nam. Ful of puttes and of diches : þat hous with inne it was; More seoruwe ne more stunch : neuere i sei&yogh;e nas: Heo weren folle of stronge tormens, : boillinde euer ech on, Of wallinde led, and i fulde heo weren : of piche and brumston. Wrechche gostus þare inne seten, : þe torment tilde wel hei&yogh;e: Some a boue þe heued, : and some ri&yogh;t to þe Ey&yogh;e, Some to þe nose, and some to þe mouth, : and some op to þe swere, And some to heore breostene, : and a bou&yogh;ten heore sunnes ful deore, And some to heore nauele, : and some neþerrore more, And some stoden op to heore knen, : and criden and weopen sore, And some stoden In with boþe fet, : and some with þat on; Deolfolliche heo weopen and criden : and &yogh;ollen euerechon. n in and überschr . Nov þov i sixt, queþen þe feondes, : &yogh;woder In þov schalt gon, Bote þov wolle an oþur speke : and to us tuyrne a non. Heo nomen and casten him In a putte; : on Jesus a non he cride, Op he cam a non a &yogh;en, : and no lengore he ne moste þare a bide. Heo nomen him in grete wrathþe : and harleden him ferrere more, And brou&yogh;ten him opon a swyþe gret hul, : ful of sorewe and sore. He stod and bi heold a boute, : þo he cam þare op an hei&yogh;; Him wondrede of þe manie gostes : þat he þare isei&yogh;. Alle þe pinene þat he hadde er i sei&yogh;e : þare a&yogh;en nou&yogh;t nere; I clui&yogh;te heo seten ope heore ton, : and quakeden revliche for fere. In þe south half of þe hul : a deop water þare was and lou&yogh;, þat foule stonk and caldore was : þane ani ys oþur snov&yogh;; A norþerne wind faste blev&yogh;, : þat him þou&yogh;te is flesch to rende. Euere þare seten gostes : and a&yogh;ein þe winde heom wende, Heo quakeden and chyuereden faste : in grete pine and stronge, Ase ho so seith a bidet þare heore time, : heore deth for to a fonge. Lo, seide on of þe feondes, : þov nost nou&yogh;t &yogh;wat is tis; istis st. is þis. Bote þov torne þi þou&yogh;t sone, : þou schalt i wite i wis. Ne hadde he bote þis word i seid, : þat þare ne cam a wind blowe And drof alle þis wrechche gostes : into þe deope watur ful lowe. þe Norþerne wynd drof heom a doun : al mid one blaste, And alle þe gostes and þene kni&yogh;t : a midde þe watere hem caste More pine ne mi&yogh;te non beo : of stronge chele ne of stunche, þane þis gostes þarinne hadden, : þare ne mi&yogh;te non at blenche. þo þe kni&yogh;t þe stronge pine : of þis water i felde, He gan to crie on Ihū crist, : þat faillede him ful selde: A non ri&yogh;t with oute lette : op of þis watere man him drov&yogh;. Ake þis wrechche gostes lefden þere : with sorewe and wo i nov&yogh;, For in þat water, þat was so cold : and so foule stonk also, þis gostes swymden op and doun : in muche sorewe and wo; þe feondes ornen opon þe watere, : so men doth on þe londe, And, &yogh;wane ani wolde coueri op : with fote oþur with honde, Heo pulten him a doun a &yogh;en, : þat þare ne a scapede non; þare was wo and sorewe i nou&yogh; : a mong heom euerechon. þis feondes wenden forth a non, : and þe seli kni&yogh;t eft nome And drowen him into a sori stude, : þare neuer er heo ne come. Heo comen and stoden ouer a put, : wyd it was and deop i nov&yogh;; A brenninde smoke, þat foule stonk, : op of þe putte drov&yogh;, þat onneþe þe kny&yogh;t mi&yogh;te stonde : for sori stunch þare nei&yogh;. Wrechche gostes in þis put : in þat sori smoke he sei&yogh; Fleo op and doun, al brenninde, : ase speldene doth of fuyre, And in to þe putte eft fullen a doun,:þo heo ne mi&yogh;ten no leng duyre. Him þou&yogh;te he was al ouer come : for þe stunche þat þarop of drov&yogh;, þare bi him þou&yogh;te þat in þe grounde : was soruwe and deol i nov&yogh;. &yogh;wy stanst þov so? þe fendes seiden, : þinchþ þe þarof wonder, Of þis swete smoke þat here bloweth, : and &yogh;wat put beo þare onder? In þis put is ovre woneingue, : for þe put of helle it is, A. R.: puteum Inferni. And, for þov us hast i serued wel, : here þov schalt wonie iwis, For alle þat us seruieth wel, : hidere heo schullen wende, And, &yogh;if þov comest here in with us, : þov worst here with outen ende; &yogh;if a. R. nebengeschr . þare fore i rede, torne þi þou&yogh;t : and do us here man rede, And we schullen þene wei ase we conne : al sauf a &yogh;en þe lede; Ms. conne st. come. þov schalt on eorþe al þi lijf habbe : richesse and Ioye al so, For we schullen on eorþe þe finde i nov&yogh;, : ase ri&yogh;t is þat we do. þo þe kni&yogh;t for sok heore bi heste, : ase he hadde er ilome, Heo smiten heom a doun into þe putte,:and þene kni&yogh;t with heom nome. þe deoppore þat heo comen, : þ(e) braddere þe put was; Ms. þ braddere. Ake al þe wo þat he isai&yogh; er : a &yogh;ein þat nou&yogh;t it nas. Of stunch, of brenninge, and of oþur wo : þe kni&yogh;t was so ouer come, þat is þov&yogh;t toward Jesu crist : nei&yogh; him was bi nome; So muche pine nas neuere i sei&yogh;e; : him þou&yogh;te, ase þei he felde, þei nach as fehlt in den and. Mss. þat he was nei&yogh; ope þe pointe : þene gost op to &yogh;elde. Ake ore louerd a mong al is wo : grace him &yogh;af atþe laste, þat he þou&yogh;te on Ihū crist : and to him cride atþe laste. atþe laste st. faste. A smoke þare cam smite up a non, : mid one wel stronge blaste Vor mid fehlt and. þene kni&yogh;t an hei&yogh; a boue þe putte, : and manie oþere gostes, caste; þe kni&yogh;t &yogh;wirlede op in þis blast, : ase speldene doth, wel wide, Atþe laste he li&yogh;te a doun : a boue þe putte bi side. þare he stod and bi heold a boute : ase man þat witles were, þat, for þe pine þat he hadde i haued, : he nuste hov he cam þere. þo he hadde longe istonde al one : and bi holde a boute, þare comen blaste op of þe putte : deuelene a gret rou&yogh;te, And bi him al a boute, : al newe as þei heo were; Nach him fehlt stode. Ase him þou&yogh;te, he ne sai&yogh; hem : neuer er bote þo þere. Heo bi heolden him wel grisliche : and grenneden on him al a boute, And seiden: &yogh;wi stanst þov here al one? : þov most come into ovre rovte! Heo seiden: tolden ore felawes þe : þat þis was þe put of helle? Hit nis nou&yogh;t so, ake we wollez sone : for ri&yogh;te soþe þe telle; Nostþov nou&yogh;t þat it is ore ri&yogh;te : to li&yogh;en euere mo, And þat we with lesingues bi traieth men, : bote it mowe oþur go? And so ore felawes louwen þe : þat þis was þe put of helle; Ake þov schalt come þudere with us, : and þe soþe we wollez þe telle. þis deouelene harleden þane kni&yogh;t forth, : þat wo was him to drawe, þat him were leouere þane ani þing : þat he hadde i beo of lif dawe. So þat heo comen to a swyþe gret watur, : deop and brod i nov&yogh;; A strong mist, þat foule stonk, : op of þis watere drov&yogh; Of brumston and of oþur wo, : so strong stunch neuere he ne sei&yogh;, þat mid al þe pine of þe world : onneþe he stod þere nei&yogh;. A brugge þare was ouer þat watur, : smallere ne mi&yogh;te non beo, þe smoke was so þicke alaboute, : þat onneþe he mi&yogh;te i seo. þo seiden þe sorie fendes: : we seggez þe i wis þat onder þis deope watere : þe put of helle so is; And þat þov schalt sone i wite, : for þov schalt sone a non Ouer þis watur, þat is so deop, : opon þis brugge gon, And we schullen þe sende swuch a wynd, : þat schal þe amidde caste, And ore felawes, þat beoth bi neothe, : schullen þe nime wel faste And drawe þe doun forth with hem : Into helle grounde a non; Cum novþe forth, and þou&yogh; schalt : op on þis brugge gon. Heo nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t : and op on þis brugge drowe, And maden him go þere is on þonkes : with wrechhedes i nowe. þreo þingus vuele i nowe : on þis brugge were: þat on was for heo was so hei&yogh;, : þat no gost ne mi&yogh;te for fere þare oppe gon, and so deope a doun : habbe so grisliche si&yogh;te; þat oþur was for heo was so narov&yogh;, : þat onneþe ani þing mi&yogh;te þare oppe sette ani fot, : þat he ne fulle a doun a non; þe þridde þat heo was so slider, : þat man ne mi&yogh;te þare oppe gon, Bote he slide and felle a doun, : so slei&yogh; man neuere nere. þeos þreo þinges þesne selie kni&yogh;t : brou&yogh;ten in grete fere, For heo was narov&yogh;, and slider, and hei&yogh;, : þat he ne scholde him so bi telle, &yogh;if þat he glufte in ani half, : þat he ne fulle in to helle. Ms. glufte, aus gulte corr., u. a. R. nebengeschr. þare oppe he was with strencþe i brou&yogh;t : and þare oppe i maket to gon. So gret drede, ase him þou&yogh;te, : ne hadde he neuer er non. Ake sone he þou&yogh;te on ihū crist, : þat so ofte him sauede er, And cride on is holie name, : þat he were is helpe þer. l in helpe überschr. He eode forth we(l) baldeliche, : and þe innore þat he cam, we st. wel. þe hardiore him þou&yogh;te he was, : and þe betere heorte to him he nam, Ms. þeb betere. And þe braddore was is wei, : so longe forth he eode, þat it was so brod, þat þere mi&yogh;te : a carte gon for neode, And so longe þat tuei cartes mi&yogh;te : meten heom wel i nov&yogh;. þe kni&yogh;t þo wel baldeliche : ase a maister forth him drou&yogh;. þe feondes stoden bi neþe þe brugge : and sei&yogh;en him so faste gon, And for al þe wo þat heo him duden : ne ouer cam him nou&yogh;t on; Heom þou&yogh;te, it was al for nou&yogh;t : after him to honten more. Grisliche heo gonne forto &yogh;eolle : ant to crie and wepe suyþe sore, Ms. goune. þat for þe &yogh;eollinge þat heo maden : he hadde wel more fere, þane of al þe pine þat he hadde er, : so lodlich was þe bere. Heore Oules heo nomen and heore hokes, : and toward him casten an hei&yogh;, Ake þare nas non þat him touchi mi&yogh;te, : ne no þing come him nei&yogh;. So þat al sauf with alle Joye : ouer þis watere he him drov&yogh;, And þe feondes lefden bi hinde : with grete soruwe ant sor i nou&yogh; — In helle is heore kuynde heritage, : and elles for soþe it were wov&yogh;; — Heo leten him go &yogh;wodere he wolde, : and ne fondeden him non more, &yogh; in &yogh;wodere überschr.
